Name: michael
Line: all right jim. your quarterlies look very good. how are things at the library?

Name: jim
Line: oh, i told you. i couldn't close it. so...

Name: michael
Line: so you've come to the master for guidance? is this what you're saying, grasshopper?

Name: jim
Line: actually, you called me in here, but yeah.

Name: michael
Line: all right. well, let me show you how it's done.

Name: michael
Line: [on the phone] yes, i'd like to speak to your office manager, please. yes, hello. this is michael scott. i am the regional manager of dunder mifflin paper products. just wanted to talk to you manager-a-manger. [quick cut scene] all right. done deal. thank you very much, sir. you're a gentleman and a scholar. oh, i'm sorry. ok. i'm sorry. my mistake. [hangs up] that was a woman i was talking to, so... she had a very low voice. probably a smoker, so... [clears throat] so that's the way it's done.

Name: michael
Line: i've, uh, i've been at dunder mifflin for 12 years, the last four as regional manager. if you want to come through here... see we have the entire floor. so this is my kingdom, as far as the eye can see. this is our receptionist, pam. pam! pam-pam! pam beesly. pam has been with us for...  forever. right, pam?

Name: pam
Line: well. i don't know.

Name: michael
Line: if you think she's cute now, you should have seen her a couple of years ago. [growls]

Name: pam
Line: what?

Name: michael
Line: any messages?

Name: pam
Line: uh, yeah. just a fax.

Name: michael
Line: oh! pam, this is from corporate. how many times have i told you? there's a special filing cabinet for things from corporate.

Name: pam
Line: you haven't told me.

Name: michael
Line: it's called the wastepaper basket! look at that! look at that face.

Name: michael
Line: people say i am the best boss. they go, "god we've never worked in a place like this before. you're hilarious." "and you get the best out of us." [shows the camera his world's best boss mug] i think that pretty much sums it up. i found it at spencer gifts.

Name: dwight
Line: [singing] shall i play for you? pa rum pump um pum [imitates heavy drumming] i have no gifts for you. pa rum pump um pum [imitates heavy drumming]

Name: jim
Line: my job is to speak to clients on the phone about... uh, quantities and type of copier paper. you know, whether we can supply it to them. whether they can pay for it. and... i'm boring myself just talking about this.

Name: michael
Line: whassup!

Name: jim
Line: whassup! i still love that after seven years.

Name: michael
Line: whassup!

Name: dwight
Line: whassup!

Name: michael
Line: whass...up!

Name: dwight
Line: whassup.

Name: michael
Line: [strains, grunts] what?

Name: jim
Line: nothing.

Name: michael
Line: ok. all right. see you later.

Name: jim
Line: all right. take care.

Name: michael
Line: back to work.

Name: jan
Line: [on her cell phone] just before lunch. that would be great.

Name: michael
Line: corporate really doesn't really interfere with me at all. jan levinson gould. [walking out of his office] jan, hello.  i call her hillary rodham clinton. right? not to her face, because... well, not because i'm scared of her. because i'm not. but, um... yeah.

Name: jan
Line: alright, was there anything you wanted to add to the agenda?

Name: michael
Line: um... me no get an agenda.

Name: jan
Line: what? i'm sorry?

Name: michael
Line: i didn't get any agenda.

Name: jan
Line: well, i faxed one over to you this morning.

Name: michael
Line: really? i didn't... [looks at pam] did we get a fax this morning?

Name: pam
Line: uh, yeah, the one...

Name: michael
Line: why isn't it in my hand? a company runs on efficiency of communication, right? so what's the problem, pam? why didn't i get it?

Name: pam
Line: you put in the garbage can that was a special filing cabinet.

Name: michael
Line: yeah, that was a joke. that was a joke that was actually my brother's, and... it was supposed to be with bills and it doesn't work great with faxes.

Name: jan
Line: do you want to look at mine?

Name: michael
Line: yeah, yeah. lovely. thank you.

Name: jan
Line: ok. since the last meeting, ellen and the board have decided we can't justify a scranton branch and a stamford branch.

Name: michael
Line: ok...

Name: jan
Line: michael, don't panic.

Name: michael
Line: no, no, no, no, this is good. this is good. this is fine. excellent.

Name: jan
Line: no, no, no, michael, listen ok. don't panic. we haven't made... we haven't decided.

Name: michael
Line: all the alarm bells are kind of going... ringie-dingie-ding!

Name: jan
Line: i've spoken to josh in stamford. i've told him the same as you and it's up to either him or you to convince me that your branch can incorporate the other.

Name: michael
Line: ok. no problem.

Name: jan
Line: this does, however, mean that there is going to be downsizing.

Name: michael
Line: me no wanna hear that, jan. because downsizing is a bitch. it is a real bitch. and i wouldn't wish that on josh's men. i certainly wouldn't wish it on my men. or women, present company excluded. sorry. uh, is josh concerned about downsizing himself? not downsizing himself but is he concerned about downsizing?

Name: michael
Line: question. how long do we have to... [telephone rings] oh uh, todd packer, terrific rep. do you mind if i take it?

Name: jan
Line: go ahead.

Name: michel
Line: packman.

Name: todd packer
Line: hey, you big queen.

Name: michael
Line: oh, that's not appropriate.

Name: todd packer
Line: hey, is old godzillary coming in today?

Name: michael
Line: uh, i don't know what you mean.

Name: todd packer
Line: i've been meaning to ask her one question. does the carpet match the drapes?

Name: michael
Line: oh, my god! oh! that's... horrifying. horrible. horrible person.

Name: jan
Line: so do you think we could keep a lid on this for now? i don't want to worry people unnecessarily.

Name: michael
Line: no, absolutely. under this regime, it will not leave this office. [zips his lips] like that.

Name: phyllis
Line: so what does downsizing actually mean?

Name: stanley
Line: well...

Name: oscar
Line: you guys better update your resumes just like i'm doing.

Name: angela
Line: i bet it's gonna be me. probably gonna be me.

Name: kevin
Line: yeah, it'll be you.

Name: pam
Line: i have an important question for you.

Name: jim
Line: yes?

Name: pam
Line: are you going to angela's cat party on sunday?

Name: jim
Line: yeah, stop. that is ridiculous.

Name: michael
Line: am i going to tell them? no, i am not going to tell them. i don't see the point of that. as a doctor, you would not tell a patient if they had cancer.

Name: michael
Line: hey.

Name: ryan
Line: hey.

Name: pam
Line: this is mr. scott.

Name: michael
Line: guilty! guilty as charged!

Name: ryan
Line: ryan howard from the temp agency. daniqua sent me down to start today.

Name: michael
Line: howard, like moe howard. three stooges.

Name: ryan
Line: yup.

Name: michael
Line: watch this. this is moe. nyuck-nyuck-nyuck-nyuck-nyuck. mee! [hold hand up for a high five] ah, right here. three stooges. oh, pam. it's a guy thing, pam. i'm sort of a student of comedy. watch this. here we go. [yelling in cod german] i'm hitler. adolf hitler. [continues with cod german]

Name: pam
Line: i don't think it would be the worst thing if they let me go because then i might... i don't think it's many little girls' dream to be a receptionist. i like to do illustrations. um... mostly watercolor. a few oil pencil. um, jim thinks they're good.

Name: pam
Line: dunder mifflin. this is pam.

Name: jim
Line: sure. mr. davis, let me call you right back. yeah, something just came up. two minutes. thank you very much. dwight, what are you doing?

Name: dwight
Line: what?

Name: jim
Line: what are you doing?

Name: dwight
Line: just clearing my desk. i can't concentrate.

Name: jim
Line: it's not on your desk.

Name: dwight
Line: it's overlapping. it's all spilling over the edge. one word, two syllables. demarcation.

Name: dwight
Line: you can't do that.

Name: jim
Line: why not?

Name: dwight
Line: safety violation. i could fall and pierce an organ.

Name: jim
Line: [crosses fingers] we'll see. [dwight begins smashing pencils with his phone] this is why the whole downsizing thing just doesn't bother me.

Name: dwight
Line: downsizing?

Name: dwight
Line: downsizing? i have no problem with that. i have been recommending downsizing since i first got here. i even brought it up in my interview. i say, bring it on.

Name: pam
Line: you just still have these messages from yesterday.

Name: michael
Line: relax. everything's under control. uh, yeah. yeah. that's important. right. oh this is so important, i should run to answer it. [imitating six-million dollar man sound effect]

Name: pam
Line: what?

Name: michael
Line: come on. six-million dollar man! steve austin! actually, that would be a good salary for me, don't you think? six million dollars? memo to jan. i deserve a raise.

Name: pam
Line: don't we all?

Name: michael
Line: i'm sorry?

Name: pam
Line: nothing.

Name: michael
Line: if you're unhappy with your compensation, maybe you should take it up with hr. ok. not today, ok? pam, just be professional. [sighs]

Name: michael
Line: i think i'm a role model here. i think i garner people's respect. [imitating a pa] attention all dunder mifflin employees, please. we have a meeting in the conference room, asap.

Name: michael
Line: people i respect, heroes of mine, would be bob hope... abraham lincoln, definitely. bono. and probably god would be the fourth one. and i just think all those people really helped the world in so many ways that it's really beyond words. it's really incalculable.

Name: michael
Line: now i know there's some rumors out there and i just kind of want to set the record straight.

Name: dwight
Line: i'm assistant regional manager. i should know first.

Name: michael
Line: assistant to the regional manager.

Name: dwight
Line: ok, um, can you just tell me please? just tell me quietly. can you whisper it in my ear?

Name: michael
Line: i'm about to tell everybody. i'm just about to tell everybody.

Name: oscar
Line: can't you just tell us.

Name: dwight
Line: please, ok? do you want me to tell 'em?

Name: michael
Line: you don't know what it is. [laughs]

Name: dwight
Line: ok. you tell 'em. with my permission. permission granted.

Name: michael
Line: i don't need your permission.

Name: dwight
Line: go ahead.

Name: michael
Line: corporate has deemed it appropriate to enforce an ultimatum upon me. and jan is thinking about downsizing either the stamford branch or this branch.

Name: ryan
Line: i heard they might be closing this branch down. that's just the rumor going around. this is my first day. i don't really know.

Name: oscar
Line: yeah but michael, what if they downsize here?

Name: michael
Line: not gonna happen.

Name: stanley
Line: it could be out of your hands michael.

Name: michael
Line: it won't be out of my hands stanley, ok. i promise you that.

Name: stanley
Line: can you promise that?

Name: dwight
Line: on his mother's grave.

Name: michael
Line: no.

Name: phyllis
Line: what?

Name: michael
Line: well, yeah, it is a promise. and frankly, i'm a little insulted that you have to keep asking about it.

Name: stanley
Line: it's just that we need to know.

Name: michael
Line: i know. hold on a second. i think pam wanted to say something. pam, you had a look that you wanted to ask a question just then.

Name: pam
Line: i was in the meeting with jan and she did say that it could be this branch that gets the axe.

Name: man
Line: are you sure about that?

Name: michael
Line: well, pam maybe you should stick to the ongoing confidentiality agreement of meetings.

Name: dwight
Line: pam, information is power.

Name: stanley
Line: you can't say for sure whether it'll be us or them, can you?

Name: michael
Line: no, stanley. no, you did not see me in there with her. i said if corporate wants to come in here and interfere, then they're gonna have to go through me. right? you can go mess with josh's people, but i'm the head of this family, and you ain't gonna be messing with my chillin.

Name: jim
Line: if i left, what would i do with all this useless information in my head? you know? tonnage price of manila folders? um, pam's favorite flavor of yogurt, which is mixed berry.

Name: pam
Line: jim said mixed berries? well, yeah, he's on to me. um... [laughs]

Name: michael
Line: watch out for this guy. dwight schrute in the building. this is ryan, the new temp.

Name: ryan
Line: what's up? nice to meet you.

Name: michael
Line: introduce yourself. be polite.

Name: dwight
Line: dwight schrute, assistant regional manager.

Name: michael
Line: assistant to the regional manager. so, uh, dwight tell him about the kung fu and the car and everything.

Name: dwight
Line: uh... yeah i got a '78 280z. bought it for $1,200. fixed it up. it's now worth three grand.

Name: michael
Line: that's his profit.

Name: dwight
Line: new engine, new suspension, i got a respray. i've got some photos.

Name: dwight
Line: damn it! jim!

Name: michael
Line: ok. hold on, hold on. the judge is in session. what is the problem here?

Name: dwight
Line: he put my stuff in jell-o again.

Name: pam
Line: [laughing]

Name: dwight
Line: that's real professional thanks. that's the third time and it wasn't funny the first two times either jim.

Name: dwight
Line: it's ok here, but people sometimes take advantage because it's so relaxed. i'm a volunteer sheriff's deputy on the weekends. and you cannot screw around there. that's sort of one of the rules.

Name: michael
Line: what is that?

Name: dwight
Line: that is my stapler.

Name: michael
Line: no, no, no. do not take it out. you have to eat it out of there, because there are starving people in the world [turns to camera] which i hate, and it is a waste of that kind of food.

Name: dwight
Line: ok you know what, you can be a witness. [points to ryan] can you reprimand him?

Name: jim
Line: how do you know it was me?

Name: dwight
Line: it's always you. are you going to discipline him or not?

Name: michael
Line: discipline. kinky! [laughs] all right, here's the deal you guys. the thing about a practical joke is you have to know when to start and as well as when to stop.

Name: dwight
Line: yeah.

Name: michael
Line: and yeah, jim this is the time to stop putting dwight's personal effects into jell-o.

Name: jim
Line: ok. dwight, i'm sorry, because i have always been your biggest flan.

Name: michael
Line: [laughing] nice. that's the way it is around here. it just kind of goes round and round.

Name: ryan
Line: you should've put him in custardy.

Name: michael
Line: hey! yes! new guy! he scores.

Name: dwight
Line: ok, that's great. i guess what i'm most concerned with is damage to company property. that's all.

Name: michael
Line: pudding. pudding... i'm trying to think of another dessert to do.

Name: jim
Line: do you like going out at the end of the week for a drink?

Name: pam
Line: yeah.

Name: jim
Line: that's why we're all going out. so we can have an end-of-the-week-drink.

Name: pam
Line: so when are we going out?

Name: jim
Line: tonight, hopefully.

Name: pam
Line: ok. yeah.

Name: roy
Line: hey, man.

Name: jim
Line: what's going on?

Name: roy
Line: hey, baby.

Name: pam
Line: hey.

Name: pam
Line: roy's my fiance. we've been engaged about three years. we were supposed to get married in september but i think we're gonna get married in the spring.

Name: pam
Line: do you mind if i go out for a drink with these guys?

Name: roy
Line: no, no. come on. let's get out of here and go home.

Name: pam
Line: ok. i'm gonna be a few minutes. so it's only twenty past five. i still have to do my faxes.

Name: jim
Line: you know what? you should come with us. because you know we're all going out and it could be a good chance for you to see what people are like outside the office. i think it could be fun.

Name: roy
Line: it sounds good. seriously, we've gotta get going.

Name: jim
Line: yeah, yeah.

Name: jim
Line: um... what's in the bag?

Name: roy
Line: just tell her i'll talk to her later.

Name: jim
Line: no, definitely. all right, dude. awesome. will do.

Name: jim
Line: do i think i'll be invited to the wedding? [scratches head]

Name: michael
Line: so have you felt the vibe yet? we work hard, we play hard. sometimes we play hard when we should be working hard. right? i guess the atmosphere that i've created here is that i'm a friend first, and a boss second... and probably an entertainer third. [knock at door] just a second. right? oh, hey do you like the jamie kennedy experiment? punk'd and all that kind of stuff?

Name: ryan
Line: yeah.

Name: michael
Line: you are gonna be my accomplice. just go along with it, ok?

Name: ryan
Line: all right.

Name: michael
Line: just follow my lead. don't pimp me, all right? come in. so, uh, corporate just said that i don't want to...

Name: pam
Line: you got a fax.

Name: michael
Line: oh, thank you. pam, can you come in here for a sec. just have a seat. i was gonna call you in anyway. you know ryan. as you know, there is going to be downsizing. and you have made my life so much easier in that i am going to have to let you go first.

Name: pam
Line: what? why?

Name: michael
Line: why? well, theft and stealing.

Name: pam
Line: stealing? what am i supposed to have stolen?

Name: michael
Line: post-it notes.

Name: pam
Line: post-it notes? what are those worth, 50 cents?

Name: michael
Line: 50 cents, yeah. if you steal a thousand post-it notes at 50 cents apiece, and you know,  you've made a profit... margin. you're gonna run us out of business, pam.

Name: pam
Line: are you serious?

Name: michael
Line: yeah. i am.

Name: pam
Line: i can't believe this. i mean i have never even stolen as much as a paperclip and you're firing me.

Name: michael
Line: but the best thing about it is that we're not going to have to give you any severance pay. because that is gross misconduct and... just clean out your desk. i'm sorry.

Name: michael
Line: [pam starts crying] you been x'd punk! [laughing] surprise! it's a joke. we were joking around. see? ok. he was in on it. he was my accomplice. and it was kind of a morale booster thing. and we were showing the new guy around, giving him the feel of the place. so you... god, we totally got you.

Name: pam
Line: you're a jerk.

Name: michael
Line: i don't know about that.

Name: michael
Line: what is the most important thing for a company? is it the cash flow? is it the inventory? nuh-uh. it's the people. the people. my proudest moment here was not when i increased profits by 17% or when i cut expenses without losing a single employee. no, no, no, no, no. it was a young guatemalan guy. first job in the country, barely spoke english. he came to me, and said, "mr. scott, would you be the godfather of my child?" wow. wow. didn't work out in the end. we had to let him go. he sucked.

Name: pam
Line: hey.

Name: jim
Line: hey.

Name: jim
Line: how are things?

Name: pam
Line: good. i thought you were going out for a drink with...

Name: jim
Line: oh no, i just decided not to. how's your headache?

Name: pam
Line: it's better, thanks.

Name: jim
Line: good. good.

Name: pam
Line: yeah.

Name: jim
Line: that's great

Name: jim
Line: yeah?

Name: pam
Line: um... are you...

Name: jim
Line: am i walking out?

Name: pam
Line: yes.

Name: jim
Line: yes, i... do you want to...

Name: pam
Line: yeah.

Name: jim
Line: great. let me just...

Name: jim
Line: [car horn honking] oh, roy.

Name: pam
Line: yeah. listen, have a nice weekend.

Name: jim
Line: yeah, definitely. you too. enjoy it. [looks at camera] you know what, just come here.

Name: dwight
Line: dwight schrute. my father's name, also dwight schrute. my grandfather's name, dweide schrude, amish. that's my family. i don't know where they came, the amish, came from originally. uh, amland.

Name: michael
Line: [holding up a dundie and pretending it is talking] hello. i'm michael scott. i'm the best boss in the world.

Name: jim
Line: my name is jim halpert and i am a sales rep, which is a very important job. um, without me dozens literally dozens of small businesses would go paperless.  they would have to write on their hands, or bed sheets, or who knows you know. total chaos, total chaos. i mean or they could get their paper somewhere else. staples maybe. i don't know.

Name: michael
Line: pam! pam-pam! pam has been with us for...  forever. right, pam?

Name: pam
Line: i guess.

Name: michael
Line: yeah, at one time or another every guy in the office has sprayed on pam.

Name: pam
Line: what?

Name: michael
Line: messages?

Name: dwight
Line: people respond to the human touch and that's what i give them. i can look at a client and i can say, "hello, how are you? how's business been going?" and we can go back and forth for sometime and uh, then i'll say, how much, how many reams do you want?" and they'll order it and then i'll take care of all the sales. i'll make sure that they get that paper. and they appreciate that.

Name: michael
Line: ah, right here. three stooges. high five. [michael and ryan high five] oh, pam. it's a guy thing, pam. [camera cuts to pam then back to michael] now, who was the one before curly?

Name: ryan
Line: uh, shemp.

Name: michael
Line: curly? very good. curly joe derita.

Name: ryan
Line: just curly. joe derita was different.

Name: michael
Line: well, comedy's kinda my thing. watch this, here's curly joe. mmm. me, me, me, me, me, me. me, me, me, me, me, me. oh, i forgot. here we go. [yelling in cod german] i'm hitler. right. [continues with cod german] me, me, me, me, me, me. curly joe hitler. [laughs]

Name: michael
Line: all these people are walking around and they're happy and their lives are just going along, ignorance is bliss. but if they knew what was lurking on the other side of that fence that furry monster. [imitating monster] "i'm gonna get you, downsizing." no. they wouldn't... they'd freak. and i'm not going to play god. they look to me for support. and they look to me for guidance and leadership. and i think if i could lie to them and it serves them, then that's what i'm going to do.

Name: michael
Line: so this is our sales staff. they are the ones who are making calls and making us lots of money. [comes to a screeching halt and laughs] this is accounting. the numbers dudes. do not let the job description fool you, they are all completely crazy. especially that guy, he is a mental patient. [camera zooms in on kevin] not literally of course, that wouldn't work. the last place you'd want somebody like that is accounting. [hides behind office plant] "very interesting, but stupid." artie johnson. it's a crazy place.

Name: angela
Line: my name is angela and um, i'm in charge of the accounting department. there are three of us, kevin and oscar.

Name: oscar
Line: it's my job to keep the books in order. and, um, i... i'm, uh, immediately below my supervisor.

Name: angela
Line: oscar, how do i describe him. he's like a stapler. do i need a stapler? yes. but, i'm still the one that has to push it down.

Name: oscar
Line: there's a lot of anxiety. i don't want to get laid off. this place is like five minutes from my house.

Name: kevin
Line: i don't wanna be laid off. this is a good job for me. 'cause i need my nights free. i'm in a band.

Name: angela
Line: not very worried about downsizing right now. because, uh, i think you've met kevin and um...

Name: oscar
Line: can i just say one thing? um, my friend is jewish, art geller. and a couple of years ago he, um, showed me how you can plant a tree in israel, so i planted a tree. so... you know 'cause... yeah we work in paper. well, you know, i try to give back.

Name: angela
Line: i have a lot of cat figurines on my desk. i think cats, really, are old souls. and, uh, phyllis thinks so too.

Name: michael
Line: what you don't know... well, it can hurt you, but if you don't know it won't hurt you. then, you can just be happy for a little while at least.

Name: michael
Line: what's that?

Name: pam
Line: wired.

Name: michael
Line: oh, john belushi. what a crazy guy. phew, freaked myself out this morning.

Name: pam
Line: oh, yeah.

Name: michael
Line: yeah. i thought i found a lump. i checked the, uh... i check the jewels every month. this time... you know, it's a little different. it was fine. it was fine. but freaky, man, you know. testicular cancer, god. cancer, whoa testicles. so... what's, um... what you eating?

Name: pam
Line: smoked turkey.

Name: michael
Line: oh, place around the corner. nice. all right. see you later.

Name: michael
Line: do i need to speak up? [grabs boom microphone] hello.

Name: documentary crew member
Line: [boom microphone drops into the camera shoot] can you move it out? can you move it? is that all right? can you make that work?

Name: dwight
Line: that's fine.

Name: documentary crew member
Line: [new take] no, you don't even need ... that's fine. we'll keep it...

Name: dwight
Line: i'm sorry it makes me nervous.

Name: documentary crew member
Line: understood, but it is what we need to capture what you're saying as clearly as possible.

Name: dwight
Line: i understand. it's in a blind spot because i'm trained in several martial arts and one of them, uh, includes, uh, an awareness that the masters bring, uh, of anything on all sides of you. it could be behind you or whatever. this is directly in a blind spot, so i'm trained to respond negatively to something right above my head. [new take] this now i have an eye on. you see, it's on my periphery and if i needed to block it, attack it, stop it somehow. [does a martial arts move with his hands] i could come right out. i mean, i know you're doing your job, but... documentary crew member: [talking over dwight] it's...

Name: dwight

Line: jim.  lots of e-mails to amazon, lots of wasted computer space.  alright, let's get back to work.

Line: uh, yeah, i guess.

Line: what's going on, michael.  talk to me.

Line: i don't know, same old stuff.  same old.  boss just been ridin' my ass.

Line: oh no! jan!?  what's goin' on?

Name: michael
Line: i don't wanna talk about it.  i just wanna hang out, just be one of the guys.

Name: dwight
Line: the most important one of the guys.

Name: michael
Line: that's not the point.

Name: dwight
Line: that's exactly the point.  you've hit a slump. it happens to the best of us.  you just have to remember, you know-

Name: michael
Line: yeah.

Name: dwight
Line: where you come from, and who you are.

Name: michael
Line: ok.

Name: dwight
Line: you know, you have worked so hard for this.  you are the boss; you can buy and sell us with just a snap of your little finger.

Name: michael
Line: ok yes, i would never do that.

Line: yeah, no one can snap with their little finger.

Name: michael
Line: ha.

Name: dwight
Line: jim, this is hardly the time.

Name: michael
Line: no, this is completely the time, this is perfect time.  this is just guys gently ribbing each other, it's what it's all about, just hangin' out.  enjoying friends, all being the same.  worker bees.

Name: dwight
Line: and their king bee.

Name: michael
Line: no, just bees, just bees hanging out, buzzing around.

Name: dwight
Line: master bee.

Name: michael
Line: i'm not a master bee.

Name: dwight
Line: queen bee.

Name: michael
Line: i'm just a bee, dwight, ok, just a bee, just buzzin'.

Name: pam
Line: hi!

Name: roy
Line: hey babe.  hey, how are you!?

Name: pam
Line: good.

Name: roy
Line: you look good.

Name: pam
Line: thank you.

Name: roy
Line: hey, um, i was wondering if it'd be ok if i go to lonny's poker game tonight.  i promise, it'll be like the last time for a while.

Name: pam
Line: we were supposed to go to the barbeque at jim's house.

Name: roy
Line: oh, man.  um, could you go without me? make something up, say i like, ate something, or...

Name: pam
Line: uhh...

Name: roy
Line: huh, huh?  you're the best.  you're the best!

Name: pam
Line: i might be late.

Name: roy
Line: ok, don't wake me up cause i'm playing ball in the morning.

Name: pam
Line: ok.

Name: roy
Line: alright, bye. [pam looks around the office]

Name: pam
Line: [to the cameraman] did i miss anything?

Name: michael
Line: five o'clock.  time to go get my improv on. [drinks]  little bit of the comedy juice.  mmm.  alright, see if you can guess what this is. [roars and flails his arms]  that is a dinosaur getting ready to go to improv class.  just a taste of the improv.

Name: michael
Line: i need to know... who shot johnson!

Name: mary-beth
Line: uh, president johnson.  um-

Name: michael
Line: shut up!

Name: mary-beth
Line: ok.

Name: michael
Line: i have a right mind to shoot you right in the head.

Name: mary-beth
Line: i, i killed him. you're right! it was me!

Name: michael
Line: just shut up!  i don't wanna hear anything more from you.

Name: improv teacher
Line: no, listen to what she's saying.

Name: mary-beth
Line: alright, i'll be quiet if we can make some kind of deal.  a deal?

Name: michael
Line: pow! pow! pow! pow!  no deal.  not with michael scarn, fbi.  michael scarn doesn't make deals.  michael scarn shoots and then asks questions later. [blows on his fake gun]

Name: improv teacher
Line: good, good.

Name: michael
Line: she was kind of tripping me up, cause she was, um, i was trying to get something going, when i was over her with the gun, and she like kept changing the story.

Name: mary-beth
Line: i don't think... he was saying-

Name: michael
Line: well, you kept-

Name: mary-beth
Line: he kept saying "shut up"-

Name: michael
Line: going into nuclear something; that's not where the scene was going.

Name: mary-beth
Line: i-

Name: bill
Line: it goes wherever.

Name: michael
Line: well, it goes, it goes in the best direction, and that was not the best direction.

Name: mary-beth
Line: i felt like he was ordering me around, cause he-

Name: michael
Line: well, he, michael scarn, that character, orders people around, and that's, you should of just gone-

Name: improv teacher
Line: all your characters order people around though, and-

Name: michael
Line: well...

Name: improv teacher
Line: there's stronger choices.

Name: michael
Line: i don't think there's any stronger choice than being a really strong character.

Name: mary-beth
Line: we've seen you do that character before though.  i mean, you know, that's cool.

Name: michael
Line: well, it's, like, well, it's, you know, when refine it, refine a character down to its essence,  that's...

Name: mary-beth
Line: like jim carrey or something.

Name: michael
Line: exactly, thank you.

Name: mary-beth
Line: right, well i wasn't saying that-

Name: michael
Line: i appreciate that.

Name: mary-beth
Line: nah, i know, i just meant that... he shot me, i just-

Name: michael
Line: or ryan stiles, something like that.

Name: mary-beth
Line: yeah, ya know maybe, he made me get on the ground, and i didn't feel safe in this game.

Name: michael
Line: you shouldn't have been, 'cause you were dealing with michael scarn.  that was exactly what i was hoping to achieve, so that is probably the best thing you could have said, that's a compliment.

Name: improv teacher
Line: you succeeded.

Name: michael
Line: good work.

Name: mary-beth
Line: yeah.

Name: jim
Line: and in this room here, if you look closely, you will find out a few clues about who lives here.  um, he likes biking, obviously, and uh, what else?  uh, he likes tour guides, i guess.  and if you're very perceptive, you'll notice that he didn't do a great job of cleaning his room [kicks water bottle under bed].  ok, and uh, that's the tou-

Name: ryan
Line: and he's really into penguins or something?

Name: jim
Line: um, thank you, ryan, uh, i don't know, i think i made the mistake one day of telling someone that i like penguins, and here we are.

Name: phyllis
Line: oh, i'm sorry.  i gave you a penguin.

Name: jim
Line: and that's why it's on my desk, phyllis; it means a lot to me, and now that i know it was from you, it means even more.  moving on!  uh, ok, so that's the end of the tour for now, and if you liked it please tell your friends: "whenever you're in scranton, visit casa de la halpert".

Name: improv teacher
Line: ok, for the next exercise, let's everyone pair up.[everyone picks a partner] and everyone got somebody?  ok, good. [michael is partner-less] uh, ok, uh, why don't you go out in the hallway and go through all the rules in your head.  ok, you take a break and sort of run through the rules in your head.  ok, stay there.

Name: michael
Line: i'll just throw out some suggestions.

Name: improv teacher
Line: ok, you guys wanna start? [to michael]  don't throw out any-

Name: michael
Line: they're in a whorehouse.

Name: improv teacher
Line: suggestions.

Name: michael
Line: and he's a proctologist. [to teacher] what?

Name: improv teacher
Line: we don't need a suggestion for this one; it's gonna come from them. [to other students] it's a game called "yes, and?" and uh, you will say the first sentence.  and uh, you're telling a story-

Name: michael
Line: first sentence is: "i'm a proctologist".

Name: improv teacher
Line: we're not gonna get a suggestion for this one, it's gonna come from them. [to students] ok, you're gonna say the first sentence and then she will say yes to that and then she'll add something to the story, like you're telling a story. [looks at michael and then students]  oh yeah, what was he doing?  ok, why don't you take a break?  since you don't have a partner.

Name: michael
Line: alright, i'm ready here.

Name: improv teacher
Line: ok.

Name: kevin
Line: why don't you turn it up? [ryan moves to turn up the grill]  uh! not so fast... fire guy.  think we need some more heat, fire guy?  hey, fire guy, maybe we should burn jim's house down.

Name: ryan
Line: that's really funny.

Name: kevin
Line: hey, kelly; i called him fire guy.

Name: kelly
Line: good one, kev.

Name: kevin
Line: yeah... hey stanley-

Name: ryan
Line: he called me fire guy.

Name: stanley
Line: oh, good one. [laughs]

Name: kevin
Line: it never gets old.

Name: ryan
Line: never gets old.

Name: dwight
Line: go. get the door.

Name: michael
Line: here we are.

Name: dwight
Line: go. push!

Name: michael
Line: oh god.

Name: dwight
Line: push!

Name: michael
Line: no, no, turn it around.

Name: dwight
Line: really shove it.

Name: michael
Line: you'll break it.

Name: dwight
Line: shove it through! break it!

Name: michael
Line: you shove it. shove it back! here we go. don't break the branches, dwight.

Name: michael
Line: all right.

Name: dwight
Line: i got a splinter.

Name: michael
Line: well, suck it up. we all have problems. hey, everybody, look what we have! [laughs] nice, huh?

Name: dwight
Line: i've got it leveraged. push. straight up.

Name: michael
Line: on three. ready? big, one, two, three.

Name: dwight
Line: one, two, three. [they push the tree up and it breaks through a ceiling tile.]

Name: michael
Line: merry christmas!

Name: michael
Line: did it work?

Name: michael
Line: a, that's what she said, and b, i wanted it to be impressive. the biggest day of the year deserves the biggest tree of the year.

Name: kevin
Line: but what are we going to do with this hacked off part?

Name: michael
Line: well, that is a perfectly good mini-tree, kevin. and we are going to sell that to charity. that's what christmas is all about.

Name: jim
Line: so this year, for the first time ever, i got pam in secret santa. and i got her this teapot, which i know she really wants, so she can make tea at her desk. but i'm also going to stuff it with some inside jokes. like, this is my high school yearbook photo. she saw it at the party, and it really makes her laugh. not sure why. what else .. ooh. this is a hot sauce packet. she put this on a hot dog a couple years ago because she thought it was ketchup. and it was really funny, so i kept the other two. [holds up a miniature pencil] this would take a little too long to explain, so i won't. and this is the card. because christmas is the time to tell people how you feel.

Name: angela
Line: is there anything we're missing? phyllis, you got the lights?

Name: phyllis
Line: yes, i got those cute little ones. [angela looks at her disapprovingly] do you think i should have gotten the big ones?

Name: angela
Line: we'll see.

Name: ryan
Line: angela drafted me into the party planning committee. her memo said that we need to prepare for every possible disaster. which to me seems excessive.

Name: michael
Line: [comes into the conference room in a santa hat and beard]  merry christmas! ho, ho, ho, [points to ryan] pimp. i'm kidding. what do we got, what do we got? how many plates are we getting?

Name: angela
Line: fifty.

Name: michael
Line: double it. double everything. double ice cream. double napkins. double it. on me.

Name: michael
Line: it was a tough year. i had to fire somebody this year. this party has to really rock. check it out. christmas bonus. 3,000 g's. i got this for helping save the company money. so i guess some good came out of firing devon after all. maybe i should call him and tell him that.

Name: michael
Line: i want people to cut loose. i want people making out in closets. i want people hanging from the ceilings, lamp shades on the heads. i want it to be a playboy mansion party. and also, i want you to spread the word that i will have my digital camera. and i'll be taking pictures all along the way. and the best and craziest thing that happens will be on the cover of the newsletter. incentive.

Name: pam
Line: you do realize that we can't serve liquor at the party.

Name: michael
Line: yeah, i know. damn it. stupid corporate wet blankets. like booze ever killed anybody.

Name: kevin & oscar
Line: one, two, three. [they lift and start to move a desk]

Name: dwight
Line: you guys should use a hand truck.

Name: kevin
Line: do we have one?

Name: dwight
Line: no.

Name: angela
Line: [having trouble with a plastic tablecloth as pam stands idly by] will you help me?

Name: michael
Line: no! no way! it... no.

Line: you wanna be santa?

Line: yeah.

Name: michael

Name: dwight
Line: [now wearing an elf hat and ears] okay, everybody listen up! it is time to get your presents, wrap them, and place them under the tree like so. if you do not get your present wrapped and under the tree within the next five minutes you will be disqualified from secret santa. all right? no exceptions except michael.

Name: toby
Line: i got angela. she is into these posters of babies dressed as adults. i got her one of those. i felt kind of weird buying that.

Name: oscar
Line: i got creed. and to tell you the truth, i don't know anything about creed. i know his name's creed. i know he works right over there. i think he's irish and i .. i got him this shamrock keychain.

Name: kevin
Line: i got myself for secret santa. i was supposed to tell somebody, but i didn't [smiles happily].

Line: you get something good this year?

Name: jim
Line: i think i did a pretty good job.

Name: michael
Line: yeah? who did you have?

Name: jim
Line: well, i can't tell you cause it's a secret.

Name: michael
Line: i think i got something pretty nice for my guy.

Name: jim
Line: yeah?

Name: michael
Line: i spent a lot of dough. lot of dough. wow.

Name: jim
Line: well, there's a $20 limit, right? so .. ?

Name: michael
Line: yeah. i wanted this party to be really special so i sorta went above and beyond.

Name: jim
Line: that's great. well don't tell me who it is, cause i can ..

Name: michael
Line: it was ryan. yeah. i have ryan.

Name: dwight
Line: gather round. secret santa, let's go. let's go. come on. stanley, no, i'm going to handle the cord. okay, safety reasons.

Name: stanley
Line: i know how to plug something in.

Name: dwight
Line: i want to do it.

Name: michael
Line: all right, let's count it down, like rockefeller center. ready?

Name: all
Line: three, two, one. [very dim lights come on the tree]

Name: michael
Line: not great.

Name: phyllis
Line: i'm sorry, everybody.

Name: pam
Line: i think the tree looks nice.

Name: dwight
Line: hey, i could get some flares from my car.

Name: michael
Line: no, no. shake it off, everybody. just, let's do secret santa.

Name: michael
Line: presents are the best way to show someone how much you care. it's like this tangible thing that you can point to and say, "hey, man, i love you this many dollars worth."

Name: dwight
Line: first present, oscar.

Name: oscar
Line: [rips off the wrapping] shower radio. neat.

Name: kelly
Line: oh, good, that was from me.

Name: oscar
Line: thanks, kelly. you know i was gonna get one of ..

Name: dwight
Line: okay. okay. that's enough. let's keep it moving on. jim.

Name: jim
Line: oh, cool. [opens his plastic bag]

Name: creed
Line: that's from me.

Name: jim
Line: great. where did you get it?

Name: creed
Line: i don't know. it was so long ago.

Name: jim
Line: he obviously forgot to get me something, and then he went in his closet and dug out this little number [holds up way-too-short sleeves] and then threw it in a bag.

Name: creed
Line: yep. that's exactly what happened.

Name: dwight
Line: pam.

Name: pam
Line: [opens up her present] oh, my god! thank you very much, santa, whoever you are. it's awesome.

Name: jim
Line: there's a little more to it.

Name: dwight
Line: all right, next. ryan. [tosses present]

Name: michael
Line: no, don't!

Name: ryan
Line: [unwraps present] whoa, a video ipod.

Name: michael
Line: whoa. wow. jeez. somebody really got carried away with the spirit of christmas. that was me, i got a little carried away.

Name: ryan
Line: wasn't there a $20 limit on the gift? this is 400 bucks.

Name: michael
Line: you don't know that.

Name: ryan
Line: yeah, you left the price tag on.

Name: michael
Line: i did?

Name: ryan
Line: yeah.

Name: michael
Line: what? oh, shoot. wow. okay, well, who cares? it doesn't matter what i spent. what matters is that christmas is fun, right?

Name: dwight
Line: michael.

Name: michael
Line: oh hey, for me. what is in here? [opens a handmade oven mitt] oh, come on.

Name: phyllis
Line: i knitted it for you.

Name: michael
Line: an oven mitt? okay. [walks out]

Name: michael
Line: so phyllis is basically saying, "hey michael, i know you did a lot to help the office this year but i only care about you a homemade oven mitt's worth." i gave ryan an ipod.

Name: kevin
Line: should we just keep opening up the presents?

Name: dwight
Line: we don't do anything until michael gives us further instructions.

Name: michael
Line: i got it! we are going to turn secret santa into yankee swap.

Name: jim
Line: what is yankee swap?

Name: michael
Line: one person chooses a gift. the next person can either choose a gift or steal that person's gift. if your gift gets stolen, then you can steal somebody else's gift or choose a new gift.

Name: jim
Line: i thought that was called nasty christmas.

Name: pam
Line: yeah, we call it white elephant.

Name: michael
Line: well, i call it fun!

Name: oscar
Line: why are we doing this?

Name: michael
Line: because it's better. because it's more special.

Name: angela
Line: it sounds mean.

Name: michael
Line: shut it. no, it's not. okay, just give it a shot.

Name: angela
Line: michael should have asked the party planning committee first. he's not supposed to just spring things on us out of nowhere. [starts to cry]

Name: michael
Line: okay, meredith is up first. here's the deal. you can either pick a new gift or you can steal somebody else's gift that they've already gotten, like the oven mitt.

Name: meredith
Line: i'll take the teapot.

Name: jim
Line: oh, shouldn't we ... i bought that specifically for pam.

Name: michael
Line: yankee swap! that's what makes it fun. pam, you can steal the oven mitt now.

Name: pam
Line: i'll take the ipod.

Name: ryan
Line: and i have to give it to her? i don't have a choice?

Name: dwight
Line: yes, now you can steal the oven mitt, the old shirt or the shower radio or pick a new gift.

Name: stanley
Line: [after ryan opens a new gift - a nameplate saying 'kelly'] that was meant for kelly.

Name: ryan
Line: yeah, i figured.

Name: michael
Line: i think this is going great.

Name: kelly
Line: [unwrapping the poster] yikes.

Name: toby
Line: well, it's for angela, so ..

Name: kelly
Line: that's like, the creepiest thing that i've ever seen.

Name: dwight
Line: angela, you're up.

Name: angela
Line: i'll take the poster. some people like these.

Name: kelly
Line: i will steal the ipod.

Name: michael
Line: everyone wants the ipod. it's a huge hit. it is almost a christmas miracle.

Name: michael
Line: oh, well, oscar, you little gourmand, you have the next turn.

Name: oscar
Line: i'll take the ... teapot.

Name: meredith
Line: damn it.

Name: dwight
Line: okay, moving along. meredith, let's go.

Name: meredith
Line: i really want the ipod.

Name: dwight
Line: it's already been stolen this round. pick something else.

Name: michael
Line: [holding oven mitt] i hope nobody takes this baby, cause this is great. wow, look at that fine craftsmanship. somebody really put a lot of work into that. it's beautiful.

Name: meredith
Line: i'll take the oven mitt.

Name: michael
Line: sucker! see, i wanted somebody to take it. boom! reverse psychology.

Name: michael
Line: reverse psychology is an awesome tool. i don't know if you guys know about it, but basically you make someone think the opposite of what you believe and that tricks them into doing something stupid. works like a charm.

Name: michael
Line: [opens present] "in addition to these paintball pellets, your gift includes two paintball lessons with dwight schrute."

Name: dwight
Line: you and me, michael. yes!

Name: michael
Line: who wants to take paintball lessons? how is that better than an ipod?

Name: dwight
Line: i never said it was better than an ipod.

Name: dwight
Line: michael keeps bragging about his ipod, but you know what? two paintball lessons with someone as experienced as i am is worth easily, like, 2 grand.

Name: dwight
Line: [shooting paintball gun at target] take that, saddam!

Name: michael
Line: last gift. kevin.

Name: kevin
Line: i want the foot bath.

Name: kevin
Line: that's the thing i bought myself. i'm really psyched to use it. [pauses] maybe i should have taken the ipod. oh, shoot.

Name: dwight
Line: pam, steal something or pick the final gift.

Name: pam
Line: i want the ipod.

Name: kelly
Line: damn it.

Name: jim
Line: sure you don't want the teapot?

Name: pam
Line: well, i mean, it's an ipod. but ..

Name: jim
Line: right.

Name: pam
Line: sorry, i ..

Name: jim
Line: no. no. definitely. it's ..

Name: kelly
Line: okay, well, i guess i will take that book of short stories.

Name: dwight
Line: yes! there you go. i want the teapot. gracias.

Name: jim
Line: got to be kidding me.

Name: dwight
Line: yankee swap is like machiavelli meets ... christmas.

Name: michael
Line: [after phyllis leaves suddenly] what is she so upset about?

Name: pam
Line: maybe because you hated her present so much.

Name: michael
Line: come on! i think that yankee swap was a big hit! i think it's a success and i'm the one who ended up with dwight's stupid paintball pellets.

Name: jim
Line: yeah, but, michael, the point is that we all bought gifts for specific people.

Name: stanley
Line: and you should have just bought a $20 gift like everyone else.

Name: michael
Line: well, i didn't. i got a big bonus because i fired devon, and i used the money to buy something awesome. sue me!

Name: oscar
Line: you got a bonus check?

Name: pam
Line: how much?

Name: michael
Line: it wasn't. it wasn't that much. it was $3,000.

Name: stanley
Line: all right, i'm done now.

Name: michael
Line: unbelievable. i do the nicest thing that anyone has ever done for these people and they freak out. well, happy birthday, jesus. sorry your party's so lame.

Name: liquor store clerk
Line: it comes to $166.41.

Name: michael
Line: all right, now, you're the expert. is this enough to get 20 people plastered?

Name: liquor store clerk
Line: fifteen bottles of vodka? yeah, that should do it.

Name: michael
Line: cool, cool. box it up.

Name: jim
Line: i bought this teapot for pam, and i know she really wants it. so, can i trade you for it?

Name: dwight
Line: no trades.

Name: jim
Line: come on, it's a shamrock keychain. good luck.

Name: dwight
Line: "a real man makes his own luck." billy zane. titanic.

Name: jim
Line: look, it has sentimental value, dwight. can i buy it from you?

Name: dwight
Line: no. i want it. i'm going to use it.

Name: jim
Line: you don't even drink tea.

Name: dwight
Line: true. but i get sinus infections, and sinus infections can be cured by making your tea from green tea leaf stems ..

Name: jim
Line: okay ..

Name: dwight
Line: .. and pouring it directly into your nose, like so. [demonstrates]

Name: jim
Line: to think that my gift for pam will be used for that, it's a little too much to handle.

Name: roy
Line: this is awesome.

Name: pam
Line: i know. it's totally going to change the way i work out.

Name: roy
Line: yeah, i was gonna get you one of these for christmas, and now i don't have to. i'm gonna save a ton of money.

Line: so what are you going to get me instead?

Name: roy
Line: i don't know. probably like, a sweater or something.

Name: michael
Line: uh-oh. looks like santa was a little naughty.

Name: angela
Line: what is that?

Name: michael
Line: this is christmas spirit, as in spirits, booze.

Name: meredith
Line: we can drink?

Name: toby

[michael sees it's the end of a street.] ok, umm, i think, that's either the hudson or the east, so we're back,  should be back this way. there's a lotta pressure on me right now. it's like michael jordan, in the nba finals. or, like stormin' norman schwarzkopf, and this presentation is desert storm and as soon as it's over, we will not have to deal with those iraqis anymore. let's do it.

Name: michael
Line: [video dialogue for "the faces of scranton"] life moves a little slower in scranton, pennsylvania. and that's the way we like it. because at dunder mifflin scranton, we're not just in the paper business, we're in the people business. let's meet some of the folks that make the scranton branch so special. [video shows stanley at desk] this is stanley hudson, one of our talented salesman. an african-american father of two, stanley's dedication is no doubt one of the hallmark's of the foundation of the business we're hoping to build our bases on.

Name: michael
Line: yeah, i shot a bunch of footage around the office, edited it together on my mac. i was thinking of entering it into some festivals. probably won't. you know, not what this is about.

Name: michael
Line: [video dialogue] and finally, pam beesly. look at her. look how cute. not bad at all. as the receptionist, pam is truly the gateway to our world. well, i hope this gave you a little taste of what life is like here at dunder mifflin, scranton. what it's like to walk a mile in oscar's shoes. or try on phyllis' pants.  maybe even one of angela's famous brownies. and you'll know, that you're home. [video says, "great scott!"]

Name: michael

Line: oh! abso-fruit-ly. fruit. grapes. nailed the joke. matter of time. um... and yes, it is a big speech. biggest of your life.

Name: michael
Line: speaker at the sales convention. been there, done that. went there again, did it again. two years in a row. consecutive. i just... i miss the feeling of knowing that you did a good job because someone gives you proof of it. sir, you're awesome! here's a plaque. what, a whole year has gone by and you need more proof? here's a certificate. they stopped making plaques that year.

Name: dwight

Line: listen up everyone! it is 11:23 exactly, the exact moment when you emerged from your mother's vaginal canal, so... huh?! right, have a seat. please.

Line: [grinning] ohhh, god.

Line: there is a tradition that the hebrews have of hoisting the birthday boy up on a chair.

Line: thank you.

Line: whoa whoa! alright. alright. watch it... please.

Name: dwight
Line: oscar...

Line: it wasn't me.

Name: dwight
Line: okay, that is not an eight foot sub.

Line: uh, we don't make an eight foot sub. this is eight one foot subs.

Name: dwight
Line: f. alright, what's the damage?

Name: delivery boy
Line: uh, thirty-nine sixty.

Name: dwight
Line: [pulls out wallet] thirty nine... sixty.

Name: dwight
Line: why tip someone for a job i'm capable of doing myself? i can deliver food. i can drive a taxi. i can, and do, cut my own hair. i did, however, tip my urologist, because... i am unable to pulverize my own kidney stones.

Name: dwight
Line: here they come.

Line: get in here... everybody.

Line: come and get it!

Line: the best.

Line: yes.

Line: bologna? i don't eat bologna.

Name: angela
Line: no.

Name: michael
Line: just the bread, it's fresh baked.

Name: angela
Line: no.

Name: michael
Line: mm-kay. get whatever you want. [under breath] and choke on it.

Name: michael
Line: when i was sixteen, i was supposed to go out on a date with a girl named julie. but there was another michael in the class that she apparently thought the date was with, so she went out with him, on my birthday. and, she got him a cake, at the restaurant. and it wasn't even his birthday, but i heard about it the next day in school. so... that was the worst birthday i think i ever had.

Name: jim
Line: so. we got kev some stuff. um... a party pack of m&m's, his favorite candy. a dvd of american pie 2, which is his favorite movie, and, he lent it to creed, so, i can guarantee you he won't get that back.

Name: pam
Line: sixty-nine cup of noodles.

Name: jim
Line: which we realize sounds crass, but, it... is his favorite number.

Name: pam
Line: and his favorite lunch.

Name: dwight
Line: hey temp, you know uh, we still got five feet of sandwich left [pulls ice cream cake out of freezer].

Name: ryan
Line: [making peanut butter and jelly sandwich] someone ate three feet of that thing?

Name: dwight
Line: hell, yeah. save room for ice cream cake.

Name: angela
Line: [grabs cake] oh. thank you.

Name: dwight
Line: oh. i got it.

Name: angela
Line: what are--- it's... the party planning committee.

Name: dwight
Line: [whispering] this is the most important day of the year. i can't risk anything.

Name: angela
Line: fine.

Name: dwight
Line: what about that meeting... later... to discuss finances?

Name: angela

Line: yeah, you don't?

Line: ...okay.

Line: [singing] happy birthday dear michael, [michael joins in, kevin's phone rings] happy birthday... [everyone but dwight stops] ...tooo youuuu.

Line: hello? hey.

Line: kevin? respect the birthday please.

Name: kevin
Line: no, um, no not yet. i will. bye. [hangs up] it was just stacy.

Line: are you done? ...good. okay.

Line: here we go. make a wish.

Name: michael
Line: uhhh... blow out the candle. okay. mmmm... [blows out the candles]

Line: yaoo yay! [claps]

Name: angela
Line: no one cares about your birthday. kevin's waiting to hear if he has skin cancer.

Name: michael
Line: ... aww, that... sucks, great. ... wow, that's good timing. that's... that's, sorry, that's terrible. terrible news. that's terrible... terrible news for both of us [takes cake into office and slams the door].

Name: pam
Line: [checking watch] we should probably head back.

Name: jim
Line: yeah. okay. oh. i dare you to make an announcement.

Name: pam
Line: you dare me? how old are you?

Name: jim
Line: just... quit stalling.

Name: pam
Line: [over loudspeaker, imitating darth vader] luke, this is your father. come set the table for dinner.

Name: jim
Line: such a dork.

Name: pam
Line: [loudspeaker] jim halpert? price check on fabric softener, the kind that gives you...

Name: store employee
Line: ma'am? please don't touch that. that is not a toy.

Name: pam
Line: oh i'm sorry. i'm sorry.

Name: jim
Line: how old are you?

Name: pam
Line: i hate you.

Name: toby
Line: [to kevin] honestly, is there any way you can get on your fiancee's plan? our health plan is s... just... it's terrible.

Name: michael
Line: there you are. good news. did some research. it turns out that 98% of people with skin cancer fully recover.

Name: kevin
Line: still scary.

Name: michael
Line: yeah, but it's not brain cancer. and it shouldn't stop us from having fun. you know what they say the best medicine is.

Line: well the doctor said a combination of interferon and dicarbazine.

Name: michael
Line: and laughter... also.

Line: i don't really think people are in the laughing mood.

Name: michael
Line: why are you here? i didn't even invite you to my birthday party.

Name: toby
Line: i work here.

Name: michael
Line: [mocking voice] nyeh, i work here. [to kevin] alright, well, you know what, since toby doesn't speak for everybody and i am your boss, i... think you should just go home. take the rest of the afternoon off. take a sick day.

Name: kevin
Line: if i go home now, i'll just drive myself crazy.

Name: michael
Line: well, you're pretty much driving everyone else here crazy... crazy with worry.

Name: dwight
Line: where have you been? and don't say the bathroom, 'cause i kicked in all the stalls.

Line: well that's an invasion of privacy, so, i'm going to tell michael.

Name: dwight
Line: please, don't.

Name: jim
Line: you... owe me.

Name: michael
Line: excuse me, everyone. attention please. kevin, we're going to take you to a very special place, a place that will make you happy, and a place that is far, far away from the evil sun.

Line: is this trip related in any way to your... birthday?

Name: michael
Line: how dare you sir. you are gross.

Line: i'll get someone to take it down.

Name: michael
Line: no, it's alright. it's already up. just leave it. where's kevin? come on! let's get our skate on!

Line: don't be scared! you're good! you're good!

Name: ryan
Line: whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa.

Line: think you can let go?

Line: whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa. [michael skates by]

Name: dwight
Line: yeah!

Name: pam
Line: who is that?

Line: is that michael?

Name: michael
Line: yeah, i've been pretty much skating my whole life. i thought about playing in the nhl, but, you're on the road so much. you got no time to spend with your wife and kids. and i really want a wife and kids.

Name: pam
Line: i got it.

Name: michael
Line: hey pam, all this stuff with kevin... um, it's pretty scary. and i'm thinking that uh, next time you're in the shower, you should check yourself out. you know, give yourself an exam. those things are like ticking time bags. alright? think about it.

Name: jim
Line: ...it's something to think about.

Line: i can't relax about it, you know?

Line: no, not yet.

Line: okay. well. live strong.

Line: okay, michael.

Name: michael
Line: alright.

Line: michael?

Line: yeah. carol? she sold me my condo! hey! what, is this place on the market? or...

Line: oh, these... all your kids?

Line: no just the front two.

Line: oh, hey guys. whats up? you wanna go for a ride? is that okay?

Line: sure.

Name: michael
Line: cool. alright. grab on. here we go. ready? hang on tight. alright. we are moving. we are reaaallly mooovin' now!

Line: push. good! that's great. you got it. [kevin's phone rings] excuse me.

Line: hello? yeah okay. alright. okay, i will, thanks. [hangs up] it was negative.

Name: michael
Line: oh... god... [stomps] god! [throws hockey stick and yellow paper bracelet down] we're gonna beat this, okay? we're gonna... come here [hugs kevin].

Line: well, apparently in the medicine community, negative means good. which makes absolutely no sense. in the real world community, that would... be... chaos.

Line: this is awesome. thanks, you guys.

Name: michael
Line: okay, who's this from? wowwwee, look at that! jersey!

Line: turn it around. turn it around.

Line: cool. ohh. great. from dwight.

Line: thank you... dwight. that's great. thanks.

Name: pam
Line: michael?

Name: michael
Line: yeah.

Name: pam
Line: this is from all of us.

Name: michael
Line: oh! you didn't need to do that. ...nightswept. this is... really amazing. thank you. i love it.

Name: pam
Line: michael's birthday was actually pretty cool. it was a good day. i don't know... it was a good day.

Name: jim
Line: michael's birthday. it's pretty fun to watch, actually. he gets very excited, and then he eats a lot of cake. and then he runs around the office. then he has a sugar crash in the afternoon. and then he falls asleep. and that's when we get our work done.

Name: dwight
Line: let's get the party started.

Name: michael
Line: that's not how i taught you, right? [singing] my hump, my hump, my lovely lady lump check it out [dwight imitating drumbeat]

Name: dwight
Line: michael's birthday is hard for me because he gets very excited. but he's also under a lot of pressure, which builds up until he's ready to explode. as his right-hand man, it's my job to release that pressure so that he can enjoy himself, if only for a moment.

Name: michael
Line: okay, here's the thing about bosses and employees. a good boss will say, "hey, it's my birthday. celebrate me." a great boss will say, "hey, it's my birthday. celebrate yourselves, because you are the ones who made me great, and i will acknowledge your contributions with donuts."

Name: michael
Line: good. you know, ryan, you didn't have to get me a present.

Name: ryan
Line: i won't.

Name: michael
Line: good. great.

Name: ryan
Line: okay, good. i think i'm gonna go.

Name: michael
Line: no, i think you're gonna stay.

Name: michael
Line: on my 20th birthday, my supposed best friend, sam ambrose, ditched me for his twin sister's sweet sixteen party. and that was my worst birthday. until today.

Name: kevin
Line: can you please stop staring at me? [dwight continues to stare and then walks away]

Name: dwight
Line: to think that a man's skin could turn on him. it's brilliant, 'cause you'd never expect it. most people think of their skin as an ally. [scoffs] makes me rethink having skin at all.

Name: michael
Line: [knock on door] mmm-hmm.

Name: ryan
Line: hey. i got the information.

Name: michael
Line: oh, good. okay. don't tell me, tell them.

Name: ryan
Line: [turns to camera] "the survival rate for localized melanoma is 98%."

Name: michael
Line: oh, my god. that's a piece of cake. that's a piece of cake. oh, 2%. jeez, that's good.

Name: ryan
Line: [looking at camera] "there was 7,800 deaths from melanoma in 2005."

Name: michael
Line: out of, like, 18 billion americans, so, no worry.

Name: ryan
Line: "for localized melanoma, the five-year survival rate is 98%. the survival rates for regional and..."

Name: michael
Line: those were probably misdiagnosed. i mean, anybody with a zit goes in and says, "i have cancer."

Name: ryan
Line: "the skin is the largest organ of the body."

Name: michael
Line: untrue. the heart is bigger than the skin. if you stretched the heart out, it would cover more than the entire body.

Name: angela
Line: i'm not afraid of dying. i know where i'm going. but if i were kevin, i might be terrified. gluttony.

Name: dwight
Line: kevin malone, you're next. spit that out. [kevin shoves the rest of the donut he's eating into his mouth] spit... okay, come on, let's go.

Name: jim
Line: you look cute today, dwight.

Name: dwight
Line: thanks, girl.

Name: jim
Line: so, yesterday dwight found half a joint in the parking lot. which is unfortunate because as it turns out, dwight finding drugs is more dangerous than most people using drugs.

Name: dwight
Line: let's go over some of the symptoms of marijuana use, shall we?  you tell me who this sounds like: slow moving, inattentive, dull, constantly snacking, shows a lack of motivation.

Name: kevin
Line: [nods] hey...

Name: dwight
Line: i like the people i work with generally, with four exceptions.  but someone committed a crime and i did not become a lackawanna county volunteer sheriff's deputy to make friends. and by the way, i haven't.

Name: jim
Line: [mimicking stanley] i enjoy the tangy zip of miracle whip.

Name: pam
Line: [laughs] jim does the best impressions. sometimes he'll look up at me from his desk and he'll just be someone else. like he'll go um, [makes mournful face, giggles] that's supposed to be phyllis.  i can't do it as good as he can.

Name: kelly
Line: and the guys are saying, chug, chug, chug, but i'm so small and all i'd eaten that day was one of those auntie anne pretzels from the food court so i said "is it okay if i sip it?" and they said no, but ryan seemed cool either way.

Name: dwight
Line: stop! this is not kelly kapoor story hour.  illegal drugs were consumed on company property, okay? your ass is on the line, mister!  my ass is is on the line!  now i'm going to ask you again.  what time did you go home last night?

Name: kelly
Line: six.

Name: dwight
Line: i didn't know that you were at a party on saturday night.

Name: ryan
Line: i go to a lot of parties.

Name: dwight
Line: okay, i'm gonna need to search your car.  give me you keys.

Name: ryan
Line: i am not giving you my keys.

Name: dwight
Line: don't make me do this the hard way.

Name: ryan
Line: what's the hard way?

Name: dwight
Line: i go down to the police station on my lunch break. i tell a police officer, i know several, what i suspect you may have in your car. he requests a hearing from a judge and obtains a search warrant, once he has said warrant, he will drive over here, and make you give him the keys to your car, and you will have to obey him.

Name: ryan
Line: yeah, let's do it that way.

Name: michael
Line: ry, is he bugging you? dwight, dude, you gotta take a chill pill, man. it was one joint in the parking lot. you know, you're totally harshing the office mellow.

Name: dwight
Line: i can't stop this investigation. it is my job.

Name: jim
Line: whoa. you are a volunteer.

Name: dwight
Line: i volunteered for this job.

Name: jim
Line: and that's not the same.

Name: dwight
Line: it is my duty...

Name: jim
Line: [interrupting] volunteer duty.

Name: dwight
Line: ...to investigate the crime scene. i have six more interviews to go and then i will reveal what i know.

Name: michael
Line: [fake coughing] narc!

Name: kevin
Line: [giggling]

Name: dwight
Line: if you are attempting to compliment me then you have done a very good job.

Name: michael
Line: i wasn't attempting to compliment you.

Name: dwight
Line: well, you have...

Name: michael
Line: uuf, well...

Name: dwight
Line: ...because being a narc is one of the hardest jobs that you can have...

Name: michael
Line: [shakes head] okay...

Name: dwight
Line: ...and i am very proud of being a narc.

Name: michael
Line: why don't you just cool it, cool it dwight, please, god! [to jim] dude, where's my office? [jim quietly laughs] i totally lost it, 'cause i was half-baked. smokin' doobies. doobie brothers, i was smokin' doobies with my brothers. peace out, seacrest!

Name: jim
Line: well, your office is behind you.

Name: michael
Line: thanks. m-m-munchies. who wants some munchies?

Name: ryan
Line: i don't think michael's ever done drugs. i don't know if anyone has ever offered him any.

Name: dwight
Line: oscar visited mexico when he was five to attend his great-grandmother's funeral. what does that mean to a united states law enforcement officer? he's a potential drug mule.

Name: dwight
Line: have you ever taken any illegal drugs?

Name: oscar
Line: no, i have not.

Name: dwight
Line: do you think it's possible that maybe you could have had some drugs in your system without you knowing about it?

Name: oscar
Line: what are you implying?

Name: dwight
Line: have you ever... pooped... a balloon?

Name: oscar
Line: okay. i'm done with this.

Name: dwight
Line: he sure left in a hurry.

Name: dwight
Line: i don't want to blow this. this is what all good law enforcement officers dream of. the chance to solve an actual crime.

Name: dwight
Line: do you know what this is? [pushing a photo toward her]

Name: phyllis
Line: yes, it's marijuana.

Name: dwight
Line: how do you know that?

Name: phyllis
Line: it's labeled.

Name: dwight
Line: [grabs pictures back and looks at it] dammit.

Name: creed
Line: that is northern lights cannabis indica.

Name: dwight
Line: no, it's marijuana.

Name: jim
Line: i'm just saying that you can't be sure that is wasn't you.

Name: dwight
Line: that's ridiculous, of course it wasn't me.

Name: jim
Line: marijuana is a memory loss drug, so maybe you just don't remember.

Name: dwight
Line: i would remember.

Name: jim
Line: well, how could you, if it just erased your memory?

Name: dwight
Line: that's not how it works.

Name: jim
Line: now how do you know how it works?

Name: dwight
Line: knock it off, okay, i'm interviewing you.

Name: jim
Line: no! you said that i'd be conducting the interview when i walked in here. now exactly how much pot did you smoke?

Name: dwight
Line: [opens eyes wide in total surprise]

Name: oscar
Line: so pam told me that you do a great stanley impression, i'd love to hear it.

Name: jim
Line: oh, um...[mimicking stanley] why do you keep cc'ing me on things that have nothing to do with me?  [pam and oscar laugh, stanley walks in, and oscar leaves quickly]

Name: stanley
Line: is that supposed to be me?

Name: jim
Line: oh, hey stanley. uh, i was just doing an impression.

Name: stanley
Line: i do not think that is funny.

Name: pam
Line: he does everyone in the office.

Name: stanley
Line: hmmmpt.

Name: pam/jim
Line: [in unison] i do not think that is funny.

Name: pam
Line: jinx! buy me a coke.

Name: jim
Line: oh...

Name: pam
Line: no, no, no, no talking. jim is not allowed to talk until after he buys me a coke.  those are the rules of jinx, and they are unflinchingly rigid.  [jim puts money in drink machine, selection is sold out]

Name: pam
Line: sold out? that has never happened in the history of jinx.

Name: jim
Line: [mouths] c'mon!

Name: pam
Line: sorry, that's not my problem.

Name: jim
Line: [presses drink button, looks at camera, makes jim-face]

Name: dwight
Line: i know you're innocent, but i can't look like i'm treating you any differently.

Name: angela
Line: i understand.

Name: dwight
Line: where were you yesterday after work?

Name: angela
Line: [smiles knowingly]

Name: michael
Line: uh-oh. uh-oh. who's he calling?  ratting somebody out.  narc!  narc!  kevin?

Name: kevin
Line: that is so good, michael

Name: michael
Line: remember the narc bit? [laughs] uh-oh, who's in trouble?

Name: dwight
Line: attention everyone.  drug testers are coming in a couple of hours to test everyone's urine.

Name: michael
Line: waa... what? what are you talking about?

Name: dwight
Line: company policy. if drugs are found on the premises there is automatic drug testing conducted within twenty-four hours.

Name: oscar
Line: is that true, toby?

Name: toby
Line: oh, when you sign your job application you agree to comply with random drug testing.

Name: michael
Line: two nights ago, i went to an alicia keys concert at the montage mountain performing arts center. i scored these great aisle seats. anyway, after the opening act this beautiful girl sits down next to me and i never get to meet girls with lip rings and she had one. i don't know exactly how this happened but one of her friends started passing around some stuff and they said it was clove cigarettes, and i'm sure that it was clove cigarettes. everybody in the aisle was doing it.

Name: michael
Line: okay, attention everyone the drug testing has been cancelled.  instead, i will be going around to each of you and doing a visual inspection.

Name: dwight
Line: no you can't do that.

Name: michael
Line: i can do that, it is my office.

Name: dwight
Line: no you cannot. it has to be official, and it has to be urine.

Name: michael
Line: hmmm. ha. [under his breath] alright. great.

Name: dwight
Line: kevin, what prescription drugs are you taking, besides rogaine?

Name: kevin
Line: i'm not taking rogaine.

Name: dwight
Line: angela, what about you?

Name: angela
Line: i don't take any prescription drugs.

Name: dwight
Line: you're not on anything?

Name: angela
Line: [gives dwight a knowing look]

Name: dwight
Line: good.

Name: kelly
Line: so the first time we went out to dinner, it was like, whatever, fine, but i was so nervous. so this time i wanted to be special, so i bought a new dress! [jim hunches his shoulders and grins] one of those kinds that is kinda low cut at top to show something, but not everything. [jim shakes his head no in agreement] i mean not everything, jim. [jim shakes his head in agreement] i promise, i'm not that kind of...

Name: pam
Line: hey guys, what's going on?

Name: kelly
Line: we're having the best conversation.  [jim, eyes wide, shakes his head, no]

Name: pam
Line: oh, okay.  well, michael wants to see everyone in the conference room. [jim shakes his head. seems relieved to be getting away from kelly] but you know what? we have a few minutes so you guys should definitely finish up your conversation. [jim nods his head as if to say, "gee, thanks, pam."]

Name: kelly
Line: so, i was looking so hot...

Name: michael
Line: it has come to my attention that some people here think that the use of drugs is something to laugh about.

Name: phyllis
Line: we don't feel that way.

Name: angela
Line: no, not at all.

Name: oscar
Line: you were the one joking around calling dwight a narc.

Name: michael
Line: no, uh, no. that was a test.  i was testing you, and you all failed. miserably. when i said that dwight was a narc, how many of you defended him?  how many of you said, "hey, you know what, he's right? what he's doing is protecting this office from the evils of drugs."

Name: dwight
Line: thank you, michael.

Name: michael
Line: i am ridiculously anti-drug. so anti-drug that i am above suspicion in any way that involves suspicion, or testing of any kind.

Name: michael
Line: drugs ruin lives people. drugs destroy careers. take cheech and chong everybody knows that cheech and chong are funny, but just imagine how funny they would be if they didn't smoke pot.  i want everybody to take a look to their left. now i want everybody to take a look to their right. one of those people will be dead from drug use at some point in their lives. this year more people will use cocaine than will read a book to their children.

Name: stanley
Line: where did you get these facts?

Name: michael
Line: are these facts scaring you, or are they not?

Name: stanley
Line: they are not.

Name: michael
Line: do you think that smoking drugs is cool? do you think that doing alcohol is cool?

Name: stanley
