Line: okay, i will... i'm not feeling very well right now though. my stomach hurts, so i may be going home early today, but...

Name: toby
Line: you know, michael, sometimes my daughter's stomach hurts when there's a mean girl at school...

Name: michael
Line: well sometimes my stomach hurts when you come into my office, so it's probably psychological.

Name: andy
Line: you meet a lot of ladies driving an xterra, because you pull up to a stoplight, and look over and there's an xterra next to you. they're always driven by chicks, so there's your icebreaker.

Name: dwight
Line: [kicks the car] unh! scratch.

Name: andy
Line: that's a racing stripe.

Name: dwight
Line: uh, bumper's sagging.

Name: andy
Line: mmm, i doubt that very much.

Name: dwight
Line: this car's crap. i will buy it for next to nothing.

Name: andy
Line: how next to?

Name: dwight
Line: well, here are your options: you can sell it for parts, drive it off a cliff... you can donate it to a person that you'd like to see die in a car crash, or, you can sell it to me, and i'll use it as i would a wagon on my farm. it will be towed by a donkey.

Name: andy
Line: i have to pick one of those?

Name: dwight
Line: yes.

Name: andy
Line: can you go over those options again?

Name: dwight
Line: you know what? you knock $1500 of the price right now, and i will take it off your hands. it's gotta be now.

Name: andy
Line: well i have the, the blue book value...

Name: dwight
Line: seal the deal. let's do it. let's do this thing. three, two, one--

Name: andy
Line: can i think about it?

Name: dwight
Line: five, four, three, two...

Name: andy
Line: let me think about it--

Name: dwight
Line: now. now. now.

Name: andy
Line: let me think about it--

Name: dwight
Line: say it. do it. now.

Name: andy
Line: i'm thinking about it--

Name: dwight
Line: do it now.

Name: andy
Line: thinking--

Name: dwight
Line: do it. shake my hand. you will sell me this car. shake my hand.

Name: andy
Line: yeah. all right!

Name: stanley
Line: what.

Name: michael
Line: i, uh, see that you... gave me that form that i asked you to give me, stanley the manly, so thank you for that. i guess we are back to normal.

Name: stanley
Line: what are you talking about?

Name: michael
Line: well, you know, uh, the thing that you said earlier, that you didn't mean, um, and that i forgive you for. the whole thing's silly, isn't it? friends don't need to apologize to friends as far as i'm concerned, so we are cool.

Name: stanley
Line: i am not going to apologize to you.

Name: stanley
Line: it's like i used to tell my wife, i do not apologize unless i think i'm wrong, and if you don't like it you can leave. and i say the same thing to my current wife, and i'll say it to my next one too.

Name: dwight
Line: jim is in charge of stanley only in sales-related matters, hence the green line--green for money-sales, get it?

Name: michael
Line: uh huh...

Name: dwight
Line: there is this yellow zigzag that does give ryan the authority to discipline stanley...

Name: michael
Line: great

Name: dwight
Line: however, in so doing, it zigs past your name, hence zagging you and making you appear weak. thus the yellow color. yellow for cowardly.

Name: michael
Line: what's the pink?

Name: dwight
Line: menstrual cycles.

Name: michael
Line: ok... is there anybody up here, anybody at all, that can deal with this?

Name: dwight
Line: you.

Name: michael
Line: other than me.

Name: dwight
Line: well, there is the emergency disaster mode for the org chart. this gives me full authority over every single person in the office.

Name: michael
Line: i never said you could do that.

Name: dwight
Line: all you have to do it say it.

Name: dwight
Line: just say it.

Name: michael
Line: okay, i will think about it.

Name: dwight
Line: say it. just do it. don't think, say it. do it. five, four, three, two... do it. give me control. michael... i promise to give authority back to you when this crisis is over. do it, michael. do it. hey, this office needs a strong man. say it.

Name: michael
Line: no.

Name: dwight
Line: so... all right, well, you're gonna have to deal with this yourself.

Name: kevin
Line: hey pam, i really like your glasses.

Name: pam
Line: oh, thanks.

Name: kevin
Line: all the girlfriends that i've ever had have worn glasses.

Name: pam
Line: oh, okay...

Name: kevin
Line: yeah, it's kind of a turn-on for me actually...

Name: pam
Line: i should probably get back to...

Name: kevin
Line: like librarians.

Name: pam
Line: entering the....

Name: kevin
Line: could you just say, "these are due back thursday"?

Name: pam
Line: no. [kevin leaves; pam takes off her glasses; phone rings] dunder mifflin, this is pam. okay, go ahead. [puts a notepad close to her face and writes message]

Name: creed
Line: a lot of jazz cats are blind, but they can play the piano like nobody's business. i'd like to put the piano in front of pam without her glasses and see what happens. i'd also like to see her topless.

Name: darryl
Line: mike.

Name: michael
Line: hey.

Name: darryl
Line: i'm very busy here, man.

Name: michael
Line: darryl, [clears throat] have you ever been in a gang?

Name: darryl
Line: why?

Name: michael
Line: it's an advice question, and if you don't wanna talk about it, i completely understand. it's, um...

Name: darryl
Line: no, no, no...

Name: michael
Line: i know, it's very, very personal...

Name: darryl
Line: no, um... i have.

Name: michael
Line: i knew it. okay, who we talking about here? crips? bloods?

Name: darryl
Line: both.

Name: michael
Line: god.

Name: darryl
Line: yeah them, and the latin kings... the warriors...

Name: michael
Line: okay.

Name: darryl
Line: newsies.

Name: michael
Line: okay, so dig this: you're on the street, and one of your gang disses you.

Name: darryl
Line: oh my goodness.

Name: michael
Line: yeah, right, so what do you do to get them to make it right?

Name: darryl
Line: well see, um... in the gang world, we use something called fluffy fingers.

Name: michael
Line: what is that?

Name: darryl
Line: that's when somebody really gets in your face, you know, you just... start tickling them.

Name: michael
Line: really?

Name: darryl
Line: yeah, and then he starts tickling you. you know, pretty soon you're laughing and hugging. before you know it, you've forgotten the whole thing. ya'll can just go to church together... get an ice cream cone.

Name: michael
Line: i would've never thought that gangs would be tickling each other.

Name: darryl
Line: well, it's effective.

Name: ryan
Line: [to toby] i think it's self-explanatory. [to jim] hey, jim, come here for a second. can you answer me something, as, as a true eagles fan?

Name: jim
Line: oh boy...

Name: ryan
Line: how do you live with a franchise this bad?

Name: jim
Line: on a wing and a prayer, mostly.

Name: ryan
Line: alright, whatever you say. uh, listen, while i have you here with toby, i need to give you a formal warning about your job performance.

Name: jim
Line: a formal warning... [chuckles]

Name: ryan
Line: it's actually not a joke. i know how you spend your time here, and i know how little you care about your job. and honestly if you spent as much time selling as you do goofing around with dwight and hanging out at reception, we wouldn't be having this conversation.

Name: jim
Line: [stammers] i'm sorry, is, is this because i talked to wallace about your website? because i really didn't mean to go over your head.

Name: ryan
Line: this is nothing to do with that, alright? i always appreciate constructive criticism about my job performance. i thrive on it.

Name: jim
Line: i'm sorry, then do you mind explaining a little better? cause i'm not sure what's really...

Name: ryan
Line: woah, don't get all defensive, alright? it's just a warning. if you want the details, toby can provide them. you take it easy, alright?

Name: toby
Line: i'd say all the goofing around at pam's desk, and, and hanging out with pam, has finally caught up to him... w-with pam

Name: pam
Line: hey, what happened? what did ryan want?

Name: jim
Line: oh we were just... talking about, bureaucratic stuff...

Name: pam
Line: because you're very important?

Name: jim
Line: yeah...

Name: dwight
Line: [washing the xterra] rocka doopa deepa do pow! shacka do do! oh! what's dwight up to? oh probably nothing. racka do do dee do-do do-do! sha-ka!

Name: andy
Line: what the hell is this all about? [holds up flier] you're flipping my car for profit.

Name: dwight
Line: it's my car now.

Name: andy
Line: i gave you a deal... based on what you said to me.

Name: dwight
Line: yeah, well... seller beware. now if you'll excuse me, i've got to monitor a three-way bidding war for my car on ebay.

Name: dwight
Line: i've got a madlib for you: a stupid, idiotic, numbskull named andy bernard sold his xterra to a smart and capable man named dwight. this is shaping up to be an awesome day for dwight.

Name: michael
Line: okay, everybody, shh! so, earlier today, stanley sassed me, and toby gave me some suggestions on how to discipline him. they did not work, obviously, because they were stupid, so i am now going to fake fire him.

Name: pam
Line: what does that mean?

Name: michael
Line: it's like a mock execution.

Name: jim
Line: that's not a good idea.

Name: michael
Line: yes it is a good idea. it's the only possible solution i have left.

Name: toby
Line: well, you can actually fire him.

Name: michael
Line: no, okay... i've had enough of you.

Name: oscar
Line: why are you telling us this?

Name: michael
Line: because i want you to behave as if i'm actually firing him, oscar, okay?

Name: kevin
Line: michael, if you hadn't told us this, then we would've thought that you were actually firing him.

Name: michael
Line: i'm not firing him. i'm not, i need you to act like i am firing him. just, what i'm going to do, is i'm going to pretend that i am firing him, and i need you to act like i am firing him. do you get that? do you get it? i'm teaching him a lesson. he needs to learn humility, alright? that's all i'm, okay, here he comes. let's just... play act. [stanley enters the room] stanley, may i talk to you for a second?

Name: michael
Line: stanley hudson, you are fired.

Name: stanley
Line: are you serious?

Name: michael
Line: i am serious, we are all serious. you are fired like a heart attack.

Name: stanley
Line: you're firing me over three words. have you lost your mind? do you think i'm gonna let you do this to me?

Name: michael
Line: hmm.

Name: stanley
Line: i've watched you screw up this office for ten years, and i'm filing a lawsuit, and i'm gonna tell them about every stupid thing you've ever done up in this office.

Name: michael
Line: alright alright, okay, you know what? now you know how i feel. this was a fake firing. lesson learned. good work, everybody. very nice.

Name: stanley
Line: so i'm not fired.

Name: michael
Line: that's it. and uh... do you have anything to say to me?

Name: stanley
Line: oh yes, i do. you are out of your damn, little pea-sized, mind. what is wrong with you? do you have any sense? at all?

Name: michael
Line: okay...

Name: stanley
Line: do you have any idea how to run an office?

Name: michael
Line: yes.

Name: stanley
Line: every day you do something stupider than you did the day before.

Name: michael
Line: that's not-

Name: stanley
Line: and i think, "there's no possible way--

Name: michael
Line: all right, all right...

Name: stanley
Line: he can top that."

Name: michael
Line: okay.

Name: stanley
Line: but what do you do?! you find a way, dammit, to top it! you are professional idiot!

Name: michael
Line: hey, stop it! okay, everybody out.

Name: jim
Line: who?

Name: michael
Line: everybody, except stanley.

Name: jim
Line: let's go.

Name: pam
Line: i can't find my glasses.

Name: jim
Line: okay, you know what? why don't you take my hand, and leave them, and let's get out of here.

Name: pam
Line: okay, okay.

Name: kevin
Line: [chuckling] it's michael versus stanley, and it is the clash of the titans. in one corner, you have michael, and he is mad. and then, in the other corner, you have stanley, and he's mad. so that's about it!

Name: michael
Line: [starts to cry] i don't understand why you keep picking on me.

Name: stanley
Line: oh, for the love of god.

Name: michael
Line: you just, do, and i don't know why, so... please help me understand.

Name: stanley
Line: fine. here it is: you are a person i do not respect. the things you say, your actions, your methods, and style. everything you would do, i would do it the opposite way.

Name: michael
Line: well stanley, maybe you're feeling that you don't respect me because you don't know me very well.

Name: stanley
Line: michael i have known you a very long time, and the more i've gotten to know you, the less i've come to respect you. any other theories?

Name: michael
Line: all right, you don't respect me. i accept that. but listen to me, you can't talk to me that way in this office, you just can't. i am your boss. can't allow it.

Name: stanley
Line: fair enough.

Name: michael
Line: i am good person, and sometimes, good people don't get no respect. rodney dangerfield. [as rodney dangerfield] hey, i don't get no respect. no respect at all. when i was in the sandbox as a kid, i got not respect. my wife likes to talk after sex, so she called me from a hotel room, and said, "i don't respect you!" ahh, thoughtless. aw, you know what don't get no respect? airplane food. why don't they just make the plane out of the airline food? my wife don't get no respect, some--take her, please, for example. [as jeff foxworthy] if you don't get no respect, you might be redneck. [as borat] respect is niiice. borat. [as rodney dangerfield] what's the deal with grapenuts? no grapes, no nuts. i don't get no respect!

Name: michael
Line: so i'm thinking, as a reward for our loyal clients, that we contact their assistants, and we find out where they live. and then, we go to their houses, in the middle of the summer, and go caroling. it is a summer christmas sale-abration. and we call it, a summer sales-a-lot. feedback? anybody? stanley?

Name: stanley
Line: has potential to be your best idea yet. [michael smiles]

Name: phyllis
Line: that's the dumbest thing i ever heard. [laughs]

Name: michael
Line: dammit, phyllis. alright, everybody out except phyllis.

Name: michael
Line: you know, i don't care what he did to me.  he's mean to other people, that's what gets me.  he's just...

Name: jim
Line: who else is he mean to?

Name: michael
Line: everybody.  he just, he's always, he's always talking about people behind their backs to me.

Name: pam
Line: what kind of stuff does stanley say?

Name: michael
Line: like that people are stupid, and that they're idiots, and that they're sluts.

Name: kelly
Line: why would he say that?

Name: michael
Line: because he's mean.  he's, he's like a really mean-spirited guy.  he talks about how gay oscar is...

Name: jim
Line: mm-hmm.

Name: michael
Line: and that angela's a midget, and that [indicates jim] your chin is too big.

Name: jim
Line: hey.

Name: michael
Line: i know, i know.  i think it's tiny.  i think it's too small if anything.  and that your glasses make you look ugly.

Name: jim
Line: she's never worn these glasses before.

Name: michael
Line: well, he's just mean.

Name: pam
Line: michael, i think that what stanley did to you was rude.  maybe you should just get him aside and tell him that he was behaving badly.

Name: michael
Line: it's complicated, pam.  i mean, the world looks a lot easier from behind your reception desk.

Name: jim
Line: well, i actually agree with her, i think you should talk to him.  and you also might want to explain to andy that no one wants to help him decide whether or not he has a rash.

Name: kelly
Line: oh, yeah, and then, yell at creed, because you know what?  looking can be as bad as touching.

Name: michael
Line: okay.

Name: michael
Line: i put stanley on a pedestal, for a long time.  but sometimes he can just be a big, fat jerk.  i... jerks don't deserve to be on pedestals.  jerks should be placed up somewhere where everybody can see how jerky they are.  big marble... jerk stand.

Name: michael
Line: pam, stand up.

Name: pam
Line: hi everyone.  my name is pam, and i wear glasses.

Name: meredith
Line: hi, pam.

Name: michael
Line: pretty disgusting.

Name: phyllis
Line: i like your frames.

Name: pam
Line: thanks, phyllis.  yours, too.

Name: phyllis
Line: oh, well, i'm already married.  boys don't make passes at girls who wear glasses.

Name: kelly
Line: ignore her, those glasses are so cool.

Name: pam
Line: really?

Name: kelly
Line: yeah, you look like lisa loeb or tina fey or someone.  you should definitely wear them all the time.

Name: pam
Line: huh.  maybe i will.

Name: kelly
Line: guess who just became the cutest girl in the office.

Name: pam
Line: what's it like without my glasses?  um, well, here, i'll show you.  unfocus your lens.  a lot.  i'm 20/400.  you got it?  okay, i'm gonna spend the rest of the day like this.  i can't see any of the things that would bother me on a normal day.  i can't see anything disgusting, or ugly, or michael... it's great.

Name: ryan
Line: yo!

Name: pam
Line: hi, can i help you?

Name: ryan
Line: haha, nice!  i guess i have been a stranger lately.

Name: pam
Line: [pointing] ryan!

Name: ryan
Line: hey, pam, do you want a bagel? [throws it]

Name: pam
Line: yeah.

Name: ryan
Line: think fast. [it hits her in the face] honestly, pam, the bagels in new york are the only good bagels in the world, i swear to god.

Name: pam
Line: okay.

Name: ryan
Line: the only good bagels anywhere.

Name: pam
Line: i've heard that. [reaches down to pick up bagel from the floor]

Name: ryan
Line: same with coffee, and women.

Name: pam
Line: okay.

Name: ryan
Line: i'm gonna go find toby.  oh, here's what you do.  [takes her bagel] you scoop out the middle, like that, and then you just eat the shell.  you know? [pats his belly, points to pam]  fewer carbs.

Name: pam
Line: yeah, if i could have seen what he just did, i think i would have gotten angry.

Name: jim
Line: a formal warning, seriously?

Name: toby
Line: well, as you know, dwight has filed a lot of complaints against you over the years.

Name: jim
Line: and no one cared.

Name: toby
Line: but now it's being looked at as more of a productivity issue.

Name: jim
Line: productivity?  my numbers are good.

Name: toby
Line: i know, um, but ryan thinks that, uh, they're not good enough.

Name: ryan
Line: wallace likes jim.  so going after him - that's a risky move for me, but in business, you gotta take risks.  sometimes you gotta get out on the open highway, with the top down [pushes button about eight times to get the top down.  finally it comes down and it's all bunched up.  as he's fixing it, the car rolls backwards a bit.]

Name: michael
Line: hey. ready? come on, show me excited!

Name: oscar
Line: yes. [small fist-pumps from both pam and oscar.]

Name: michael
Line: yeah, i'm pretty excited too.

Name: michael
Line: today i'm heading over to the job fair at valley view high school, to find some new interns. want to get some fresh blood. um, euthanize this place.

Name: darryl
Line: hey, are we doing this thing?

Name: michael
Line: yup.

Name: kelly
Line: oh my god, darryl, you look like barack obama. everybody i'm dating barack obama!

Name: michael
Line: why are you dressed like that?

Name: darryl
Line: [in a dress shirt and tie] like what?

Name: michael
Line: like you're applying for a loan.

Name: dwight
Line: maybe he's going to church. or court.

Name: darryl
Line: figured i look presentable. [looks michael over] you? [michael dressed casually in jeans and sneakers] went a different way.

Name: pam
Line: [to darryl] i think you look nice.

Name: michael and darryl
Line: [simultaneously] thank you.

Name: michael
Line: okay, here's what we're going to do: i'm going to instruct the kids about management and sales. oscar will be in charge of accounting. pam will be eye candy. no... uh, also, because that is your alma mater. darryl will hire some kids for the warehouse. we don't have to worry about internships with them, because they definitely ain't going to college.

Name: darryl
Line: what college did you go to mike?

Name: michael
Line: let's go!

Name: jim
Line: today, i am meeting a potential client on the golf course, because ryan put me on probation. you remember ryan, he was the temp here. yeah. and uh, it is not a good time for me to lose my job. since i have some pretty big long term plans in my personal life with pam, that i'd like her parents to be psyched about. so i am about to do something very bold at this job that i've never done before. try.

Name: phil maguire
Line: [takes golf swing] whoa!

Name: jim
Line: mr. maguire, it's been a couple of years.

Name: phil maguire
Line: hey jim, how are you, nice to see you man.

Name: andy
Line: oh no!  no, no-no-no-no! my grandfather would be spinning in his urn, if he knew that i was out here with a dartmouth boy. you take that shirt off right now or i will take it off for you, sir.  i am... totally and completely kidding! [they both laugh] andrew bernard, cornell '95.

Name: phil maguire
Line: phil maguire, dartmouth, '74 [goes to shake andy's hand]

Name: andy
Line: oop, got some blisties.

Name: phil maguire
Line: yeah, you do.

Name: andy
Line: hit about 1200 balls last night, in preparation for today, so hands are a little tender. [shows blisters on both hands] it's actually not funny at all. it's incredibly painful.

Name: phil
Line: let's make it interesting, say, uh, ten bucks a hole?

Name: jim
Line: great!

Name: kevin
Line: what are we talking? skins? acey duecy? bingo bango bongo? sandies, barkies? arnies, wolf? what?

Name: kevin
Line: i'm gonna take this petty cash i got from oscar, and turn it into next month's rent.

Name: pam
Line: so many memories in this old gym. pretending i have pms so i didn't have to play volleyball, pretending i have pms so i didn't have to play basketball. those were the days!

Name: michael
Line: [darryl approaches as students throw basketballs] a little over the top, don't you think?

Name: darryl
Line: show them what you brought, mike.

Name: pam
Line: [holds up single sheet of paper] um, that's all we brought.

Name: michael
Line: this is all we need.

Name: oscar
Line: we'll see.

Name: michael
Line: yes we will see oscar, we will see, because a blank sheet of paper equals endless possibilities! conceptual! all right! we. are. open for business! [all four of them sit in an empty booth with small dunder mifflin sign]  hello!

Name: kevin
Line: andy, you're up, let's go!

Name: andy
Line: [gushing lotion inside his golf gloves] giddy up, let's do this.

Name: andy
Line: people assume i'm great at golf. but like everybody, i hated golf lessons when i was a kid. so, i used to hang out at the sailing club instead. got my "knot" on.

Name: andy
Line: [swings] dammit!

Name: meredith
Line: guys, do we have to stay all day?

Name: phyllis
Line: i mean, michael's gone, can't we just go?

Name: creed
Line: yeah, and i finished my work months ago!

Name: dwight
Line: excuse me, people. it has come to my attention, some of you have forgotten, who is in charge here. when michael is gone... jim is in charge. when jim is gone, andy and i are in charge. when andy is gone you answer to me. okay? [stanley gets up to go] excuse me where do you think you're going? oh no, no, no. you're not leaving. no! stanley, do not walk out that door! if you walk out that door, so help me, i will - [stanley leaves] he left. last time i checked, the american workday ends at five pm. you will all stay at your desks until that time. or, you will suffer the consequences.

Name: phyllis
Line: what consequences?

Name: dwight
Line: i will tell on you.

Name: pam
Line: there's some filing, restocking the supply shelves. replacing the water jug, which nobody likes to do. um, we... uh, eat a lot of cake!

Name: justin
Line: cool.

Name: pam
Line: [laughs] yeah, and uh, you basically learn how an office runs.

Name: michael
Line: hello. hi. [to pam] can i talk to you for a sec? excuse me.

Name: pam
Line: this is michael, my boss. [she points] justin.

Name: michael
Line: hey, uh, remember what we talked about, in the car on the way up, "only the best and the brightest."

Name: pam
Line: he's nice and he seems interested.

Name: michael
Line: he's totally wrong, pam. [to justin] hey.

Name: justin
Line: hi.

Name: michael
Line: how you doing? listen, i don't think that a handsome, funny, smart, funny-looking kid like you, should limit himself. you could do whatever you want to do. you could be a classy janitor, or a cashier with dignity, or a... migraine worker. [takes back the info flyer justin holds] maybe for you, paper should be more of a hobby.

Name: justin
Line: sorry for wasting your time.

Name: michael
Line: oh, no problem. [looks down] and he signed!  he put his name on the piece of - okay, that was supposed to be a blank canvas on which to put their hopes and dreams. and he just, made it into a stupid piece of paper. we need another one, immediately.

Name: darryl
Line: yeah, the booth is lame without it.

Name: pam
Line: i only brought the one.

Name: michael

[airforce recruiter glares at michael] air force is cool. the refreshments? bush league! you know, that's not what you want. dunder- they,  well, okay i see security is coming so i just want to say, come to dunder mifflin. dunder mifflin, a great place to work! anybody? show of hands, anybody want to intern at dunder mifflin?  we do not offer college credit, we cannot give you any sort of pay, but it is a really fun work environment. anybody? show of hands? damn... it. okay, i'm gonna wrap it up here. thank you for your time, and drive safe.

"michael, buy a motorcycle." so i put the money in my shoe, and then i forgot about it until now.

Line: hi. yeah. right. okay, well, they hired a female toby. good for the world. thank you, god, for creating two of you. here's how things work here: my job is to make the office fun. your job is to make the office lame. and we have an eternal struggle, you and i. and only one of us can be the winner. spoiler alert: i'm gonna win.

Line: man, someone doesn't like h.r.

Name: michael
Line: yeah.

Name: holly
Line: [to toby] what did you do to him?

Name: toby
Line: nothing.

Name: michael
Line: t-no. he tortured me... with his awfulness.

Name: holly
Line: yeah, i know what you mean. i nearly fell asleep when he gave me a tour of the files. um, well look, i'll let you get back to work, but i-i really look forward to working with you, mr. scott.

Name: michael
Line: y-you can-michael.

Name: michael
Line: thanks to toby, i have a very strong prejudice against human resources. i believe that the department is a breeding ground for monsters. what i failed to consider though, is that not all monsters are bad. like e.t. is holly our extraterrestrial? maybe. or maybe she's just an awesome woman from this planet.

Name: creed
Line: [shaking holly's hand] the pleasure's all mine.

Name: holly
Line: oh, thanks. i'm really looking forward to sitting down with you and finding out more about what you do here.

Name: creed
Line: any time.

Name: holly
Line: what do you do here?

Name: creed
Line: ...excuse me.

Name: creed
Line: what is wrong with this woman? she's asking about stuff that's nobody's business. "what do i do?"... really, what do i do here? i should've written it down. "qua" something, uh... qua... quar... quibo, qual...quir-quabity. quabity assuance! no. no, no, no, no, but i'm getting close.

Name: dwight
Line: [whispering] have you been introduced to kevin?

Name: holly
Line: no. which one's kevin? [they glance over at kevin subtly, who is stifling a giggle]

Name: dwight
Line: he's here on a special work program. he's slow, you know, in his brain.

Name: holly
Line: oh. good for you guys.

Name: dwight
Line: yeah.

Name: dwight
Line: hazing is a fun way to show a new employee that she is not welcome or liked.

Name: dwight
Line: accounting department, listen up. holly, human resources. angela, oscar, and kevin. [accountants mumble hellos]

Line: hello. hello. [to kevin] hi.

Line: hi.

Line: what do you do?

Line: oh, good for you.

Name: kevin
Line: do you want a m&m?

Name: holly
Line: oh, no, that is so sweet. but thank you though.

Name: kevin
Line: yeah. i keep them here at my desk so that everybody doesn't take them.

Name: holly
Line: well that is a very safe place for them.

Name: kevin
Line: yeah.

Name: michael
Line: here she is! holly... you know, if we hung holly from the ceiling, we'd have to kiss underneath of her. so-i know. oh, sorry. question, are you real, or are you a hollygram?

Name: holly
Line: oh... [laughs along] nice, i've never heard that one before actually.

Name: michael
Line: i bet.

Name: holly
Line: that's good.

Name: michael
Line: i bet. are these guys boring your ears off?

Name: holly
Line: no, no, i...

Name: michael
Line: oh... what, um, what is your commute like? how long does it take to get in?

Name: holly
Line: ooh, uh...

Name: michael
Line: you know, i should make you a mix. do you have a, uh, a cd player?

Name: holly
Line: um... y-yeah. okay.

Name: michael
Line: all right.

Name: holly
Line: thanks.

Name: michael
Line: yep.

Name: holly
Line: great.

Line: do you like it? it's a photo of everyone in the office. so you can take it to costa rica.

Name: toby
Line: you're-you're not in it.

Name: pam
Line: well i was taking the picture.

Name: toby
Line: i love it. i love it... i would love a picture of the two of us, to also take to costa rica.

Name: pam
Line: sure, do you have a camera here?

Name: toby
Line: no, uh... [shouts] does anyone have a camera here? [no one answers him] no one has a camera here. uh...

Name: pam
Line: okay...

Name: toby
Line: i'm gonna... i'll go get one. stay. [runs out of the office]

Line: [on the phone] so i just got the fax closing the sale, and uh, it's big. it is really big.

Name: ryan
Line: congratulations!

Name: jim
Line: thanks.

Name: ryan
Line: don't interrupt.

Name: jim
Line: i just-

Line: congratulations on doing your job. did you enter the sale on the website?

Name: jim
Line: no, i didn't. i just logged it in right here, so...

Name: ryan
Line: all right, try to be a team player here, jim. log it in the website.

Name: jim
Line: all right, well it already went through, so...

Name: ryan
Line: don't worry about that. just re-log it. [hangs up]

Line: hello?

Line: that's not it.

Line: music...

Name: jim
Line: yeah.

Name: michael
Line: for a cd mix tape...

Name: jim
Line: close.

Line: for holly.

Line: mmhmm.

Line: and i'm looking for perfect songs that work on two levels.

Line: what are the two levels?

Name: michael
Line: the two levels being, uh, "welcome to scranton"...

Name: jim
Line: mmhmm.

Name: michael
Line: and "i... love you."

Name: jim
Line: okay. let's start with the "i love you" level.

Name: michael
Line: hey, what's the group that was from scranton that made it big? was that u2?

Name: jim
Line: yes. you don't love holly.

Name: michael
Line: i think i do.

Name: jim
Line: but you just met her.

Name: michael
Line: well, it was love at first sight. actually, it was-no, it was when i heard her voice. it was love at first see with my ears.

Name: jim
Line: oh, okay, it doesn't work like that.

Name: michael
Line: well, you're not a romantic.

Name: jim
Line: actually, i think i am. and i have a little bit of experience in office romance.

Name: michael
Line: oh really?

Name: jim
Line: yeah.

Name: michael
Line: like, with who?

Name: jim
Line: we've been through this.

Name: michael
Line: pam?

Name: jim
Line: yes, we are still dating. and guess what? i took it slow.

Name: michael
Line: yeah, you took it too slow.

Name: jim
Line: well, we're really happy.

Name: michael
Line: this thing with holly feels a lot like love to me.

Name: jim
Line: and that's really sweet. and you can think that. but you don't say that out loud, and you definitely don't say it to her.

Name: michael
Line: i don't want her to get away.

Name: jim
Line: i know. here, michael, you can court her as you get to know her, you know? i mean, the office is a great place for that. pam and i, we got to know each other right out there. i mean, the first time we joked around was at my desk. and the first meal we ever had was, in the break room, actually. we were at two separate tables and, i remember that. the first time we kissed even, was right outside, and... look, all i'm saying is that you can get to know someone really really well, like i did, right here at work.

Name: jim
Line: i was thinking... fireworks for the party. what do you think?

Name: phyllis
Line: oh boy. i appreciate your help, but i can't...

Name: jim
Line: oh, no, no, no, no, no. i just meant i wanted to pay to have fireworks at the party.

Name: phyllis
Line: why would you do that?

Name: jim
Line: because i'm gonna miss toby. yep, he's a heck of a guy, and i think we should send him off right. it doesn't matter. here ya go. [hands her an envelope with money in it]

Name: phyllis
Line: really?

Name: jim
Line: well we all want a good party, right?

Name: jim
Line: i'm going to propose tonight. holy crap!

Name: holly
Line: hey kevin.

Name: kevin
Line: hi.

Name: holly
Line: do you need some help?

Name: holly

Line: well i like pretzels, but, i really like chips.

Name: holly
Line: hmm. well how much money do you have there? [looks at the change in his hand] okay, let's see... fifty... oh, this is a button. okay. fifty-five, sixty-five, okay, you have seventy-five cents. so, that means you could get anything up in the top row.

Name: kevin
Line: hmm...

Name: kevin
Line: i'm totally gonna bang holly! she is cute, and helpful, and she really seems into me.

Name: jim
Line: [on phone, leaving a message] hey, ryan, it's jim. look man, i don't know what's gotten into you lately, but you know what? i really don't care, because you're trying to get rid of me. and i bet you don't think i care enough about this job to actually fight back, but you're wrong, because i do, and i will. so you can keep trying to push me out of this place, but guess what? i'm not going anywhere. [hangs up and exhales sharply]

Name: holly
Line: [tool clicking] damn it!

Name: michael
Line: hello, holly. [holly is on the floor with her desk chair in pieces] woah, what are you doing? you don't, uh, you don't have to do that. i mean, we have already put-together chairs. that's how we buy them actually.

Name: holly
Line: oh, i'm trying to adjust the lumbar support on toby's chair and... that made this up/down lever thing not work, and then i took the whole chair apart, and that... is the story of me on the floor. it's pretty good, right? you know, i'm gonna sell the movie rights.

Name: michael
Line: and the sequel, "woman stands at desk and works." so, i have no idea how you, [he sits on the floor] how you sit like that.

Name: holly
Line: yoga.

Name: michael
Line: [as yoda] sit on floor and put together chair we will. [laughs nervously] yo-da. um...

Name: holly
Line: [as yoda] pass curvy metal piece, you will.

Name: michael
Line: so are you in down this weekend? cause, i'm not-i'm not... i'm not gonna be in town. i'm going out of town.

Name: holly
Line: ohh, so you can't make my orgy? kidding!

Name: michael
Line: kidding. [overdramatically] acting!

Name: holly
Line: [overdramatically] acting!

Name: michael
Line: [overdramatically] acting!

Name: holly
Line: [laughs] lovitz.

Name: michael
Line: yeah.

Line: i did it! [exhales]

Line: wow. okay, so how'd that feel?

Name: michael
Line: it was hard. i wanted to kiss her.

Name: jim
Line: oh, i'm so glad you didn't.

Name: michael
Line: whew, oh god. [inhales] laying a base. laying a base...

Name: jim
Line: there you go. there's plenty of base-laying left, right?... hey. hey!

Name: michael
Line: [giddy] yeah...

Line: hello angela.

Line: phyllis, you look like you're gonna have a heart attack.

Line: why would you do that?

Name: angela
Line: gosh, i just don't know. why do you think?

Name: phyllis

Line: yes we do.

Name: michael
Line: i'll let you in on a little secret: i've been very much looking forward to this moment. very, very much. i-i have been steeped in anticipation. toby has been cruisin' for a bruisin' for twelve years, and i am now his cruise director, and my name is captain bruisin'.

Name: toby
Line: [michael hands him a present] wow, thanks, michael, i...

Name: michael
Line: can i just say that, of all the idiots, in all the idiot villages, in all the idiot worlds, you stand alone, my friend.

Name: dwight
Line: oh my gosh.

Name: creed
Line: mm-hmm.

Name: oscar
Line: well this is what happened: uh, ryan's big project was the website... which wasn't doing so well. so ryan, to give the impression of sales, recorded them twice: once as office sales, once as website sales. which is what we refer to in the business as "misleading the shareholders." another good term is "fraud." the real crime, i think, was the beard.

Name: michael
Line: [still watching video of ryan] oh my god. ryan... oh my god.

Name: kelly
Line: i cannot wait to visit ryan in prison. i'm gonna wear my hottest track suit, and get my hair done, and then be like, "hi ryan." and then all the other prisoners are gonna be like, "damn! ryan, you got a hot ex-girlfriend. ooh, i would never have treated her so bad when i was outside of prison."

Name: jim
Line: would you do me a favor and connect me to ryan?

Name: pam
Line: absolutely. [dials and hands jim receiver]

Name: jim
Line: [clears throat] right to voicemail. [into phone] hey, ryan, it's jim. you know what? totally disregard that last voicemail, because you obviously have your hands tied. good luck! [hangs up]

Name: holly
Line: what's protocol on this?

Name: toby
Line: i normally do nothing, i guess. no, you shouldn't- [holly knocks on michael's door]

Name: holly

Name: michael

Name: holly
Line: no, hey.

Name: michael
Line: i'm cool.

Name: holly
Line: stop. you can let yourself be upset. he's your friend. you know what i usually find?...

Name: michael
Line: holly is sweet and simple, like a lady baker. i would not be surprised to find out that she had worked in a bakery before coming here. she has that kind of warmth. i'm pretty sure she's baked on a professional level.

Line: wow. look at our parking lot.

Name: pam
Line: is jim gonna propose tonight? he is, isn't he? no, he's not... is he?

Line: oh, it was a pretty good company, but i just couldn't see a future there. they kept hiring from the outside. it was easy to get in but impossible to rise up.

Line: that's what she... a lot of places are like that.

Line: i like, uh...

Line: hey. what are you doing?

Name: michael
Line: there is a raccoon in the car, dwight!

Name: dwight
Line: n-no there's not.

Name: michael
Line: why did you do that?

Name: dwight
Line: it was playful hazing.

Name: michael
Line: no. there is no such thing as playful hazing. dwight, i want you to look at holly right now. everybody, i want you to look at holly right now, and maybe if you look at her deeply enough, you will see what i see in her. and that is that we are all very lucky to have her here. holly is the best thing that has happened to this company since world war ii. fifty years, she is the best. [to dwight] take care of that, all right?

Name: dwight
Line: it's not rabid.

Name: michael
Line: shh...

Name: meredith
Line: thanks for bringing that up.

Name: dwight
Line: get it out. come on, get it out. get it out.

Name: michael
Line: i'm really sorry.

Name: holly
Line: michael, thank you so much for saying that. [puts a hand on his arm] i feel so welcome here.

Name: michael
Line: yeah...

Name: holly
Line: i just... um, excuse me.

Name: michael
Line: did you see that! did you see it? did you see what... wow-wee! uh, well, jan didn't believe in showing affection, so... sometimes i don't know how to react when a girl touches me. oh... i like it! [giggles]

Line: classic.

Name: pam

Line: yeah, so...

Line: o-kay. hello jan.

Line: yeah.

Line: i don't know, it could be any number of people. it could be a pedestrian. it could be an old person. it could be a lookie-loo. or, it could be... a bruce springsteen fan - what? who said that? i did. why did i say that? oh, i think you know why i said that. i think it is very apparent. i think it goes without saying. bear with me. there's a point there. but what is the point? i don't understand what he's saying. it seems a little shady. it seems a little foggy. well, it's not a little foggy there's actually something going on here-

Name: jim
Line: do you need us for any of this?

Name: michael
Line: do i?

Name: holly
Line: michael scored the big ticket item.  springsteen tickets! the boss scored the boss.

Name: michael
Line: yeah, i think that's pretty boss.

Name: holly
Line: he knows how to get things. he got me.

Name: michael
Line: whoa!

Name: holly
Line: [giggles] sorry.

Name: michael
Line: twice. ... right?

Name: holly
Line: mm-hmm.

Name: michael
Line: mm-hmm.

Name: holly
Line: mm-hmm.

Name: dwight
Line: listen to me close. 'cause i'm only gonna say this once. you either break off your engagement with that singing buffoon, apologize, and then date me, or you can say good-bye to this. [points below his belt]

Name: angela
Line: i think you have me confused with another person.

Name: dwight
Line: i said i was only gonna say this once. you have until 6:14 pm. 6:14!

Name: angela
Line: i heard you. [quickly walks away]

Name: michael
Line: pump it up! yeah! yeah! yeah! [huey lewis' heart of rock and roll plays] pump up the volume. thank you very much, everybody. thank you, mr. springsteen. [music stops] and welcome to c.r.i.m.e.-a.i.d. [clears throat] crime reduces innocence makes everyone angry i declare. it is not known how many office robberies occur every second because there is no  wikipedia entry for office robbery statistics. however, tonight, its victims, are standing together and standing strong in the form of song, cooking lessons, and hugs. really phyllis? you're auctioning a hug? okay, so with no further ado, lights, camera, auction! take it away bruce! [huey lewis' heart of rock and roll plays]

Name: darryl
Line: mike gave me a list of his top ten springsteen songs. three of them were huey lewis and the news. one was tracy chapman, fast car. and my personal favorite, short people.

Name: michael
Line: okay, this is the moment that you have all been waiting for. our first item up for bids tonight is something that i consider to be very boss indeed. [cheers and applause] it is a yoga lesson from holly flax! yoga! and i would like to start the bidding off at 300 dollars. [auctioneer voice] 300 dollars do i hear 300 dollars? 300 dollars. hey, batter batter batter, hey batter, swing batter, 300 dollars, 300 dollars, 300 dollars. anybody, 300 dollars. 400 dollars. who wants for 400-[speaking gibberish] do i see somebody in the back? is there somebody in the back? do i see somebody in the back? 400-450 [speaking gibberish] sold! for 300 dollars to me! [bangs gavel, which squeaks] what the hell is that?

Name: phyllis
Line: it's the only gavel i could find.

Name: michael
Line: it squeaks when you bang it, that's what she said. let's hear it for me! right? a bargain at any price!

Name: darryl
Line: hey mike, do my thing.

Name: michael
Line: oh, yes, great. very good, um, so, darryl, and the boys in the hood in the warehouse, have graciously donated to, uh, go out for a beer with them right now. you know what, i'm actually going to bid on this. i'm going to start the bidding, because this is something that i have dreamt of-

Name: darryl
Line: mike, you can't do that. it's conflict of interest.

Name: jim
Line: 5 dollars.

Name: darryl
Line: sold! to jim.

Name: michael
Line: okay. okay, sold! have fun, you guys. well, this next item is sure to spring steam from your ears if you don't win it. it just says "creed."

Name: creed
Line: yeah, that's all-inclusive.

Name: darryl
Line: she thought i was mcnabb. [laughing]

Name: jim
Line: i can see that.

Name: darryl
Line: yeah, well, watcha gonna do?

Name: jim
Line: another round, boys? great. [jim walks to the bar]

Name: roy
Line: halpert?

Name: darryl
Line: what's up, roy?

Name: jim
Line: hey man.

Name: roy
Line: i'm not gonna hit you or anything.

Name: jim
Line: oh, i wouldn't-[clears throat]

Name: roy
Line: you good?

Name: jim
Line: i'm good. how you doing?

Name: roy
Line: i'm good.

Name: jim
Line: yeah, okay.

Name: roy
Line: hey darryl, what's happenin'?

Name: darryl
Line: oh, what's up, roy?

Name: roy
Line: hey, what's up, guys? how you been?

Name: kevin
Line: hi, i'm kevin. and i'll do your taxes.

Name: michael
Line: let's hear an opening bid, everybody. who's first? kevin do your taxes. he's the tax man. kevin the tax man.

Name: kevin
Line: federal and state.

Name: michael
Line: federal and state. [no one bids]

Name: kevin
Line: fine. [throws down microphone, knocks down microphone stand]

Name: michael
Line: okay, alright. hey, you know what? i would appreciate it if people would stop storming off the stage.

Name: hank [the security guard]
Line: [playing blues on a guitar] me and the blues. it's me and the blues. [dwight looks at his watch, then at angela, who looks away from dwight towards andy]

Name: michael
Line: we are getting there folks. slow and steady. [david wallace walks in] well, well, have we been blessed today. ladies and gentlemen, mr. david wallace! whoo!

Name: david wallace
Line: hey.

Name: michael
Line: hey!

Name: david wallace
Line: thank you michael, thanks, thanks everybody. i'd like to auction off a weekend at my place in martha's vineyard. hey, hey!

Name: oscar
Line: 100 dollars.

Name: michael
Line: 100 dollars, great.

Name: dwight
Line: hey phyllis, someone let the air out of your tires. come quick.

Name: phyllis
Line: oh dear.

Name: michael
Line: keep it going. hey batter batter batter.

Name: dwight
Line: i had to get your attention. this is an emergency. [the air is let out of one of phyllis' tires]

Name: phyllis
Line: why couldn't have you just said it? why did you actually do it?

Name: dwight
Line: listen, she ignored my ultimatum. now what?

Name: phyllis
Line: now you move on.

Name: dwight
Line: okay, fine. i've moved on. now how do i get her back?

Name: phyllis
Line: well dwight, i don't think you do. i think you've got your answer.

Name: dwight
Line: wait, that's it? that's your advice? i thought you had some kind of big master plan.

Name: phyllis
Line: well, i just think we all deserve to be with someone who wants to be with us.

Name: dwight
Line: oh. i get it. you're trying to secure your place as head of the party-planning committee. you're just being selfish. [phyllis slaps dwight] and you slap like a girl.

Name: dwight
Line: what did phyllis do wrong? i'll tell you what phyllis did wrong. she stuck her nose into my business and tried to help me. [dwight has an epiphany]

Name: roy
Line: what's going on with pam?

Name: jim
Line: oh, she's good actually.

Name: roy
Line: yeah?

Name: jim
Line: she's, um, she's in new york. she's at an art school.

Name: roy
Line: really?

Name: jim
Line: yeah, she's doing really well.

Name: roy
Line: huh.

Name: jim
Line: she's engaged, um... to me.

Name: roy
Line: [laughs] congrats, man.

Name: jim
Line: oh, thanks man. appreciate that.

Name: roy
Line: so pam's happy?

Name: jim
Line: yeah, i'd say she's happy. i mean, she loves her classes. loves the city. i mean, last night, she was out with her friends, till, like, 8:00 am.

Name: roy
Line: wow.

Name: jim
Line: what?

Name: roy
Line: i thought you were a friend.

Name: jim
Line: [driving] i am going to see pam. because i feel like i should. [sighs]

Name: bob
Line: when are you getting to bruce?

Name: michael
Line: uh, just a few more items.

Name: all
Line: [chanting] bruce! bruce! bruce!

Name: michael
Line: all right, all right, all right, all right, all right! here we go. all right, big ticket item. [cheering] all right, in my pocket, i have... two tickets... to mr. bruce springsteen, front... oh, where are those? has anyone seen an envelope with bruce springsteen front row tickets and backstage passes? anybody seen something like-lying around?

Name: stanley
Line: do you want us to look for 'em?

Name: michael
Line: no. i think they were stolen. i think they were stolen and they're gone forever. so... oh, that was the last good item. so, good job, everybody.

Name: phyllis
Line: i have my hug.

Name: michael
Line: yeah, well, phyllis, nobody... really wants a hug, so.

Name: bob
Line: i'll bid on a hug.

Name: michael
Line: she's your wife, you idiot.

Name: bob
Line: 100 dollars.

Name: michael
Line: uh, what the hell is happening?

Name: angela
Line: what are you doing?

Name: andy
Line: i need a hug, unless you're gonna give me one.

Name: angela
Line: not here.

Name: michael
Line: 300, we have 300. 300 going once. 300 going twice.

Line: 300 and one penny.

Name: michael
Line: 300 and one penny, 300 and one penny.

Name: dwight
Line: 350 and one penny.

Name: michael
Line: 350 and one penny.

Name: michael
Line: 400, 400 hey batter batter.

Name: dwight
Line: 400 and one penny.

Name: michael
Line: 400 and one penny.

Line: 500 and one penny.

Line: 500 and one penny. one million dollar!

Name: dwight
Line: 700 and one penny.

Name: michael
Line: humuna-humuna-humuna-humuna-humuna-

Line: eh, it's not worth it.

Name: michael
Line: 1,000 going once, 1,000 going twice. sold for 1,000 dollar. [applause] nicely done.

Name: jim
Line: [driving, sighs, laughs] no. you know what? no. because... i'm not that guy. and [laughs] we are not that couple. [turns around]

Name: michael
Line: [whispering] hey, that looks good. listen, about the tickets. it's sort of a gray-kind of a gray area in terms of...whether or not i had them- [holly covers michaels mouth]

Name: holly
Line: the springsteen tickets seemed too good to be true. but, a lot of michael seems too good to be true. so far it's all true. but yeah, those tickets, really seemed too good to be true.

Line: [after accidentally seeing michael and holly kiss] no, i did not know that michael was dating holly.

Name: pam
Line: what can i do for you, michael? i'm kinda busy.

Name: michael
Line: oh, i guess that job that i got you is working out for you well, then.

Name: pam
Line: it is.  thanks again.

Name: michael
Line: hey, if there's anything else i can do, just let me know.

Name: pam
Line: [long pause] and of course, if there's ever anything i can ever do for you...

Name: michael
Line: you know what?  i would love a slice of real new york style pizza.

Name: pam
Line: if i get you a slice of pizza, are we even?

Name: michael
Line: even as pie.

Name: michael
Line: [opening a delivery envelope, takes out slice of pizza which appears to have a section off the end] okay... don't ask me how i got it, let's just say that i have... connections. [folds it in two and takes a bite] mmm.  mmm.  [with a full mouth and an italian accent] i'm the godfather.  i'm gonna eat this whole pizza.  and then i'm gonna kill you. [digs around in envelope, pulls out the rest of the slice] [indistinct] some cheese.  you gotta fold it up.  that's the way you eat pizza.

Name: jim
Line: i just don't know if he's presidential enough.

Name: pam
Line: i know.  and how long is cj gonna spin this whole ms thing?  how can josh and sam keep quiet?

Name: pam
Line: every night, jim and i watch an episode of the west wing together on dvd.  um, he wanted to watch battlestar galactica and i wanted to watch cranford... so we compromised.  next we're gonna watch cranford.

Name: jim
Line: cranford?  no.  we will never watch that.

Name: michael
Line: i am going to run three possible date ideas by you and i want you to tell me which one gets your blood percolating.

Name: jim
Line: ah, i'm sure they're all great.

Name: michael
Line: i have two sure things, one wildcard.

Name: jim
Line: let's start with the wildcard.

Name: michael
Line: okay.

Name: jim
Line: mmm-hmm.

Name: michael
Line: the wildcard is dinner at a nice restaurant.

Name: jim
Line: uh-oh.

Name: michael
Line: exactly.  here, here are my sure things.  i blindfold her.  i take her to the houdini museum.  she chains me up...

Name: jim
Line: i think i got a pretty good sense of that one.

Name: michael
Line: okay.

Name: jim
Line: yep.

Name: michael
Line: all right.

Name: jim
Line: let's move on to the next.

Name: michael
Line: number two, we go to the mall...

Name: jim
Line: mmm-hmm.

Name: michael
Line: we go to the bed store, i let her choose whatever bed she wants...

Name: jim
Line: oh, that's good.

Name: michael
Line: and we have sex on it.

Name: jim
Line: i like the wild card.  i'm already liking the wild card.

Name: michael
Line: really?  i don't know.  it's a big third date, jim.

Name: jim
Line: mmm-hmm.

Name: michael
Line: what do i do?

Name: jim
Line: have you asked her what she wants to do?

Name: michael
Line: well, i thought as the man that i should make the decision.

Name: jim
Line: no.  you got that backwards.

Name: michael
Line: times have changed, jim.

Name: dwight
Line: our first date was at the anthracite coal museum.  we had both been before, but we pretended like it was our first time so we could get all the extra information.  they knew we were faking... 'cause they recognized us.   but we made them tell us all the stories.  all the safety information.  and we corrected them whenever they got it wrong. [phyllis chuckles and nods, dwight sighs and takes the rest of his sandwich out of the container and holds it up to phyllis]   you want half a sandwich?

Name: phyllis
Line: okay.

Name: dwight
Line: i'll bring you one tomorrow.  you've earned it.  [bites into the sandwich half, chews]  mmm.  i hope you like fox meat.

Name: kelly
Line: [dressed as carrie bradshaw] wow you guys look amazing. stanley, i thought you hated halloween.

Name: phyllis
Line: [dressed as raggedy ann] shh. he wears that so he can sleep at his desk. who are you?

Name: kelly
Line: oh, i'm carrie bradshaw from sex and the city.

Name: phyllis
Line: mm. i like your shoes. [kelly has 5-inch heels on]

Name: kelly
Line: thank you. will you help walk me to the fax machine?

Name: phyllis
Line: sure.

Name: ryan
Line: i got her, i got her. i can help you. you look amazing.

Name: kelly
Line: inappropriate. thank you. who are you, larry king?

Name: ryan
Line: gordon gekko.

Name: kelly
Line: oh, from the insurance commercials!

Name: ryan
Line: ... yeah.

Name: creed
Line: let's put a smile on that face!

Name: kevin
Line: [also dressed as the joker] dammit creed! i've been up since four!

Name: andy
Line: [dressed as a kitten] meow. sweet 'stume, dude. who are you supposed to be?

Name: jim
Line: dave.

Name: andy
Line: cool.

Name: jim
Line: you are?  [andy hisses] a cat?

Name: andy
Line: [buzzer noise] we were looking for "kitten."

Name: jim

Name: pam
Line: hey.

Name: jim
Line: hey new york, happy halloween!

Name: pam
Line: thanks.  my costume's getting a lot of attention. [pam is dressed as charlie chaplin]

Name: pam
Line: so apparently no one dresses up for halloween here. i wish i had known that before i used greasepaint for my moustache. and i can't even take off my hat, because then i'm hitler.

Name: dwight
Line: [dressed as the joker] hm mm mm mm. want to see a magic trick? heh heh heh! i'm gonna make a pencil disapp-- oh! [elevator doors close, reopen.] disappear.

Name: michael
Line: okay, i think we are set. we have puzzles, string for cat's cradles. burned this last night. a little road trip cd. puppets.

Name: holly
Line: oh, look at all this stuff! it's only seven hours.

Name: michael
Line: when corporate found out that we were dating, they decided they were going to transfer holly back to her old branch, in nashua, new hampshire.

Name: holly
Line: michael is taking a personal day to move me up.

Name: michael
Line: road trip!  right?

Name: holly
Line: breaker one-nine, copy?

Name: michael
Line: oh, copy that breaker. those duke boys are at it again.

Name: darryl
Line: hey! do not touch my radio.

Name: michael
Line: we're not.

Name: holly
Line: kidding.

Name: michael
Line: we're not doing anything.

Name: holly
Line: it's been a weird week since we found out i had to transfer. michael wanted me to quit and get some job here in scranton, and i said "well, why don't you quit and get some job in nashua?" and he said "i asked you first."  and i said "first!" at the same time he did. and then i said "jinx." and then we never talked about it again and haven't been back to the conversation. so...

Name: michael
Line: all right everybody. i'm out of here. jim, you're in charge.

Name: jim
Line: oh, i'll walk you out.

Name: michael
Line: ah, you are quite the gentleman.

Name: michael
Line: you can let people go a couple of minutes early if you want.

Name: jim
Line: all right. we'll see. [to camera] no.

Name: jim
Line: i am off to new york. my brother pete from boston, and my brother tom from new jersey are taking pam and i out for lunch, to celebrate the engagement. or maybe to beat me up. i can never tell with those two.

Name: dwight
Line: good morning temp.

Name: ryan
Line: 'morning. [dwight reveals cornell sweatshirt] wow. good morning dwight.

Name: dwight
Line: thought i'd go casual today. morning everyone. good morning.  hello.  how are you phyllis?

Name: andy
Line: ha ha ha. that's funny. [angrily] take that sweatshirt off!  hey buddy.

Name: dwight
Line: andy.

Name: andy
Line: remember when i jokingly yelled at you to take your sweatshirt off? totally joking. but, you should know, those colors are sacred. not that i care. but if you're not a cornell man, you probably shouldn't wear them.

Name: dwight
Line: no i get it. i totally understand. and uh, i just want to assure you, that i mean no disrespect. you see, i'm applying!

Name: andy
Line: come on, you think you can get into cornell?

Name: dwight
Line: well if somebody who barely out-sells phyllis, can get in, i should be fine.

Name: phyllis
Line: i'm sitting right here dwight.

Name: dwight
Line: i meant that as a compliment to you phyllis, as well as a slight to andy.

Name: dwight
Line: cornell is a good school, and i want to better myself through higher education. if it makes andy angry, so be it. [he sips from his cornell mug]

Name: holly
Line: i have to unpack this weekend but maybe next weekend we go to the outlets!

Name: michael
Line: cool!

Name: darryl
Line: mike you'll drive this every weekend?

Name: michael
Line: we're gonna switch back and forth, the driving. sometimes we'll just meet in the middle. it'll be fun. wait a sec. oh i love this song.

Name: michael and holly
Line: life is a highway, i want to ride it all night long.

Name: michael, holly, and darryl
Line: if you're going my way, i wanna drive you all night long! if you're going my way...

Name: dwight
Line: hey there. so uh, how do you think we're gonna do against penn this year? nathan ford's arm looks pretty strong.

Name: andy
Line: well he's had a pretty good season so far--- stop saying "we." you did not go to cornell. okay, you're just doing this to screw with me.

Name: dwight
Line: not so. cornell is an excellent school. without its agricultural program, we probably wouldn't have cabbage. at least not modern cabbage.

Name: andy
Line: i know it's an excellent school, dwight. i went there. my blood runs big red.

Name: dwight
Line: someday, we'll both get together in comstock hall and just laugh about all of this.

Name: pam
Line: hey!

Name: tom
Line: hey, future baby sis!

Name: pam
Line: how are you tom. nice to see you.

Name: tom
Line: i'm good.

Name: pam
Line: i asked tom and pete to come early so we could play a prank on jim at lunch! pretty awesome, right? i think they're into the idea. they're probably thinking, "that pam beasly, she's the coolest sister-in-law on the planet. she's the best! the absolute best."

Name: pam
Line: okay, so here's what i'm thinking. i'm gonna say that before ceramics class, i took off my ring, and then when i changed back out of my smock, it wasn't in my pocket anymore, and i lost it.

Name: pete
Line: that's perfect. you know what would be even more hilarious? remember that thing we did when jim was in high school with his girlfriend?

Name: tom
Line: right! that would be hilarious! we should totally dog her, about being an artist, never making any money!

Name: pete
Line: that, is awesome!

Name: tom
Line: like she basically has a hobby, for a job.

Name: pete
Line: oh yeah.

Name: pam
Line: so, not the ring then? the- the- not doing the ring?

Name: pete
Line: i think this is better.

Name: tom
Line: the other thing would "get" jim.

Name: pete
Line: this is nicer, it's fun. it's fun!

Name: pam
Line: okay, okay.

Name: tom
Line: oh, he hates it when we pick on his girlfriends.

Name: pam
Line: oookay....

Name: pam
Line: they came up with that idea really fast.

Name: darryl
Line: this trip was longer than i thought.

Name: holly
Line: yeah it did look shorter on the map-

Name: michael
Line: ah! ah! ahhhh!  [waking up] hey. whew. ow. i was having a nightmare.

Name: holly
Line: you were sleeping?  you were talking before.

Name: michael
Line: was i?  really? was i saying anything interesting?

Name: darryl
Line: not really.

Name: michael
Line: all right. what's the scoop, how far?

Name: darryl
Line: four hours. almost halfway there.

Name: holly
Line: we're only halfway?

Name: michael
Line: halfway! okay, you know what i want to do, i want to pull over and find little bed and breakfast for when we meet in the middle. emphasis on the bed. and the breakfast.

Name: darryl
Line: next exit isn't for five miles.

Name: holly
Line: let's check there.

Name: pam
Line: hey guys.

Name: jim
Line: hey, how are you?

Name: pam
Line: hi! [smooches]

Name: jim
Line: good to see you.

Name: pete
Line: nice to see you again, pam.

Name: tom
Line: pam, i haven't seen you in so, so long!

Name: jim
Line: all right so now we can sit... and get comfortable.

Name: darryl
Line: there's nothing out here man.

Name: michael
Line: yeah. i don't know i just- i imagined a hotel right here. pool, over here. really good breakfast place. with really good bacon.

Name: michael
Line: here we go, fourth time's a charm. "life's like a road where you just... one day here, and the next day back...sometimes you deal with it, today you don't, sometimes you do, what you want... there's a world out there.... [holly sobs] hey. are you crying?

Name: holly
Line: no.

Name: michael
Line: allergies?

Name: holly
Line: no.

Name: michael
Line: did darryl touch you?

Name: darryl
Line: what!?

Name: holly
Line: no, darryl did not touch me. can we just keep going, please? [crying]

Name: michael
Line: what's the matter?

Name: holly
Line: it's not gonna work.

Name: michael
Line: sure it is.

Name: holly
Line: there's too much distance.

Name: michael
Line: oh no no no.. it's gonna work, it'll be fine.

Name: holly
Line: michael we've only been dating each other for a few weeks

Name: michael
Line: listen to me. i like you so much.

Name: holly
Line: and i like you too.

Name: michael
Line: and i've dated four women in the last--

Name: holly
Line: i've dated four guys last year too.

Name: michael
Line: not last - no. in like the last ten years.

Name: holly
Line: oh.

Name: michael
Line: i've dated almost four women, and you are so far above them, it is stupid.

Name: holly
Line: michael. don't. don't. don't make it harder than it has to be.

Name: michael
Line: that's what she said.

Name: michael
Line: holly thinks that this relationship is over. well, you know what? i am not gonna give up that easy. i'm gonna make this way harder than it needs to be.

Name: andy
Line: take that down. [dwight has hung a large red cornell banner from the ceiling]

Name: dwight
Line: excuse me?

Name: andy
Line: take. that down.

Name: meredith
Line: you know i once dated a couple of guys from cornell. they were really nice. they gave me a ride home.

Name: andy
Line: i seriously doubt that anyone from cornell dated you.

Name: creed
Line: it's pronounced ker-nell. it's the highest rank in the military.

Name: andy
Line: it's pronounced "corn-ell!" it's the highest rank in the ivy league!

Name: dwight
Line: andy, let's just talk about this man-to-man, after work.

Name: andy
Line: fine.

Name: dwight
Line: what do you say?

[holly gasps] you have to drive to boston, right? that's an hour and a half. get there an hour before the flight. now you're up two and a half hours. the flight to philadelphia is an hour fifteen. it's another two and a half hour drive to scranton, assuming there's no traffic, because....

Line: why are you doing this to andy?

Line: i'll take care of that for you. [crumples receipt and throws it in trash] thanks.

Name: michael
Line: kelly kapoor is our dusky, exotic customer service rep. and once a year, she will contact our clients and find out how happy they are with our salespeople. sort of a kapoor's list. "schindler's list" parody. ... that's not appropriate, no.

Line: why are surveys important? okay, hypothetical: a man wants to buy 500 reams of....carrots. and, so he's like "what do i do? where do i go? do i go to the insensitive carrot supplier, the insensitive carrot salesman? or do i go to the nice carrot salesman, who will maybe charge a few cents more per ream of carrot, but guarantee next-day delivery on your carrots? most companies need their carrots the next day. now, substitute paper for carrots, and that is why surveys are important."

[pam walks over to the clown painting on the wall]  yeah, i am really sorry about this.  i tried to move it but he is really nailed in there.  worried about art theft, i guess, lot of art theives in this neighborhood.  [upstairs] this is the master bedroom but, i'm actually not allowed in here so... [shuts the door]

[pam looks around and then looks at him] look, i know, i bought this without asking you and it's doesn't look great, i know that.  and if you really hate it, i totally understand it's just---

Name: dwight
Line: what is my perfect crime?  i break into tiffany's at midnight.  do i go for the vault? no, i go for the chandelier.  it's priceless.  as i'm taking it down, a woman catches me.  she tells me to stop.  it's her father's business.  she's tiffany.  i say no.  we make love all night.  in the morning the cops come and i escape in one of their uniforms.  i tell her to meet me in mexico but i go to canada.  i don't trust her.  besides, i like the cold.  thirty years later, i get a postcard.  i have a son and he's the chief of police.  this is where the story gets interesting: i tell tiffany to meet me in paris, by the trocadero.  she's been waiting for me all these years; she's never taken another lover.  i don't care, i don't show up. i go to berlin.  that's where i stashed the chandelier.

Name: michael
Line: uh-uh.  no, no, no.  come on. get up.  let's do this.

Line: yes. i had a heart attack.  i would quit, but i'm too old to find another job and i don't have enough saved to retire.  i feel like i'm working in my own casket.

Line: michael!

Name: michael
Line: this is you we're talking about.

Name: angela
Line: michael.

Name: michael
Line: okay, okay.  i'll show them. here we go. [whispers] stanley.  all right.

Line: so, assessing the situation.  are they breathing?

Line: no, rose. they are not breathing.  and they have no arms or legs.

Name: rose
Line: no, that's not part of it.

Name: michael
Line: where are they?  you know what? if we come across somebody with no arms or legs do we bother resuscitating them? i mean, what kind of quality of life do we have there?

Line: i would want to live with no legs.

Name: michael
Line: how about no arms? no arms or legs is basically how you exist right now, kevin. you don't do anything.

Name: rose
Line: all right, well, lets get back to it. 'cause you're losing him. okay, too fast. everyone, we need to pump at a pace of a 100 beats per minute .

Line: okay, that's uh, hard to keep track.  how many is that per hour?

Name: jim
Line: how's that gonna help you?

Name: michael
Line: i will divide and then count to it.

Name: jim
Line: right.

Name: rose
Line: okay. well, a good trick is to pump to the tune of 'staying alive' by the bee gees.  do you know that song?

Name: michael
Line: yes, yes i do.  i love that song. [clears throat, begins to sing] first i was afraid, i was petrified.

Name: rose
Line: no, it's--ah, ah, ah, ah, stayin' alive, stayin' alive.

Name: michael
Line: okay, i got it.

Line: [to rose] you were in the parking lot earlier. that's how i know you.

Name: michael
Line: ah, ah, ah, ah, stayin' alive, stayin' alive [andy joins in] ah, ah, ah, ah, stayin' alive, stayin' alive.

Name: michael
Line: ah, ah, ah, ah...

Name: andy
Line: oh you can tell by the way i use my walk i'm a woman's man, no time to talk. music loud, women warm, been kicked around since i was born. oh, it's alright, it's okay, [michael and kelly join in] you can look the other way. loo do do!

Name: rose
Line: okay!

Line: da, da, da, da, da, da, da

Name: rose
Line: okay!

Line: [muttering] stayin' alive, stayin' alive.

Name: rose
Line: yeah, okay.  you didn't maintain 100 beats per minute, and the ambulance didn't arrive because nobody called 911. so you lost him.

Line: yeah.

Line: my dad spent the night at our place last night.  my parents have been fighting for weeks and... it kinda sucks.  jim's been great. but i'm gonna need to buy my dad a robe.

Line: he's not saying what he needs to say.

Name: andy
Line: hmm? who? sam?

Name: pam
Line: yeah.

Name: jim
Line: i mean, they just need to communicate, you know?  if they said to each other what they're saying to everyone else, then--

Name: andy
Line: hmm.

Line: jim and pam are, like, movie geniuses. they're catching things that are totally going over my head.

Name: michael
Line: hi, everyone.  corporate has given dwight two strikes. they are very, very upset with him. so, as a disciplinary measure he is going to have to issue a formal apology. dwight, have you prepared your statement of regret?

Line: i have.

Line: let's hear it.

Name: dwight
Line: [clears throat] "i state my regret."

Line: you couldn't of memorized that?

Name: dwight
Line: i could not, because i do not feel it. okay, everyone. i am going to need you to sign this statement of regret as an acknowledgement that you heard it.  okay? everyone come on up here. it's not a big deal.

Name: phyllis
Line: it is a big deal. you almost killed stanley.

Name: dwight
Line: yeah, right. i filled him full of butter and sugar for 50 years and forced him not to exercise. now, take a lesson from stanley and jog on up here and sign this, okay?  make a line. just form a line right here.  sign it!  sign it now!

Name: pam
Line: hi dad. yeah jim has shaving cream, check our bathroom.

Line: [movie] i'm in here.

Line: gimme a break.

Line: i know it man. you know, lilly was supposed to be nicole kidman, um and it was gonna be sophie's mom, not grandmother. but then nicole kidman dropped out so they went with lily, with a small rewrite.

Name: sam
Line: [movie] get that in there. oh yeah.

Name: lily

Line: mmm...

Name: michael
Line: my goal is to make this office as peaceful a place for stanley hudson as i can. i think sounds have a lot to do with that. here are some downloaded peaceful sounds. [a couple of sounds play on the computer] that one makes me think... of death. it's kinda nice...

Name: michael
Line: [everyone is lying on the floor in the conference room with the light off, michael is walking around with a candle in his hand] it is a beautiful, sunny day as we walk through the meadow that is very spiritual and relaxing and there are flowers and it is sunny and beautiful. now, up ahead, a castle, in a distance.

Name: michael
Line: and you walk up toward the castle, and inside the castle are 4 men, and each of them, none of them have shoes, and they give you a funny cigarette, and you feel even more relaxed, and then you want ice cream. you want a big bowl of ice cream. what kind do you want? shout it out.

Name: meredith
Line: chunky monkey.

Line: too expensive.

Name: stanley
Line: chocolate.

Name: michael
Line: racism is dead stanley, you can have any kind of ice cream you want. what do you want? [beeping starts] what is that? people! please i told you to get rid of the cell phones.

Name: stanley
Line: it's my bio-feedback machine..

Name: michael
Line: oh, ok. what is that, like, a video game?

Name: stanley

Line: would ya, would ya step back please

Line: ok, alright.

Line: ok. [beeping slows down]

Name: michael
Line: ok... i think that thing is on the fritz. ahh... oscar, would you reach over and touch his thing? that's what he said! right guys, 'cause of gay? [oscar has stanley's monitor now] let's give this a shot.

Line: hellloo... [beeping speeds up as michael gets closer]

Name: michael
Line: remember when people used to say boss, when they were describing something that was really cool like, those shoulder pads are really boss man... look at that perm, that perm is so boss. it's what made me want to become a boss. and i looked so good in a perm and shoulder pads. but now, boss is just slang for jerk in charge.

Name: michael
Line: ok everybody, i've figured it out. the reason that you are all so stressed around me is that you are too intimidated to tell me what you really think. [jim shakes his head at the camera] you are keeping these feelings inside, and that is what's causing stress. so, what is the solution? solution is honesty, laughter, and comedy. in short...

Name: kelly
Line: a vacation.

Name: michael
Line: what? no. no, i am talking about a roast! of michael scott! oh c'mon! who here has the comedy central roast channel? you've seen it right? everybody gets together, and everyone starts hurling insults at the one guy, and everybody's laughing, and everybody's hugging each other...

Line: si senor.

[angela jumps up] ok... lower the mic for the midget.

Line: if you ever wondered if you were michael scott, here's a quiz to help. if you ever put sunblock on a window, you might be michael scott. [laughter]

Line: you're so lucky! good one... [clapping]

Line: hey, ya know what? forgive me for caring. right?

Name: pam
Line: well, ya know, michael is a great delegator. he never does any work himself. ever. and one time, i walked in on him naked, and his thing is so small. [quickly walks off stage] if it were an ipod it would be a shuffle! [clapping, laughter]

Name: michael
Line: can i make just a little announcement. in a professional roast, usually the roaster will say something nice about the roastee after they're done, something about how much they love them, so, just, keep that in mind.

Line: mike claims, we're all a family isn't that right?

Line: we are, we are a family.

Line: oh very funny.

Line: uhh... hehe hah! i'm thinking roy?

Name: michael
Line: i don't believe i have had the pleasure.

Name: warehouse michael
Line: michael i gave you a ride home last week, we spent an hour in traffic...

Name: darryl
Line: what's his name?

Name: michael
Line: jefferson.

Name: darryl
Line: nope. his name is michael. [michael makes the da dum ksch on the drumset again]

Name: andy
Line: [singing and playing the guitar] what i hate about you, you really suck as a boss, you're the laziest, jerkiest and you're dumber than applesauce. we're stuck listening to you all day, stanley tried to die just to get away, heeey, well it's true. that's what i hate about you. that's what i hate about you. yeah. and now, a man that deserves no introduction, michael scott.

Name: michael
Line: haha ha. thank you very much, thank you. that was great. great job, great laughs. really, really went after my intelligence there. [clears throat] dozens of online iq test might prove you wrong, but, and my thing isn't tiny, its average, so... get your facts straight. [clears throat again] so when i heard that there was going to be a roast in my honor, i thought [choking up, clears throat again] sorry. [laughs nervously] i think i have a frog in my throat. um... [sigh] i decided to jot down some quick thoughts about you people, um, first up phyllis and kevin. uh um... [michael walks off stage, knocking over the snare drum]

Name: pam
Line: dunder mifflin this is pam. uh, i'm sorry, michael's not here right now can i take a message? great. i will. thanks.

Name: dwight
Line: it's very unusual for michael not to show up to work. my guess? he's either deeply depressed, or an icicle has snapped off his roof and impaled his brain. he has this terrible habit of standing directly underneath them and staring up at them. and i always say michael, take two steps back, and stare at the icicle from the side. and he's like no, i like the way they look from standing directly underneath them.

Name: kevin
Line: [in the lunch room, with a sock puppet] he is so dumb that he tries to put his m&ms in alphabetical order. [giggles]

Line: i'm almost done.
