Line: well, i saw them in there.

Name: andy
Line: well maybe they ran away, because the pizza was like, [imitating italian accent] "hey, get out of here, you stupid strawberries."

Name: erin
Line: i think when andy finally asks me out he's going to try to top what he did with the drum line. i can't wait to see what he comes up with.

Name: andy
Line: the ball's totally in erin's court. after the whole drum line thing.

Name: gabe
Line: [on videochat]  first let me say that i told them everything you wanted me to say, in just the way you wanted me to say it, so...

Name: jo
Line: gabe, honey, i love this. i love the sound of your voice. but i really need some new information now.

Name: gabe
Line: ok, um, i told the story of your uncle, and i have a feeling that you would have [michael gesturing behind computer] really been proud of the way... okay, um...

Name: jo
Line: wait a minute, who is it? who's there? is there somebody in the room with you? [michael gesturing "no"] i want to see who it is. turn me around.

Name: gabe
Line: i don't - it's just...

Name: jo
Line: turn me around. now. [michael starts to leave, jo whistles] hey, buddy. is it something i said?

Name: michael
Line: hello. no. my name's michael scott. hello.

Name: jo
Line: oh, hello, mr. scott. pleased to meet you.

Name: michael
Line: nice to meet you. we are very excited about the merger with sabre. i think you have a great accent.

Name: jo
Line: aw, thank you. i've been working on it since i was a little girl. to, um, to what do i owe the pleasure of this videochat?

Name: michael
Line: well, i am little concerned with all of these changes, to be quite frank. i think we have done things a certain way here at dunder mifflin for quite some time, and -

Name: jo
Line: pardon. pardon me, mr. scott, but the last time i saw a company as mismanaged as dunder mifflin, it was my grandson's snowball company, so you'll excuse me if i prefer that you all adapt to the way that we do things.

Name: michael
Line: ok. i feel very strongly that you can't just come in here and change everything that people have been doing forever. is christian slater back there? because... he knows. he'd know what to do.

Name: jo
Line: so listen, why don't you tell gabe if by the end of the day you can't handle the changes.

Name: michael
Line: i have already told him, but i will tell him again if you think that will help.

Name: jo
Line: i would take until the end of the day if i were you. [michael leaves conference room]

Name: jerry
Line: pam and jim? hey, i'm jerry.

Name: pam
Line: hi jerry.

Name: jim
Line: jerry.

Name: jerry
Line: good to see you. come on in. my office is right back here. this is the play room.

Name: jim
Line: this is great. got to confess, we came a little early, so we got a quick look around, but, uh -

Name: jerry
Line: oh, so you saw it already?

Name: jim
Line: no, no, no, no. yes. we saw this, yes. no, it wasn't like a look around. we really just had a peek. quick peek. didn't focus on anything in particular.

Name: pam
Line: it's lovely.

Name: jerry
Line: [cell phone rings] oh. got to take this. sorry.

Name: jim
Line: do it.

Name: jerry
Line: okay. hi, this is jerry.

Name: pam
Line: ok, you've got to pull it together.

Name: jim
Line: we should just go. he's really uncomfortable.

Name: pam
Line: he's uncomfortable because you're acting weird. so you have to stop acting weird.

Name: jim
Line: what if we just bring it up? we just put it out in the open?

Name: pam
Line: that's the weirdest possible solution to the problem.

Name: jerry
Line: sorry about that. right this way.

Name: jim
Line: all right.

Name: michael
Line: i have come here today to talk to mr. david wallace about this whole thing going on with sabre. [rings doorbell] he will know exactly what to do. he is not a big fan of me dropping by announced. but then again, who is? [loud drumming as door opens] hey. hi, sorry.

Name: david
Line: michael.

Name: michael
Line: i hope you're not busy doing something.

Name: david
Line: no, you kidding? come on in. come on.

Name: michael
Line: you sure?

Name: david
Line: you look great.

Name: michael
Line: you look great too.

Name: david
Line: you hungry? i'm just having lunch.

Name: michael
Line: oh, yeah, that sounds good.

Name: david
Line: fantastic. teddy, look who just stopped in.

Name: teddy wallace
Line: huh? hey. [continues drumming]

Name: michael
Line: hey. wow.

Name: david
Line: keep it up, son.

Name: michael
Line: really loud.

Name: michael
Line: wow. oh, yummy. [david spreads marshmallow fluff on bread] you have got the life, my friend.

Name: david
Line: yeah.

Name: michael
Line: can i just stay here and never go back?

Name: david
Line: things not going so well there?

Name: michael
Line: oh, man. how much time do you have?

Name: david
Line: i have a doctor's appointment next thursday.

Name: michael
Line: yeah.

Name: mrs. wallace
Line: hey, honey. how's your day going? did you do anything cool?

Name: david
Line: uh, no, sweetie. i just sort of hung out.

Name: mrs. wallace
Line: oh, 'cause i saw you had shoes on, so i didn't know if you did anything.

Name: david
Line: no. just hanging out, honey. you remember michael.

Name: michael
Line: hi. sorry, i was just in the neighborhood, thought i'd come by, see...

Name: mrs. wallace
Line: no problem at all. this is great. so what are you guys up to?

Name: michael
Line: i don't know.

Name: david
Line: uh, but maybe, uh - actually, you know, i think maybe we'll go outside. may -maybe we'll go outside. [drumming intensifies] outside.

Name: jim
Line: there was one thing we were curious about, uh, your flexibility on things like easter or memorial day, because we might want to change our days around a little bit.

Name: jerry
Line: that seems a bit premature, don't you think? i don't even know if i have a space for you yet, and you're already lining up your holiday plans.

Name: jim
Line: oh, no, sorry. just, um, we're kind of planners. but we're also flexible too, so you know what? maybe we can just discuss it when the time comes.

Name: jerry
Line: yeah, if the time comes, we can discuss it.

Name: pam
Line: is this because jim walked in on you going to the bathroom?

Name: jim
Line: what?

Name: jerry
Line: seriously? you told her?

Name: jim
Line: did it? it might have come up while we were waiting for you.

Name: jerry
Line: and you - you thought that might have something to do with how the meeting is going?

Name: jim
Line: no.

Name: pam
Line: maybe, because it doesn't seem to be going super well.

Name: jerry
Line: well, you didn't consider the fact that it might not be going super well just because it might not be going super well?

Name: pam
Line: nope. 'cause we're really nice people but you don't seem to like us.

Name: jerry
Line: i'm being perfectly pleasant. did you ever consider that you might not be as charming as you think you are?

Name: jim
Line: oh, this coming from the guy who still uses a children's toilet? why didn't you just lock the door, man?

Name: jerry
Line: it doesn't lock for the children's safety.

Name: jim
Line: anybody could have walked in.

Name: jerry
Line: it was story time.

Name: michael
Line: sabre is changing everything. [michael and david sitting in hot tub] site blockers. they don't let us use cups. so i started thinking, who could handle this? who would know what to do? david wallace would know what to do. what should i do, david wallace?

Name: david
Line: i don't know. i mean, what can you do?

Name: michael
Line: exactly. what are you thinking?

Name: david
Line: i, i - it's a tough one.

Name: michael
Line: it is a tough one.

Name: david
Line: i don't have any ideas for you there.

Name: michael
Line: yeah. but one would be good.

Name: david
Line: hey, oh, okay. wait.

Name: michael
Line: okay.

Name: david
Line: i want to tell you about a business idea i have.

Name: michael
Line: okay.

Name: david
Line: ok? you know how kids leave their toys everywhere? okay. so this is a vacuum. it's like a shop-vac type of thing. [imitates vacuum] teaches kids how to pick up their own toys. right? baseball gloves, hacky sacks, drumsticks. [sucking noise] picks it up!

Name: michael
Line: so the kid's making the noise to pick it up.

Name: david
Line: no. no, no, no. that's the -that's the vacuum noise.

Name: michael
Line: oh, okay.

Name: david
Line: you-you don't like it.

Name: michael
Line: no, i think it is-

Name: david
Line: no, it's ok. another guy from dunder mifflin, arnie from research, he's gonna draw up the prototype. and, uh... it's like shop-vac. [sucking noise] did i say that?

Name: michael
Line: yep.

Name: david
Line: it'll be ok.

Name: andy
Line: hey, any fun weekend plans?

Name: erin
Line: no, you?

Name: andy
Line: uh, no, actually. so nothing? no movies, or parties, or anything you might want to invite someone to?

Name: erin
Line: nothing. it's wide open.

Name: andy
Line: okay.

Name: andy
Line: that's as hard as i can hint.

Name: david
Line: hey, you know, if you want, i'm sure i can get arnie on board if you wanted to join us for suck it. work together again.

Name: michael
Line: the what?

Name: david
Line: suck it. that's what it's called.

Name: michael
Line: oh, okay.

Name: david
Line: huh? catchy. kids'll love it.

Name: michael
Line: like it.

Name: michael
Line: there are very few things that would make me not want to team up with david wallace. and suck it is one of 'em.

Name: michael
Line: see you later. [hugs wallace]

Name: david
Line: oh, michael.

Name: michael
Line: bye now.

Name: david
Line: thank you for coming.

Name: michael
Line: thanks for having me.

Name: michael
Line: well, that's not the david wallace that i remember. [reverses out of driveway, wallace follows him] that is some sort of weird creature that lives in david wallace's house. oh, my god. alright. just get me out of here.

Name: michael
Line: hello. [comes in carrying 4 gallons of orange juice and his water bottle] is anybody home? oh, thank you, erin. now if everyone would please ready their canteens, so i can fill them with the sweet, sweet nectar of gabe's homeland, and then propose a toast. here we go.

Name: michael
Line: you know when people say getting fired was the best thing that ever happened to them? i feel sorry for those people. that's the best thing? really? ugh.

Name: michael
Line: well, i'm not really one for making speeches.

Name: everyone
Line: yes. yes, you are. you make a lot.

Name: michael
Line: but i feel pretty good right now. i really do. a lot better than i did earlier. let me tell you.

Name: angela
Line: that's your toast?

Name: michael
Line: no. this is my toast.  i think this whole thing with sabre is going to work out. i have a very good feeling about it.

Name: phyllis
Line: michael, this isn't a toast. you're just thinking out loud.

Name: michael
Line: here's my toast. orange juice is in here. and, like saber, it is from florida, and it is good.

Name: kevin
Line: just 'cause you have liquid that doesn't make it a toast.

Name: michael
Line: here's the toast. i'm gonna do it now. raise your container to us and to sabre.

Name: all
Line: to us and to sabre.

Name: michael
Line: mm. wow. that is metallicy. ugh. that's like drinking a battery. ah, really gets you in the fillings, doesn't it? okay, anyway, welcome.

Name: david
Line: [singing] well, it's a mess, what a mess. what you gonna do? you're going to take out your suck it and you suck it. suck it. yeah, take out your suck it and you suck it.

Name: teddy
Line: suck it!

Name: david
Line: yeah!

Name: teddy
Line: suck it!

Name: david
Line: yeah!

Name: teddy
Line: suck it!

Name: david
Line: yeah! take out the suck it and we'll...

Name: teddy
Line: suck it!

Name: david
Line: yeah!

Name: teddy
Line: suck it!

Name: david
Line: yeah!

Name: both
Line: take out my suck it and we'll suck it.

Name: david
Line: yeah! teddy!

Name: teddy
Line: yeah. [high-five each other]

Name: hotel employee
Line: [on phone] vancouver court hotel, how many i help you?

Name: michael
Line: hello vancouver, this is michael scott calling from the united states of america!  i have a reservation in your fair city from february 12th to the 19th, first week of the olympics.

Name: hotel employee
Line: well, we are looking forward to having you, so, let me just pull up your information here...

Name: michael
Line: okey doke.

Name: hotel employee
Line: um, i don't seem to have it, sir.

Name: michael
Line: what?

Name: dwight
Line: [looking through michael's email] i'm not seeing anything under "confirmation."

Name: michael
Line: no.

Name: dwight
Line: could it be under "affirmation?" cause you have thousands of those.

Name: michael
Line: no. [to hotel employee on phone] we're trying to look it up right now.

Name: dwight
Line: you [i]did[/i] get the e-vite to my barbeque!

Name: michael
Line: um, come on.

Name: dwight
Line: michael...

Name: hotel employee
Line: uh, sir? a lot of people are trying to get last-minute reservations at hotels here for the olympics, but we've been fully booked for months.

Name: michael
Line: well, i have been booked for three years, so you should have that. i've always heard that british columbia is a very nice place, but i am not getting that from this conversation.

Name: dwight
Line: wait, i got it! confirmation code: xv2rdm!

Name: hotel employee
Line: ...oh, here it is. yep.

Name: michael
Line: oh.

Name: dwight
Line: thank you.

Name: hotel employee
Line: uh-huh. seven nights in our street-view economy single?

Name: michael
Line: that's it!

Name: hotel employee
Line: yeah, we changed it since it was a while back. i do apologize.

Name: michael and dwight
Line: uh-huh, okay...

Name: hotel employee
Line: yeah, how may i help you mr. scott?

Name: michael
Line: alright, i would like to cancel my reservation, please.

Name: hotel employee
Line: there is a cancellation fee for this, sir.

Name: michael
Line: okay, put it on my card.

Name: michael
Line: today, jo bennett, the ceo from sabre, is coming to see us here for the first time. she bought us sight unseen, like a mail-order bride, so she's gotta be kinda nervous. i mean, are we ugly? are we smart? are we cool? are we too cool? do we speak english?

Name: michael
Line: [jo bennett enters with two humongous dogs, everyone stands to welcome her except dwight] why hello!

Name: gabe
Line: this is michael scott, co-regional manager of this branch.

Name: michael
Line: pleasure to meet you, miss bennett.

Name: jo
Line: oh, that's mrs. bennett, sweetheart. my husband and i are divorced, but i kept the "mrs." just to piss off the new wife. well, let's take a gander around this place.

Name: andy
Line: [jo's dogs are sniffing at his crotch] these sure are pretty dogs...

Name: jo
Line: they love a good crotch.

Name: andy
Line: they sure do.

Name: jo
Line: you should take that as a compliment!

Name: andy
Line: oh, i do!

Name: jo
Line: [to dwight] hello.

Name: dwight
Line: hello.

Name: jo
Line: do you always stay seated when a lady enters the room?

Name: dwight
Line: i am treating you the same as a man, for whom i would also not stand. unless it was the president. or judge judy.

Name: jo
Line: i like that.

Name: gabe
Line: this is accounting.

Name: kevin
Line: hi!

Name: jo
Line: good-looking group.

Name: gabe
Line: over here is meredith palmer and creed bratton.

Name: jo
Line: another couple of heartbreakers. who is this tall drink of sun tea?

Name: gabe
Line: that is jim halpert, he is the co-regional manager of this office.

Name: jo
Line: [gesturing to michael] i thought this guy was the manager?

Name: gabe
Line: oh, he is. he's the co-manager, and that's the other co-manager.

Name: jo
Line: two guys doing one job? we gotta do something about that!

Name: andy
Line: got some valentine's cards for my coworkers and my bro-workers.

Name: angela
Line: [as andy is passing her a card] no, no!

Name: kevin
Line: what, no candy?

Name: andy
Line: valentine's day, right around the corner. erin and i have been on zero dates. so i got her a valentine's day card, but i didn't wanna seem "too eager," so i got cards for everyone in the whole office to kind of dilute it a little bit.

Name: andy
Line: [throwing a card at meredith, which skims her throat]: look alive.

Name: meredith
Line: ow! geez, you gave me a paper cut on my throat!

Name: meredith
Line: yeah, i have this thing about men cutting or threatening to cut my throat. don't try to cut my throat.

Name: michael
Line: jo, i don't know how things work in florida, which from your description sounds like a colorful, lawless swamp, but here it takes two men to do one job, where in florida it might take one very strong woman to do such a job.

Name: jim
Line: whoa, whoa.

Name: michael
Line: whoa, whoa!

Name: jim
Line: i'll take over. um, what we're doing here: michael handles more of the "big-picture" stuff, and i handle more of the day-to-day stuff, so together...

Name: jo
Line: yeah. i think i understand.

Name: jim
Line: alright.

Name: jo
Line: each of you is doing half a job.

Name: jim
Line: no.

Name: michael
Line: and sometimes i can hardly handle that!

Name: jo
Line: this is knucklehead talk. i'm not gonna bite it, you know. you can't give me gravy and tell me it's jelly, because gravy ain't sweet! is it, jim?

Name: jim
Line: i don't think so.

Name: jo
Line: michael?

Name: michael
Line: forget the question...

Name: jo
Line: i think one of you should return to sales, and the other one be manager.

Name: michael
Line: i humbly accept the management position.

Name: jim
Line: i... why would you just say something like that?

Name: michael
Line: because, well, jim. where i'm from, two types of folk: those who ain't, and those who are knee-high on a grasshopper. which type ain't you ain't? ya'll come back now.

Name: jim
Line: do you even know what that means?

Name: michael
Line: yes.

Name: jo
Line: well, i'm gonna let this marinate. so you can go.

Name: jim
Line: um...

Name: jo
Line: you can go on. shoo!

Name: jo
Line: i'm jolene bennett, jo for short. i'm a breast cancer survivor, close, personal friends with nancy pelosi, and truman capote and i slept with three of the same guys. when i was a little girl, i was terrified to fly, and now i have my own pilot's license. i am ceo of sabre international, and i sell the best damn printers and all-in-one machines korea can make. pleased to meet you.

Name: andy
Line: [almost running into erin] whoa-oh, traffic jam!

Name: erin
Line: uh-oh, traffic jam on route three!

Name: andy
Line: [imitating car noises] beep-beep! beeooop-beep!

Name: erin
Line: beep! twenty people dead in a pile-up!

Name: andy
Line: there's blood everywhere! um, i got you a valentine's card.

Name: erin
Line: [opening card] oh, you did? aw, a bird and a dog!

Name: andy
Line: yeah, well it's snoopy and woodstock.

Name: erin
Line: you named them?

Name: andy
Line: uh, charles schultz did. i thought it was relevant cause i got you all those birds for christmas, remember?

Name: erin
Line: uh, yeah i do remember. [reading card] aw, they love each other.

Name: andy
Line: oh, look at that. they sure do. i hadn't noticed.

Name: erin
Line: wow, it smells really good too.

Name: andy
Line: yeah! it's roger federer for men, i sprayed some in there.

Name: erin
Line: andy, whoa! thank you very much!

Name: andy
Line: it's got pheromones in it.

Name: jo
Line: hey!

Name: kevin
Line: hi.

Name: jo
Line: [to angela, who's having a hard time deciding on a chair] just choosing seats, not getting married. chop, chop little onion!

Name: kevin
Line: jo, there's books in my chair.

Name: jo
Line: that's right, darlin', now you're the proud new owner of a sabre handbook and my autobiography. now, you all must be in a tizzy. i can see it on your faces, i mean, what's going on now? i mean, who owns dunder mifflin? right? i mean, sabre? what's that? some company i've never heard of? down in tallahassee? where is that? near mars?

Name: michael
Line: no, we know. texas!

Name: jo
Line: now dunder mifflin has an arm's reach in all these small businesses all over the northeast. now we're gonna take that arm, and we're gonna start selling printers.

Name: michael
Line: i could manage my way around that.

Name: jo
Line: they're the easiest-to-use printers on the market.

Name: michael
Line: i will try to manage my excitement!

Name: michael
Line: i have been saying the word "manager" a lot, so whenever jo thinks "manager" she thinks of me. camel cigarettes did the same thing with joe camel by making him look like a penis. i can't even go near a cigarette now without thinking of a penis. and vise-versa.

Name: jo
Line: i think that's it. so we're all good! [many employees raise their hands] thanks ya'll.

Name: dwight
Line: [jo leaves] i, uh...

Name: kelly
Line: [reading her valentine's card from andy] oh my god.

Name: kelly
Line: i guess andy likes me. i never thought of him in that way. but, i guess in most romantic comedies, the guy you're supposed to be with is the one you never thought of in that way. you might have even thought he was annoying or possibly homosexual.

Name: pam
Line: so, check this out. according to the handbook, you could make more money as a salesman than as a manager. they have all these incentive programs. i ran your numbers from last year.

Name: jim
Line: this is way more than i make now.

Name: jim
Line: i don't think i'm gonna miss being manager. you know how some people say they're not in it for the money? well, with all due respect to this job, i think i'm definitely in it for the money. and quite honestly, the women.

Name: jim
Line: hey, you got a second?

Name: michael
Line: sure. you here to tell me that you think i would be a better manager and that you are sorry for being such a jerk?

Name: jim
Line: actually, yeah.

Name: michael
Line: what?

Name: jim
Line: exactly that. i think that you absolutely deserve the manager position more than i do.

Name: michael
Line: what? really?

Name: jim
Line: yeah!

Name: michael
Line: wow!

Name: michael
Line: la la la, hello oscar!

Name: oscar
Line: michael. reading.

Name: michael
Line: what are you reading?

Name: oscar
Line: the atlantic.

Name: michael
Line: oh, that is my favorite ocean! i love it! i am so happy right now. no! i can't keep it a secret any longer. jim is stepping down to salesman, i am going to be the sole manager once again.

Name: oscar
Line: i should step into sales myself.

Name: michael
Line: why, is there an untapped gay market?

Name: oscar
Line: sabre has no caps on commissions. he can make a lot more money in sales.

Name: michael
Line: ...where did you get that information.

Name: oscar
Line: manual.

Name: michael
Line: manuel who?

Name: michael
Line: well, according to the manual, there is no cap on commissions. i have been hustled.

Name: michael
Line: son of a bitch. [enters conference room] pardon me.

Name: jo
Line: oh, speak of the devil. we were just talking about you. have a seat!

Name: michael
Line: okay.

Name: jo
Line: now jim here is thinking about taking himself out of the running for being manager.

Name: michael
Line: really? aw, that is so sweet of you! but, i cannot accept, because i have been thinking about it, and i think i wanna go back to sales.

Name: jo
Line: really?

Name: jim
Line: really.

Name: michael
Line: yeah. you can take the man out of the salesman, but you can't take the sales out of salesman.

Name: jo
Line: well, i think you're both being a little too modest.

Name: jim
Line: no, i really, really think michael is better at being manager for so many reasons.

Name: michael
Line: no, i think i would be bad. i would sleep in my office, and i would sexually harass people.

Name: jim
Line: why would you do that?

Name: michael
Line: i'm turning myself in right now!

Name: jo
Line: you know, michael, you have more experience in sales and management, so i'm gonna defer to your judgment.

Name: michael
Line: thank you.

Name: jo
Line: i think you [to michael] will become the salesman, and congratulations! [to jim] you're gonna be the new manager of this branch!

Name: michael
Line: great! that's great. congratulations. have fun signing my commission checks, boss.

Name: pam
Line: [pointing to the window in michael's office] oh, michael marked his heights. he's grown!

Name: jim
Line: mm!

Name: dwight
Line: [on phone] bobcat, this is dragon. listen. he's been promoted to sole manager. we've got to step this up. meet me behind the dumpster in ninety seconds. [hangs up phone] 89... 88...

Name: dwight
Line: you're twenty minutes late!

Name: ryan
Line: [walking up] um, i was at another dumpster!

Name: dwight
Line: just admit you lost track of time.

Name: dwight
Line: ryan and i have been meeting up to work on our diabolical plot against jim. ryan is always late for our meetings. i wish i had a lair.

Name: ryan
Line: did you see saw?

Name: dwight
Line: of course i seesaw. mose and i seesaw all the time.

Name: ryan
Line: no, uh, the movie. did you see the movie saw?

Name: dwight
Line: oh, yeah. great film. almost as fun as going on a seesaw.

Name: ryan
Line: okay, the reason these movies are so popular, is the element of psychological torment.

Name: dwight
Line: i like where you're going with this. continue.

Name: ryan
Line: could we lure him into an old warehouse or something?

Name: dwight
Line: i have an old barn!

Name: ryan
Line: yes!

Name: dwight
Line: it's kinda smelly, but that might be a plus! and then what?

Name: ryan
Line: we do what they did in saw! ... i mean, we don't kill him, obviously. i have a mask...

Name: dwight
Line: okay, that's your idea? exactly like in the movie!? that is the most idiotic thing i have ever heard in my life!

Name: ryan
Line: well suggest something else then! don't just...

Name: dwight
Line: he's supposed to cut his leg off? think!

Name: ryan
Line: don't just criticize my idea!

Name: dwight
Line: think!

Name: ryan
Line: you think of something then!

Name: erin
Line: michael, i'm worried that, uh, not all your toys are gonna fit on your new desk.

Name: michael
Line: how is that possible?

Name: erin
Line: well, in your old office there were all those ledges and extra space.

Name: michael
Line: no excuses erin, come on! make it happen.

Name: erin
Line: you know, i actually think i should get back to work. jim asked me to do some stuff, and he's manager.

Name: michael
Line: oh, yeah. fine, fine. leave it here. i have to make some sales anyway. who should i call with my magic sales fingers? [michael's phone rings] michael scott, head of sales.

Name: jim
Line: [on phone] you gotta do something, man. you can't just sit there.

Name: dwight
Line: the new it guy. nick.

Name: ryan
Line: nick.

Name: dwight
Line: i think he is the key. he's very trusting, he's looking for friends, he has been given an awesome amount of power, and does not know how to wield it.

Name: ryan
Line: like frodo!

Name: dwight
Line: why don't you just let me handle the tolkien references, okay dumb jock?

Name: ryan
Line: well, i think he can be corrupted. like gollum.

Name: dwight
Line: smeagol was corrupted and became gollum.

Name: dwight
Line: i might start a diabolical plot against him after this one.

Name: erin
Line: who's hungry?

Name: jim
Line: what is that?

Name: erin
Line: it's ants on a log. michael would always have me bring them in at 2:30 and say "who's hungry?"

Name: jim
Line: oh. i'm fine. thank you, though.

Name: erin
Line: do you want me to spin you in your chair and make you dizzy?

Name: jim
Line: why would i wanna do that?

Name: erin
Line: it's a thinking technique. all the top executives do it. it keeps the brain moving, and a spinning brain is a working brain.

Name: jim
Line: for now, i'm just gonna go back to work here...

Name: erin
Line: oh sure.

Name: jim
Line: yeah. thank you.

Name: erin
Line: well.

Name: michael
Line: [on phone] it will be a pleasure doing business with you. thanks, bye. [hangs up phone, blows train whistle] i just got a new account for the gentleman's club in carbondale. it is called "curves." i went by there the other day, saw some of the women walking in. not really my cup of tea. actually, kevin, you might like it!

Name: kevin
Line: nice!

Name: dwight
Line: you know, we really don't announce out loud our sales that much.

Name: michael
Line: why not? it's part of the sales experience.

Name: dwight
Line: it's not really 1992 anymore.

Name: michael
Line: well, okay...

Name: kelly
Line: [reading andy's card] you brighten my day with the sound of your voice, you bring so much laughter and love, you're everything to me, and i was so blessed when god sent you here to me.

Name: erin
Line: geez louise.

Name: kelly
Line: i know, obsessed with me much?

Name: erin
Line: well, everyone got one.

Name: kelly
Line: what did yours say?

Name: erin
Line: friends are worth sharing a doghouse with.

Name: erin
Line: it's no wonder that andy gave kelly such a romantic card. i can't compete with her. that girl can sing, and dance, and gets all of her clothes at the mall. and i feel like such a fool for thinking that andy was only going after one girl, cause andy bernard is a playboy. and, why shouldn't he be? he's got it all.

Name: dwight
Line: ho-ho. there he is, the it guy. so you discovered the break room.

Name: nick
Line: uh, yep.

Name: dwight
Line: i imagine one of the best things about being an it guy is, you get to know everyone's computer passwords.

Name: nick
Line: no, i actually don't.

Name: dwight
Line: listen, i know you have to say that, but we got a little problem here. there is an employee named jim halpert, and he is doing some terrible things, okay? he is molesting people via the internet. and we need to stop him.

Name: nick
Line: i think that you should call the cops.

Name: dwight
Line: no, the cops called us. so i'm gonna need you to give me the password to jim halpert's computer.

Name: nick
Line: i don't know what to tell you, man. i'm sorry, i just can't give out his password like that.

Name: ryan
Line: nick. we could make things very, very difficult for you.

Name: nick
Line: are you... you threatening me?

Name: ryan
Line: threatening you? no. [tries to crush an aluminum can, dwight  crushes an apple]

Name: michael
Line: what is that smell? do you smell that? what is that? like a sulfur deposit under here?

Name: pam
Line: michael, stop.

Name: michael
Line: no, i'm serious, we don't have to put up... is it the dogs?

Name: pam
Line: michael...

Name: michael
Line: you know what, we don't have to deal with this. i am going to google sulfur maps.

Name: dwight
Line: michael, it's phyllis.

Name: michael
Line: no, this is geological.

Name: phyllis
Line: i sent an email out to everyone in this area that this might be a side effect to my new allergy medication i'm on.

Name: michael
Line: are you kidding me?

Name: phyllis
Line: no.

Name: michael
Line: and you guys are okay with this?

Name: dwight
Line: she sent an email, so.

Name: phyllis
Line: i did.

Name: andy
Line: [has two tissues in his nostrils] it's not cause of the smell. i'm just expecting a nosebleed.

Name: michael
Line: oh my god.

Name: kelly
Line: oh! you scared me!

Name: andy
Line: i'm sorry, i thought you saw me.

Name: kelly
Line: i didn't see you. and you were there all along. [takes papers out of copy machine] well, i warmed it up for you so, should be good to go.

Name: andy
Line: cool, thanks.

Name: kelly
Line: bye, andy. [kisses his cheek]

Name: andy
Line: ...that was weird.

Name: meredith
Line: no it ain't. we all saw the valentine you gave her.

Name: andy
Line: i don't even know what that card said.

Name: meredith
Line: believe me, if i got that card? we'd be in the bathroom doin' it right... now.

Name: michael
Line: hey.

Name: jim
Line: hey.

Name: michael
Line: you know, it's funny. i used to stand in here and wish i was out there. now i'm out there, and i wish i was in here.

Name: jim
Line: well, the grass is always greener.

Name: michael
Line: yeah. except there's no grass out there. it's just a farty dirt patch.

Name: jim
Line: well, it's what you wanted.

Name: michael
Line: i really need my job back. we made a terrible mistake here.

Name: jim
Line: for the record, i fought this. alright? and now, i'm not really sure what we do.

Name: michael
Line: we make a poster that says "happy opposite day!" and she sees it on the way out... nah, that's stupid. ugh! i wish we had one of those amnesia flashlights from men in black.

Name: jim
Line: hey, what was that movie where their boss was within earshot and they could've just gone and talked to her.

Name: michael
Line: lethal weapon?

Name: jim
Line: that's it. i think we should do it the lethal weapon way.

Name: jo
Line: you two are grown-ass men. what do i have to do, fire you and get two people in here who don't need so much management?

Name: michael
Line: what? what i'm saying...

Name: jim
Line: michael's saying he's better at being manager, and i agree, cause he's a better people person, weirdly.

Name: michael
Line: and weirdly i'm a good dog person, right guys? [dogs go to him] see? they love me.

Name: jo
Line: fine. i don't care which one of you does which job, just stop meeting with me to talk about it.

Name: jim
Line: alright.

Name: michael
Line: alright!

Name: jo
Line: [cell phone rings] oh, i gotta take this. yep. uh, finish walking my dogs for me. and don't ride 'em. lotta people try to ride 'em.

Name: andy
Line: [erin leaves room] excuse me? everyone? please check your emails, i just sent you the following message: "coworkers, you may have received a valentine from me. please understand this does not mean that i like you in any way."

Name: phyllis
Line: you don't even like us as friends?

Name: andy
Line: phyllis, you guys are like my closest friends. i just mean i don't like-like you.

Name: oscar
Line: what are we, five?

Name: andy
Line: "please don't read into this card. yours in professionalism, nard dog."

Name: kelly
Line: [entering with erin] um, why did i just receive a mass email from you that said that you don't like me? do you realize how hard that makes me like you, andy?

Name: andy
Line: it's n-- that wasn't... i like someone else.

Name: kelly
Line: who?

Name: andy
Line: it's not... whether or not, you...

Name: kelly
Line: who, what?

Name: erin
Line: yeah, i guess andy never liked kelly. how about that?

Name: michael
Line: oh, it smells good in here.

Name: erin
Line: sure does! okay, we have your space heater, your humidifier, your dehumidifier, your fan, your foot fan, and your food dehydrator.

Name: michael
Line: erin, what about my keyboard? [erin hits a button on an electronic keyboard, playing a beat] aw, so good to be home. how about a little bosa nova?

Name: erin
Line: oh! [hits another key, they awkwardly dance together]

Name: pam
Line: [gesturing to michael dancing in his office] he looks happy.

Name: jim
Line: yep.

Name: dwight
Line: well, well, well. hm. boss for, what was it? oh, four and a half hours? new record. low. previous record? henry rosston. boss for nine years, four months. and he only left because he had family matters to attend to and he [jim dunks dwight's tie in his coffee cup, pam smiles] what? michael!

Name: dwight
Line: [entering elevator with ryan] i can't help but think that something we did made this possible.

Name: ryan
Line: jim dug his own grave, but maybe we provided the shovel.

Name: dwight
Line: oh temp, i like that. i'm going to engrave that into a piece of wood. care to celebrate with a drink?

Name: ryan
Line: i would love to. [elevator doors close, then reopen in the lobby] why not?

Name: dwight
Line: because! martini bars are pretentious. no thank you.

Name: ryan
Line: well, i'm sorry that i don't want farm boy swill like you do, you know.

Name: dwight
Line: it is not "farm boy swill," i will show you. it is beet vodka and it is delicious.

Name: ryan
Line: i am not interested in anything i have to make myself!

Name: pam
Line: [on the phone with a client] i just wanted to check and see if there's anything you needed before i went on my maternity leave...  yeah, i'm pregnant...  great, well, i'll write up the order.  okay, thanks.

Name: dwight
Line: wait a minute!  you can't do that.  you cannot exploit your baby for sales.

Name: jim
Line: [on the phone] hey, did i tell you we were going to have a baby?  oh, thank you very much.  i'm excited.  oh, definitely.

Name: dwight
Line: no, no!  you need to come by your sales honorably!

Name: pam
Line: there is nothing dishonorable about talking about your life.  people like it.

Name: dwight
Line: [on the phone with a client]  hey there.  dwight schrute here.  listen, uh, would you be interested in restocking on paper? ...  yeah, i could sure use the money.  my cousin, uh, came down with a case of that nasty new goat fungus.  oh, it's just horrific.  the  doctor says he'd never seen it beard so quickly.  okay.

Name: dwight
Line: i need a baby.  i'll never outsell jim and pam without one.  also, i've been noticing a gaping hole in my life.  sometimes i wake up cradling a gourd.

Name: pam
Line: kevin, you're such a gourmand.

Name: kevin
Line: i cooked my way through julia childs' cookbook, and now, i'm halfway through the twilight cookbook.  last night, i had edward's corn flake chicken.

Name: pam
Line: hmm.

Name: kevin
Line: pregnant pam and i, we get hungry at the same times, so we've been eating together a lot.  not all meals.  just second breakfast, lunch, second lunch, and first dinner.

Name: kevin
Line: i thought that maybe we should do something special for early dinner.  one last ultra feast.

Name: pam
Line: mmmm, that sounds great.  what are you thinking?

Name: kevin
Line: i think it should be a surprise.

Name: meredith
Line: [after pam has a contraction]  oh, getting there, huh?

Name: pam
Line: no, no.  i still have time.

Name: pam
Line: i'm having contractions, but they're irregular and far apart.  so i'm not really in labor, i'm near labor.

Name: jim
Line: yeah, we're slow-playing it because of our stupid hmo.

Name: pam
Line: if we check in after midnight, i get an extra day to recuperate surrounded by doctors.

Name: jim
Line: not to mention the extra night's sleep in the hospital will be very nice because once we bring the baby home, if it's crying all night, one of us is going to have to take care of it.  and i do not plan on helping unless it's a boy.

Name: pam
Line: i cannot wait for that joke to be over.

Name: pam
Line: ooh.

Name: michael
Line: oh, oh, oh!  contraption!  she's contrapting!  okay, you know what?  i think i should drive you guys to the hospital, and here is why.  i am a licensed, classy driver in the state of pennsylvania.  i gassed up the car...

Name: jim
Line: michael.

Name: michael
Line: actually, i put diesel in this time, trying to save some money.

Name: jim
Line: michael, you shouldn't have done that.

Name: michael
Line: happy to do it.  also, i did a heck of a job baby-proofing this office.

Name: pam
Line: you know the baby's not going to live here, right?

Name: michael
Line: well, the baby was conceived here, so might as well live here a little bit, too.

Name: jim
Line: hmm, that logic's air-tight, but unfortunately it wasn't conceived here.  burning man, port-o-potty.

Name: michael
Line: oh, yuck!  tmi!  how was it?  i don't want to know.  tell me later.  let's go!  let's go!  hospital!

Name: pam
Line: okay, okay, we're not going to the hospital.  we are waiting until midnight.

Name: erin
Line: ooh, spooky.  but why?

Name: jim
Line: because the insurance company only covers two nights.

Name: pam
Line: everything's fine.  we have plenty of time.

Name: nick
Line: well, you don't want to wait too long, pam.  otherwise the baby's going to become a teenager in there and you'll be up all night, from the rock music.

Name: michael
Line: shut up, nick.  what a weird thing to say.  weird i.t. nerd.  don't get revenge on me, nerd.

Name: angela
Line: [as nick looks over at her]  what are you looking at?

Name: dwight
Line: ha, nerd.

Name: kelly
Line: did you know that labor can last weeks?  then they take your insides out and they just plop them on a table, and sometimes epidurals don't work, and you can poop yourself.

Name: dwight
Line: [with angela in the break room]  bare my child.

Name: angela
Line: excuse me?

Name: dwight
Line: i want to have a child for business reasons and i want you to be the mother.  if you agree, say nothing.  if you disagree, say anything...  very well.  let's meet at 4:00 pm at our old meeting spot and bang it out.

Name: jim
Line: [after pam has another contraction]  that's seven minutes.  here we go.  this is happening.  come on.

Name: pam
Line: hold on, hold on.  it isn't midnight yet.

Name: jim
Line: are you serious?  pam.

Name: pam
Line: no, the doctor said every five to seven minutes.

Name: jim
Line: i...  pam, please.

Name: pam
Line: i'm going to be okay, we should really try to make it until midnight.

Name: andy
Line: yeah, no, you really should.  because if your baby's born tomorrow, he's going to have the same birthday as butt-mud brooks.  my old roommate.

Name: pam
Line: did you hear that?  butt-mud brooks.

Name: jim
Line: okay, but we are leaving at five minutes apart.

Name: pam
Line: five minutes apart.

Name: jim
Line: so, the plan was seven minutes.  but we're calling an audible, because that's her call.  because she's the quarterback.  i'm just the left tackle who happened to get her pregnant.

Name: pam
Line: okay, stop watching me.

Name: jim
Line: okay, crazy.  i think i have some better things to do with my day than worry about you, like sell printers.

Name: pam
Line: mm-hmm.

Name: jim
Line: well not until friday 20% off toner cartridges, that's a big deal.  while we're on the subject, why don't i just run you down to the hospital and we'll just do a quick check?

Name: pam
Line: not until midnight.

Name: andy
Line: guys.  word of advice.  speaking as a former baby.  don't get too hung up on baby names.  i was named walter jr. after my father until i was about six or so, when my parents changed their minds.

Name: erin
Line: i thought you said your younger brother was named walter jr.

Name: andy
Line: my brother was born, and my parents felt he better exemplified the walter jr. name, so they gave it to him.  i was given andrew, which they got out of a baby name book.

Name: jim
Line: you know, it's getting real crowded in here.  maybe you guys should all go back to work because the day's not out yet.

Name: michael
Line: no, no, no, no, no.  you know what?  you can't tell us what to do because you are not co-manager anymore.

Name: jim
Line: [as andy and kevin shout "yeah!" in response to michael] okay, i feel like this noise is going to prevent pam from being able to listen to her body's signals.

Name: pam
Line: actually, the distractions are good.  i mean, i don't think i'm going to make it until midnight if i'm just sitting here thinking about it.

Name: michael
Line: distractions are good!  that means conference room, five minutes!  no, no, five seconds!  right now, right now!  conference room!  topic, potpourri!  let's go!

Name: michael
Line: um, i am sort of a master of distraction.  when i was a kid, my mom received compliments left and right from my teachers on how i was always able to distract others in class.  try to think, what were the first thirteen colonies?  mm-hmm, mm-hmm.  [michael covers his mouth and makes fart noises.]

Name: michael
Line: the purpose for this meeting is to take pam's mind off of what's going on inside of her body.

Name: andy
Line: can we do sleight of hand tricks?

Name: michael
Line: i will allow that.

Name: andy
Line: yes!  can anyone do those?

Name: stanley
Line: i'm going to go look at the internet.

Name: jim
Line: [as pam has another contraction]  oh!  oh, alright.  that's a good one.

Name: pam
Line: oh, okay, uh, sorry, guys.  just, um, keep talking.

Name: michael
Line: okay.

Name: kelly
Line: oh my god, pam, you are a woman warrior.

Name: pam
Line: oh, thanks, kelly.

Name: michael
Line: does anybody have anything?  anything interesting, any hobbies, uh, special skills?

Name: pam
Line: yes, this is the only time i'm ever going to make this request.

Name: michael
Line: yes, phyl?

Name: phyllis
Line: i can put on lipstick the way molly ringwald does in the breakfast club.

Name: michael
Line: [ as pam shakes her head] nope, nope, i don't think anybody wants to see that.

Name: andy
Line: i can do the evolution of dance-dance.

Name: michael
Line: [as pam gives the thumbs up]  that sounds good!  do you need some music, or...?  okay.

Name: andy
Line: nope, actually music would just throw me off.  i need complete silence.  okay...  [pam begins to clap as andy dances]  you're clapping.  i need complete silence.  totally threw me off, so i'm going to have to start over.  evolution of dance-dance.

Name: ryan
Line: [reading from a book as kelly admires]  "you let me in your bed.  but now, i sleep alone.  trapped with the forgotten in my detritus home."

Name: erin
Line: [naming race horses]  affirmed.  seattle slew.  secretariat.  citation.  assault.  count fleet.  whirlaway.  war admiral.  omaha.  gallant fox...  and...  i know this.  uh...  the jockey was johnny loftus.  sired by star shoot.

Name: angela
Line: good afternoon.

Name: dwight
Line: have a seat.

Name: angela
Line: what is this?

Name: dwight
Line: before we conceive a child, uh, it is important that we bang out a parenting contract.

Name: angela
Line: of course.

Name: dwight
Line: it's been a long time since we've come down here separately.

Name: angela
Line: you know i was thinking...

Name: dwight
Line: now, then.  let's get to it, shall we?  item one:  [speaking into a voice recorder] child will be breast fed by the mother for exactly six months, then weaned onto a nutrient-rich winter vegetable mash provided by the father, dwight schrute, hereafter referred to as morpheus.  agreed?

Name: angela
Line: agreed.

Name: michael
Line: [as pam has another contraction]  where are we?  we have every six minutes, ladies and gentlemen.  another seventy five contractions and you are going to be there.

Name: kevin
Line: for the love of god, pam, do it for ultra feast!

Name: jim
Line: okay, you know what?  i'm going to go give, uh, doctor asmani a quick call.  he'd probably know...

Name: pam
Line: jim, please.  happy thoughts here.  happy times.

Name: michael
Line: yeah, happy times.  come on.  let's have happy times.

Name: jim
Line: alright.

Name: michael
Line: jim, as a matter of fact, i have printed out ten ways to induce labor.  and i'm thinking we just do the opposite of those things and we can slow down your labor.  erin, read the first one.

Name: erin
Line: um, stimulate the nipples.

Name: michael
Line: okay, nobody touch pam's nipples.  think of pam's nipples as toby's grundle.

Name: kevin
Line: her shirt is touching them.  maybe we should cut holes in her shirt.

Name: meredith
Line: i have a shirt like that in my car.

Name: michael
Line: okay, yeah, why don't you go get it?

Name: erin
Line: okay, uh, the second one is walk around.  we're already doing the opposite of that.  perfect.  okay, number three, eat spicy foods.

Name: michael
Line: okay, the opposite of that?

Name: kevin
Line: stick spicy food up her butt.

Name: jim
Line: nope, nope, nope, nope.  come on, let's go to the hospital.  pam, let's go to the hospital right now.

Name: pam
Line: jim, jim, honey, i love you, but you're really distracting me from my distractions.

Name: jim
Line: mm-hmm.  okay, great.  well, sorry.

Name: pam
Line: why don't you go do some work?

Name: jim
Line: great.  i will do that.  sorry, pam, i just feel a little bit frazzled.  and you know how very rarely i use that word.  frazzled.

Name: pam
Line: i know, you don't like to be frazzled.

Name: jim
Line: no, i don't.

Name: pam
Line: okay.

Name: jim
Line: oh, and by the way, hate that you're helping her with this right now.  totally.

Name: michael
Line: ooh, someone's freakin'.

Name: andy
Line: a little frazzled.

Name: michael
Line: i think he is.

Name: jim
Line: i know pam better than anyone in this office, and obviously she's gone crazy, but everybody wants to say that i'm crazy.  but i'm not crazy, she's crazy.  i'm not crazy, she's crazy.  [reading from various books]  five to seven minutes.  five to seven minutes.  six minutes.  different, but not really.  five to seven minutes.

Name: dwight
Line: acceptable names include and are limited to:  ebenezer.

Name: angela
Line: jedediah.

Name: dwight
Line: jonas.

Name: angela
Line: jedediah.

Name: dwight
Line: warf.

Name: angela
Line: no star trek names.

Name: dwight
Line: okay.  fine.

Name: angela
Line: what if it's a girl?

Name: dwight
Line: irrelevant question.  section 5a, child shall be male.

Name: angela
Line: hey.  uh-uh.  i cannot control that.  you can't put that in here.

Name: dwight
Line: yes you can.

Name: angela
Line: no.

Name: dwight
Line: it's as simple as keeping the womb extremely warm for two days after sex, and then extremely cold for five months.

Name: angela
Line: absolutely not.

Name: jim
Line: [pam approaches as he sits in his car]  hey.

Name: pam
Line: hey.  i'm not going to get in the car, because i know if i do you'll try to drive me to the hospital.

Name: jim
Line: ah, you know me too well.

Name: pam
Line: okay, jim.

Name: jim
Line: yeah?  ...  oh.

Name: pam
Line: everything is fine.  you don't have to worry.  try not to think about it.  she's not coming out for a while, okay?

Name: jim

Line: hello jo.

Name: jo

Line: hmm.

Name: michael

Name: michael

Name: michael
Line: [speaking at a staff meeting] first up, the lost and found has gone missing. it itself is lost, so please, try not to lose anything until we find it. ah, pet day. if you don't have a pet, please don't feel like -

Name: michael

Name: dwight
Line: listen, michael - about what happened earlier.

Line: yeah.

Name: dwight
Line: salesman is king. as the best salesman, i am king of kings. oh, you say jesus is king of kings? well. what does that say to you about how i think of myself?

[angela, kevin and oscar applaud]

Name: stanley
Line: we need those leads, michael. it's our job michael. michael!

Name: michael

Name: miichael

Name: gabe

Name: michael
Line: exactly that.

Name: gabe
Line: good.

Name: michael
Line: exactly that.

Name: jim

Line: hey, alright.

Line: alright.

Line: ahh, these aren't leads. what are they?

Line: oh, right, those are clues. and within each clue is a lesson. you learn a lesson, and then you find a lead. the leads are scattered all over the industrial park. i am trying to make your kids respect you. because a father needs to respect his boss, and kids don't respect the father who doesn't respect the boss. do you understand that line of logic?

Line: i don't think you understand -

Name: michael

Name: jim
Line: oh my god, i couldn't envy you more.

Name: jim
Line: having a baby is as exhausting as they say it is. having two babies [holds up index cards] - that's just unfair.

Name: jim

Name: pam
Line: he means his mopey place, it's under that streetlamp that he thinks was in casablanca.

Name: jim
Line: i love you.

Name: michael
Line: today i turned an office crisis into a teachable moment. [cuts to jim fishing one of the leads out of a catering size tin of ravioli] a lesser manager would have screwed this day up royally [clue next to jim reads: 'now that's italian!'] some yokel sitting behind his desk saying take a lead, learn nothing [cut to scenes of chaos as everyone argues] some people shouldn't be in this business.

Name: andy
Line: hey. i guess you probably won't give me your leads since i'm a jerk salesman.

Name: erin
Line: yeah. i basically wish you were dead. [grins] i hid the leads.

Name: andy
Line: where?

Name: erin
Line: [mimes zipping mouth and throwing away key, andy begins to walk away] colder. colder. warmer. warmer. colder. colder. warmer. warmer. warmer. hot. [andy hovers his hands above her chest] hotter. pretty hot. lower.

Name: andy
Line: are you...

Name: erin
Line: lower.

Name: andy
Line: are you sure?

Name: erin

Name: jim
Line: michael's stupid scavenger hunt.

Line: scavenger hunt? here. i can solve it. give it. [grabs card] 'the treasure you seek is in the parking lot under the first president.'

Name: jim
Line: [taps car] lincoln.

Name: dwight

Name: jim

Name: dwight
Line: the leads are in?

Name: dwight
Line: michael? michael, you were supposed to tell me when the leads came in.

Name: michael
Line: well, bigshot, 'if you want to find your leads, go to the man who never breathes'.

Name: dwight
Line: kevin! damnit [runs over to kevin's desk] kevin, give me those leads. where are they? c'mon -

Name: kevin
Line: you are never going to find them.

Name: dwight
Line: really.

Name: kevin
Line: i'm going to enjoy this.

Name: dwight
Line: [begins to strangle him] gimme the leads. where are my leads?

Name: kevin
Line: [muffled] i'm still enjoying  it.

Name: dwight
Line: where are they?

Name: kevin
Line: turn the trash. turn the trash.

Name: dwight
Line: turn the trash [releases him - kevin coughs] it's code. alright, meredith, take off your dress.

Name: meredith
Line: [stands up and reaches for her buttons] okey-dokey.

Name: kevin
Line: no, dear god, no, it's in the trash can. in the kitchen.

Line: it's coming off anyway.

Name: dwight

Name: kevin
Line: what -

Line: if we don't patronise the only syrian restaurant in town, there'll be nothing left but pan pizzas and make-your-own salads.

Name: dwight

Name: michael
Line: wait. what day is today?

Name: kevin
Line: um, tonight is ghost whisperer. so, friday.

Name: michael
Line: oh my god. oh my god [takes off running] oh my god, no, no no, hey, hey [chases after garbage van] wait, wait!

Name: michael
Line: okay. you know what, let's just go to the dump, start looking - ryan, c'mon, shotgun in my car -

Name: phyllis
Line: michael, why would we all go to the dump?

Name: michael
Line: why? because i am not going to call sabre and say, 'hi, you know those very valuable expensive leads that you gave us earlier today? well, because of a screw-up by a staff member, they're now in the city dump."

Name: stanley
Line: not your staff, michael. you.

Name: michael
Line: well, that's not the way it's going t sound. here's what we're going to do. we'll go to the dump, we'll look around, then we'll all go out and get pizza, maybe catch a movie, late-night drink, some more pizza, call it a night. what do you -

Name: toby
Line: does it have to be pizza? could go for a, falafel?

Name: michael
Line: really?

Name: angela
Line: i'm not going. you did this, not us.

Name: michael
Line: okay, no, you encouraged it. you were complicit [looks to jim for vocab-reassurance] complicit. you were all successories!

Name: darryl
Line: that sounds fun, mucking around in the dump. wish i could go.

Name: michael
Line: you can.

Name: darryl
Line: i can't. you know that.

Name: michael
Line: okay fine, i get it. i'll just go by myself.

Line: i'll go, michael. you'll just screw it up.

Name: dwight
Line: [looks around dump] this place has gone to hell.

Name: michael
Line: you know, dwight, there was a time when you'd be pinching yourself to have the opportunity to look through a dump with me.

Name: dwight
Line: yeah, well, the acorn becomes the oak.

Name: michael
Line: yeah. sometimes the acorn just stays the acorn. if you don't believe me, look in my gutters.

Name: jim
Line: phew! can't wait for this day to be over.

Line: why?

Name: jim

Name: kelly
Line: what drama?

Name: jim
Line: between the - us and you guys. it's unnecessary, right?

Name: kelly
Line: so unnecessary.

Name: jim
Line: oh, good, phew,  thank god you said that.

Name: kelly

Name: jim
Line: i have new baby pictures.

Name: kelly

[pam hands jim a note] it's not about showing you're in charge or flexing some sort of authority. it's about forgiveness. and yes, i'm talking about you three in this desk clump right here. i think that, if you were to apologize to me, then i would revoke your suspension.

Name: dwight
Line: [pressing buttons to start microwave and moves towards his crotch] i am an honorable man, and i will honor the contract. but i don't have to give her the good stuff. schrute sperm are strong, [banging on his crotch with drum sticks] but they're no match for a grown schrute man. [drops yellow pages against his crotch] [screaming] [chuckling] let's see what she gets. [bouncing crotch on bike and crashes into glass door] [thud] aah!

Line: he don't give an "f" about nothin'!

Line: i have got big balls.

Name: darryl

Name: jim
Line: okay.

Name: darryl
Line: pam.

Name: pam
Line: okay.

Name: phyllis

Name: michael
Line: okay. [phyllis avoids looking at michael] phyllis. okay. look at me. [continues to look away] phyllis, look at-- [phyllis turns to leave] okay, that's... [chases after her] all right, all right. you know what? i'm sick of this. i'm sick of the little disapproving head shakes. if you think that's going to have any effect on me, it will not. i am going to leave right now and go to a motel to meet donna.

Name: kevin
Line: why not your condo?

Name: michael
Line: because a motel is dirty and it is sexy. like me. and like donna. and frankly, the stuff that we're into isn't very condo-appropriate.

Name: michael

Name: dwight
Line: are you warmed up? [outside sliding door in warehouse]

Name: angela
Line: no.

Name: dwight

Name: angela
Line: what did you do to yourself? [camera pans to jim and pam laying down in restful location]

Name: dwight
Line: never mind. just never mind.

Name: angela
Line: well, it better work.

Name: dwight
Line: oh, it'll work. [jim and pam look shocked and disturbed] mm. stop kissing me. it's not in the contract.

Name: michael
Line: [driving in car; returns to office; grabs ice cream out of freezer] how do i feel about breaking up with donna? good. moral. i feel proud. [beeping; cut to donna who is waiting in the parking lot of the motel] like a grownup.[donna receives text from phone] that was not easy because i really liked her a lot. and i'm a little bit emotional right now because i know that i absolutely made the right decision. [donna has disappointed look; cut back to michael in his office opening ice cream] at the end of the day, we have to do what's right. and it was either living with myself or... being happy. and i picked... the... former.

Name: reporter
Line: michael scott?

Name: michael
Line: yes?

Name: reporter
Line: do you wanna make a comment on the rumors?

Name: michael
Line: [sighs] umm... i have done some very bad things, things of which i am not proud. i would like to publicly apologize to... the coach and the players. and i vow to never listen to my bodily instincts ever again.

Name: reporter
Line: i'm talking about the sabre printers that catch on fire.

Name: michael
Line: oh. okay. i was talking about... what do-- what? what's going on?

Name: michael
Line: [on youtube video] there is nothing wrong, nor will there ever be wrong with any sabre printers. case closed. [phone rings, michael picks it up] michael scott, as seen on tv.

Name: todd packer
Line: [high-pitched voice] i saw you on the news and i want to pinch your tiny wiener...  [normal voice] it's packer!

Name: michael
Line: oh! pack man, i thought you were a girl!

Name: michael
Line: apparently, there are allegations that sabre printers can cause a fire. so they asked me to give a statement to the press. i'm like, what? all right. so i do it. it's on tv last night. and it's in the paper today. and it's online. and then i call froggy 98.7, the request line. i talk to the host about it on the air. it's like, come on, people, enough.

Name: michael
Line: everybody, we are at defcon 5. i am officially the second-most watched clip of the day on the wbre news site.

Name: oscar
Line: what's number one?

Name: michael
Line: oh, that teacher who was wrongfully accused of being a pedophile. now, we cannot let the pedophile win again! i would like you all to go to the website and watch my clip eleven times.

Name: jim
Line: so instead of working, you want...

Name: michael
Line: yes.

Name: jim
Line: okay.

Name: michael
Line: yes. come on! get it up! that's what... let's do it!

Name: phyllis
Line: awww, it's kissing its mommy!

Name: michael
Line: please.

Name: dwight
Line: michael, you have to see, this is like, the cutest thing ever.

Name: michael
Line: really? a baby otter? okay, um, count me in as who cares. it's not even that interesting a baby otter, it can't even stand up. [looks toward computer] it's trying to stand up... [choking up] there it goes.

Name: jo
Line: howdy. i hope i'm not interrupting anything.

Name: michael
Line: jo! we were not expecting you!

Name: jo
Line: 'course you all, no doubt, know why i'm here.

Name: kevin
Line: no.

Name: jo
Line: turns out our printers are famous. they're all over the news. it's an interesting story. cheap foreign printers attacking innocent americans. well, actually the, the real story isn't quite as racy, but uh... let's give it a go.

Name: kevin
Line: jo, i think that i know what happened.

Name: jo
Line: i'm not sure you do, teddy bear.

Name: kevin
Line: well, now i think i might not.

Name: jo
Line: not long ago, we discovered a defect in one of our printers, so we got a software patch and fixed it right up, just like that. i don't know how it works. but just as we were about to send out a letter to our affected customers, giving 'em free toner, and we keep 'em, happy, but somebody here, they liked that first story better. the one where we lose half our clients for no damn good reason! whoever it was who talked to the press, they should come forward, please.

Name: michael
Line: jo, jo, i can assure you it was no one in this office.

Name: jo
Line: can you now?

Name: michael
Line: absolutely. anyone who talked to the press, please raise your hand.

Name: phyllis
Line: [quietly, to andy] put your hand up, norma rae.

Name: andy
Line: if you say anything, so help me god, i'll break off the temples of your glasses and stick them in your eye sockets.

Name: andy
Line: so unfair. even if i thought that our printers killed baby seals, i would not be a whistleblower. the bernards, for generations, have silenced whistleblowers. it's how we made all our money. woody guthrie wrote a song about us. [sings] old mr. bernard, old mr. bernard, who have you silenced today?

Name: jo
Line: [as gabe hands out forms to everyone] it's a little form, says "i did not do it."

Name: michael
Line: there is no reason for anyone here to sign this, because i know everything there is to know about these people. i know when their birthdays are, i know what their favorite kind of cake is, i know what color streamers they like...

Name: jo
Line: all that's just birthday information, michael.

Name: michael
Line: yes, yes, but it shows a bigger picture.

Name: jo
Line: why don't you come with me? we'll start out with the honcho, what'cha say?

Name: michael
Line: okay.

Name: jo
Line: when mama was working as a prison guard and something went missing, she'd ask one question: what do we do when we find the guilty party? and if they said, "come down on him with that swift hammer of justice!", innocent. a clear conscience don't need no mercy. but if they said "officer bessie, well they may have had a reason, blah blah blah blah", well nine times out of ten, that's the anus they'd check.

Name: jo
Line: so say we catch this whistleblower, what do you think i should do with him?

Name: michael
Line: we should give him a one-way ticket to montego bay, where they keep all the al-qaeda.

Name: jo
Line: uh, that's, uh, guantanamo bay.

Name: michael
Line: yes. you put them in jail for a long time, you put them in jail for as long as you can.

Name: jo
Line: well, i guess we're all right, michael.

Name: michael
Line: i want these people to really pay, i want them to suffer. i'd prefer it if they died, 'cause it's not right.

Name: jo
Line: yeah.

Name: michael
Line: okay.

Line: apache persuasion hold, that's the hell! what are you doing to my computer?

Line: hold that thought. i don't want to waste your time, and i wouldn't dare waste mine. i didn't do it. now, i don't know exactly who did it, but i have a list right here... [hands jo a piece of paper] you should fire the following people.

Line: uh-huh.

Line: i don't know what to do! do i go tell jo, or - i don't want everyone to keep blaming the wrong person!

Name: pam
Line: that fast?

Name: michael
Line: oh.

Name: michael

Line: so see you in meredith's van in five minutes.

Name: pam

Line: all right, this is just messed up.

Name: michael
Line: no, you know what's messed up? this situation all up in here is what's messed up! we need to brainstorm, we need to get out of this! brain hurricane. come on, think.

Line: all right.

Line: what do we got?

Name: pam
Line: um...

Name: pam
Line: we're not going for yogurt.

Name: michael

Line: hey, hey, it's as interesting as a morgue.

Name: kelly
Line: of course i'm the leak! i think i tweeted it! i can't control what i say to people, i spend the whole day talking! i mean, i video chat, i skype, i text, i tweet, i phone, i woof...

Name: ryan
Line: woof is a site that i'm launching to be the last word in social networking. for just $12.99 a month, woof links up all your communication portals so you are always within reach. it's part of the dog pack, as i call it. but, look, why tell you when i can show you. [types on his phone] i just sent myself a woof. [fax machine makes noise, several windows pop up on computer behind ryan with accompanying sounds, including barking]

Line: [on phone] ryan, you have a woof on line 1.

Name: ryan
Line: thank you, erin. woof!

Line: okay, here's what we do. i say we just smash all the computers. we destroy the evidence. no evidence, no case.

Line: wouldn't we get fired for smashing all the computers?

Line: no. okay, not all the computers, just our computers.

Line: that idea sucks.

Name: pam
Line: i don't think that's a good idea.

Name: michael
Line: just don't say no.

Name: darryl
Line: michael, you know you don't have to turn us all in. all you need is one scapegoat.

Name: kelly
Line: uh, if you turn me in, i'm turning in darryl.

Name: michael
Line: that's just what we need, another black man in prison. you know, let's just...

Name: pam
Line: nobody's going to prison, okay? um... all right, michael, you need to convince jo to go easy on us. and then we'll all confess once we know our jobs are safe.

Name: michael
Line: okay. you can count on me.

Line: [sees toby banging on the vending machine] let me give you a hand.

Name: toby
Line: i'm hungry.

Name: dwight
Line: ready? [they pull the vending machine towards them; dwight's phone rings] got it? oh shoot. got it? [walks away, opens phone] dwight schrute.

Line: [on phone] the property you're looking at is in great shape. by the way, it has a very spacious basement office.

Name: dwight
Line: basement office? you mean like a lair?

Name: michael
Line: hey jo.

Name: jo
Line: michael.

Name: michael
Line: i was thinking about our little leak problem. i was up all lunch thinking about what we should do to this individual. you know what i think we should do? we make 'em come to work, and we work 'em, and we make 'em sit next to all the people they screwed over. and, and we pay 'em but we make 'em feel like they did something really wrong. the one question i have is, do we give them a christmas bonus? i say yes, it's christmas, but right after they're back in the thick of it.

Name: jo
Line: michael scott... what do you know?

Name: michael
Line: what?

Name: michael
Line: it doesn't matter what i know.

Name: jo
Line: if it doesn't matter, then tell me.

Name: michael
Line: why?

Name: jo
Line: because i want to deal with it the way i deal with it.

Name: michael
Line: well, deal with this. [crosses arms]

Name: jo
Line: empathize with me for a moment. i came up here with a big problem, and now i got a branch manager who's giving me the silent treatment... speak to me... speak. [jo's dog barks] come with me.

Name: michael
Line: what?

Name: gabe
Line: [as michael and jo leave] are you leaving? oh, am i... should i continue with the investigation?

Name: michael
Line: are you going to kill me?

Name: jo
Line: hahahahahaha.

Line: [on phone] i just need you to come by later and sign a few forms.

Name: dwight
Line: okay.

Name: realtor
Line: what time works for you? [dwight looks across the street] mr. schrute, what time works?

Name: dwight
Line: cancel it. i want you to make an offer at seventeen twenty-five slough avenue. make 'em an offer they can't refuse. no, on second thought, low ball them. don't call me 'til you have it.

Name: realtor
Line: but... [dwight closes phone]

Name: michael
Line: [on jo's jet] are we going some place far away? i know you said no questions, but... i have an early dinner that i need to get to... with the chief of police.
