Line: can i talk to you a second about these client memos?

Name: andy
Line: sure. what's going on? [in room with gabe]

Name: gabe
Line: are you still in love with erin?

Name: andy
Line: what?

Name: gabe
Line: because i am. i need to get her back. [crying] i can't be alone anymore. andy, do you like being alone with me right now?

Name: andy
Line: no, this is horrifying.

Name: gabe
Line: no. i don't like being alone with me either, okay? i have to get her back. are you still gonna date her?

Name: andy
Line: we're just friends, okay?

Name: gabe
Line: do you promise that?

Name: andy
Line: yeah, fine, i promise. we'll never date again. can we go outside now?

Name: gabe
Line: no, just give me a second. i don't want anyone to know i've been crying.

Name: dwight
Line: [seeing the join the fist flyers that jim is hanging] hey, hey, hey, hey. what do you think you're doing? what's this? what's the fist?

Name: jim
Line: oh, it's just a social club. you know, like the french revolution, or the black panthers, or communism. it's just a club. guys talking, you know.

Name: dwight
Line: you expect me to believe that you're starting a rebellion?

Name: jim
Line: nope. social club. god, i hate when everybody calls us a rebellion. [darryl enters and brandishes his fist, jim returns the gesture]

Name: dwight
Line: okay, you know what? i would love to join the fist.

Name: jim
Line: and we would love to have you. but not today. unfortunately, it's a bad day, what with operation overthrow and everything, but i have noted it.  [dwight tears the sign down, jim hangs two signs in its place]

Name: kevin
Line: [inputting numbers into the copier and holding up the line] one...

Name: stanley
Line: [refills his coffee near a sign that reads "honor system: $0.50" with a camera pointed at it]

Name: andy
Line: pam, i have to show you this video. you're gonna love it. it's beyonce falling with a fart mixed in. [buzzer to indicate a blocked web site]

Name: dwight
Line: i will never be happier than i am right now. i will also never be less happy. i will be at my current maximum happiness for the rest of my life. because i am manager of the scranton branch of dunder mifflin. acting manager.

Name: kevin
Line: [looking at empty vending machine] no food now? someone has to do something about dwight!

Name: creed
Line: he put some snacks in the freezer for us.

Name: pam
Line: you mean the frozen mice for the piranha?

Name: creed
Line: no. the blueberry slurpee pouch.

Name: phyllis
Line: he means the ice pack.

Name: erin
Line: [on phone] 2:00 should probably be okay. i can either take your number or - [gabe ends the call]

Name: gabe
Line: i'm sorry. this can't wait.

Name: erin
Line: he's just gonna call back.

Name: gabe
Line: erin, i am in love with you. i don't believe in much, okay? i don't believe in horoscopes. i don't believe in christmas. uh, uh, i sure as hell don't believe in god. [erin and angela both look taken aback]

Name: erin
Line: [quietly] what?

Name: gabe
Line: or maybe there's a god. i don't know. i mean, it's just not a guy with a long white beard. [erin looks shocked] or it could be. i mean, it's possible that that is exactly what - what god is. but for all of the disbelief [phone rings] i believe in us. i believe in love. you have made me believe that for all of the hokum [phone continues ringing] out... there... uh, do we not have voicemail?

Name: erin
Line: dwight doesn't trust robots to give us our messages.

Name: gabe
Line: well... it's just... [ringing] it messes up my rhythm.

Name: erin
Line: i'm taking a break from dating. gabe was a great guy with so many wonderful qualities, but it was a challenge being touched by him.

Name: jim
Line: wow, you've really embraced the whole bond villain aesthetic.

Name: dwight
Line: ah, jim, jim, jim. the gun is a beaumont-adams. jo collects them. i thought we could have some nice small talk about it. and the piranha's a rescue.

Name: jim
Line: and the desk.

Name: dwight
Line: the desk is a replica of uday hussein's desk. i saw a picture in newsweek. listen, i'm a very busy man. let's get right down to business.

Name: jim
Line: okay.

Name: dwight
Line: jo is coming later today. i cannot have a subordinate trying to make me look stupid. okay? i need you to promise me that you'll be on your best behavior.

Name: jim
Line: i promise...d other people that i would be on my worst behavior. and i gave them my word, so...

Name: dwight
Line: don't make me fire you.

Name: jim
Line: you can't fire me. you're acting manager. not office manager. so you have no firing powers.

Name: dwight
Line: don't make me pre-fire you.

Name: jim
Line: you wouldn't dare.

Name: dwight
Line: watch this. you're pre-fired. and when i'm promoted, you'll be full fired.

Name: jim
Line: [quietly] if you get promoted, and if you haven't fallen in love with me by then.

Name: dwight
Line: what?

Name: jim
Line: if i had thought that there was a real chance that dwight would be permanent manager, i would have pre-quit. and you might be saying to yourself, "well that's pretty premature to think," but i always say, it's better to be pre-pre-preprepared.

Name: dwight
Line: how you doing, jordan?

Name: jordan
Line: i'm good.

Name: dwight
Line: everyone here thinks that you're a joke. they think that you were hired because of your good looks, which won't last long anyway. as your pale skin and severe bone structure imply, you'll age swiftly and poorly.

Name: jordan
Line: why are you telling me this?

Name: dwight
Line: now i want you to find out what people are saying about me, things they don't want me to know abou-[dwight opens a box and sits down in shock] ohh... it's a holster.

Name: dwight
Line: [walking around the office with the holster around his waist] yep. yep, yep, yep. lookin' good. [grunts] ohh... [stretching out his arms to better indicate the gun and holster] oh, what a day. what a day.

Name: pam
Line: dwight, are you carrying a gun?

Name: dwight
Line: the holster was a gift from my great-uncle honk. um, i don't know. i guess he's saying that he's proud of me.

Name: andy
Line: dwight, guns make me really uncomfortable.

Name: dwight
Line: the gun is just an accessory to the holster, okay? i can't walk around wearing an empty holster.

Name: pam
Line: why do you need to wear the holster at all?

Name: dwight
Line: why do you need to keep wearing those booby shirts all the time?

Name: angela
Line: thank you.

Name: phyllis
Line: you could put your cell phone in it instead.

Name: dwight
Line: uh... hello! [indicates his phone clipped onto his belt]

Name: kevin
Line: you could put a banana in it.

Name: dwight
Line: why would i put a banana in my holster?

Name: kevin
Line: in case you weren't hungry now, but you got hungry later.

Name: pam
Line: dwight, no gun, okay? don't make us call jo.

Name: dwight
Line: okay. all right. fine. everyone calm down. someone get me a banana. sorry i freaked you guys out - aah! [dwight goes to flip the gun and it fires near andy's ear, making everyone jump]

Name: erin
Line: andy!

Name: andy
Line: aah! aah! it's so loud!

Name: oscar
Line: my god. there is a hardwood floor underneath this carpeting. why would they do that?

Name: andy
Line: [trying to find a pitch] eeeeeeee... there's like this crazy ringing going on. i can't - eeeeeee... i can't find perfect c.

Name: meredith
Line: okay, everyone make a list of what's lost for the insurance. i lost a necklace, a ring, a painting-

Name: toby
Line: hey, what happened?

Name: kelly
Line: dwight went on a shooting spree, and then he shot andy in the head.

Name: dwight
Line: no, no, no. all we know is that a gun fired. that's all we know! no. that's not true. actually, we heard a loud noise. later, a hole was seen. no one saw the bullet leave the gun.

Name: andy
Line: [scatting off-key] something's definitely wrong.

Name: oscar
Line: i'll look on webmd. what are your symptoms?

Name: angela
Line: oh, everybody. oscar found a reason to look on webmd.

Name: oscar
Line: [buzzer to indicate a blocked site] firewall.

Name: gabe
Line: i can't reach jo. she must already be on the plane.

Name: dwight
Line: okay, why are you calling jo?

Name: andy
Line: i think i should go the hospital.

Name: erin
Line: i'll go with you.

Name: gabe
Line: no! we really shouldn't be without a receptionist. now more than ever.

Name: darryl
Line: i'll take him.

Name: andy
Line: thank you, darryl. [andy limps out of his chair and leans on darryl for support]

Name: darryl
Line: what's wrong with you?

Name: andy
Line: it's my ear.

Name: darryl
Line: yeah.

Name: andy
Line: okay, sorry.

Name: toby
Line: [excitedly] oh, i should get the accident report binder. i've never used the gun violence forms before.

Name: gabe
Line: i'm gonna keep trying jo.

Name: dwight
Line: okay, everyone! conference room, right now!

Name: dwight
Line: [enters with a cowboy hat, speaking with a western accent] yee-haw! whoo-hoo! [imitates gunfire] howdy, partners! it's me, gun-safety dwight! and i'm the rootin'-est-- [removes hat] i can't do this. um, look. obviously, a gun went off under my watch, and i'm launching a full investigation.

Name: stanley
Line: we all saw you do it.

Name: dwight
Line: really? you did? what hand was i holding the gun in? what did andy's tie look like?

Name: erin
Line: navy blue. little red anchors.

Name: dwight
Line: i have no way of knowing if that's true.

Name: toby
Line: i am supposed to collect eyewitness accounts. who saw dwight do this? [all raise their hands]

Name: dwight
Line: okay, really?

Name: toby
Line: would you consider this a terrorist incident?

Name: ryan
Line: i felt terrorized.

Name: dwight
Line: come on.

Name: toby
Line: oh, there's a whole 'nother terrorism booklet for that.

Name: dwight
Line: i just really, really think we should handle this internally.

Name: ryan
Line: dwight, why is it on us to protect you?

Name: dwight
Line: because you guys are my best friends, and i mean that. managing you for this last week has been the greatest honor of my life. and if you ruin this, i will burn this office to the ground. and i mean that figuratively. not literally. because you guys are so... so important... to me. i love you guys. but don't cross me. but you're the best.

Name: andy
Line: hey. [erin gasps] we're back.

Name: dwight
Line: there he is! our hero! [both dwight and erin move to hug andy] you look fantastic. how you doing? here, tell us your war stories.

Name: andy
Line: well, i burst my eardrum. doctor said it could take weeks to heal.

Name: dwight
Line: did they say what caused it? because i know you like putting q-tips deep into your ear canal.

Name: andy
Line: yeah.

Name: phyllis
Line: how's your hearing?

Name: andy
Line: temporary deafness in one ear. it was both ears. i couldn't hear a thing darryl was saying while we were in the waiting room.

Name: darryl
Line: i was talking like this. [mouths words while pointing to his ear] i don't feel good about it, but he just kept calling himself a gunshot victim and it got to me.

Name: kelly
Line: dwight, i would like tomorrow off so that i can go on my american idol audition.

Name: dwight
Line: american idol? what? no.

Name: kelly
Line: okay. i guess i can just not go. do you guys wanna hear my solo?

Name: dwight
Line: no.

Name: kelly
Line: [singing] why did my temporary boss go on a shooting spree?

Name: dwight
Line: okay, fine. you can go on your singing audition.

Name: phyllis
Line: okay, well, then i want an extra vacation day.

Name: angela
Line: pet day! i want pet day back - no dogs.

Name: kevin
Line: put back everything in the vending machine except the fruit.

Name: dwight
Line: i put everything back in the vending machine.

Name: kevin
Line: put everything back in the vending machine except... the fruit.

Name: pam
Line: you have to get rid of all your weapons. all of them. including killer fish.

Name: dwight
Line: okay.

Name: jim
Line: oh, is it my turn? ooh, i'm on the spot. i don't know. um... you know what? i think i'm good.

Name: dwight
Line: thank god.

Name: jim
Line: nope. when jo's here, can you work in "shagadelic, baby," at least three times in a conversation? oh, and when i cough can you do jazz hands?

Name: dwight
Line: what's jazz hands?

Name: jim
Line: [quickly shakes his hands back and forth]

Name: dwight
Line: fine.

Name: dwight
Line: [leaves the men's room with an empty fish tank after flushing the toilet]

Name: kevin
Line: [after entering the men's room] what the [bleep] is that? [runs out of the bathroom] oh, my...

Name: jo
Line: hey, all! cornelius, bobo, have at it. nobody let my dogs hump each other. they don't seem to know they're brothers.

Name: dwight
Line: hello, jo. welcome. well, shall we begin?

Name: jo
Line: slow yourself down there. just like a man. wants to jump right into it while i still got my socks on. jim halpert - the only man that ever turned me down.

Name: jim
Line: well, i don't know about that. just wasn't for me. but let me assure you, dwight is firing on all cylinders. right?

Name: jo
Line: well, some pretty big shoes to fill. i was sorry to hear about deangelo. he was a good man. tragic. [jim coughs]

Name: dwight
Line: [does jazz hands, jo notices and eyes him oddly] well, what can you do? life.

Name: andy
Line: we have to clean this up now!

Name: erin
Line: she had so much -

Name: gabe
Line: hey, guys.

Name: erin
Line: hey.

Name: gabe
Line: hope i'm not interrupting anything.

Name: andy
Line: no! [erin and andy laugh]

Name: gabe
Line: hey, andy, did you tell erin about our conversation earlier when you said you would never want to date her again?

Name: andy
Line: uh...

Name: gabe
Line: i just thought that it was so interesting that you promised that.

Name: andy
Line: did i say that earlier? yes, i did. because you, gabe, were crying...

Name: gabe
Line: no, i was not.

Name: andy
Line: and sobbing uncontrollably. yes. uh-huh. you were in hysterics. and my maternal instincts kicked in. is it actually how i feel? yes. or no. that is... between me and my diary.

Name: dwight
Line: oscar, can you print out last year's sale statements?

Name: kevin
Line: hey, dwight, gimme a back massage.

Name: dwight
Line: no, kevin, come on.

Name: kevin
Line: my back is sore, dwight. massage it.

Name: dwight
Line: kevin, not now.

Name: kevin
Line: hey, jo!

Name: dwight
Line: okay, okay. shh! [dwight begins rubbing his shoulders]

Name: kevin
Line: no, under the jacket.

Name: dwight
Line: you're kidding me. [reaches under kevin's jacket] oh god, what am i touching? it's moist.

Name: kevin
Line: i don't feel anything.

Name: dwight
Line: oh, it's so wet.

Name: kevin
Line: push harder, dwight.

Name: dwight
Line: i can't. i can't push harder!

Name: kevin
Line: go a little higher. there you go. nope, higher. higher. [dwight has positioned his feet on the filing cabinet behind kevin and is kneading his back horizontally]

Name: dwight
Line: okay, how's that?

Name: kevin
Line: knead it. knead it like a pizza.

Name: dwight
Line: i'm kneading it!

Name: kevin
Line: don't eat it.

Name: jo
Line: dwight! walk me out. let's talk soon. and stay on top of these people. you gotta admit it - it's nice to have a little power, eh? how's it feel?

Name: dwight
Line: jo... i accidentally fired a gun in the office today.

Name: jo
Line: what?!

Name: dwight
Line: i am telling you this because i care too much about this job to be blackmailed into doing it poorly. all i've ever wanted was to be manager here. and if you feel that you cannot promote me over this one accident, i understand. but if you think that extortion is worse -

Name: jo
Line: shooting is worse! are you kidding me? it's not even in the same - you shot a gun? what is wrong with you?

Name: dwight
Line: it was a beaumont-adams, if that helps.

Name: jo
Line: beaumont-adams is a girl's gun. that just makes it plain stupid.

Name: dwight
Line: i take full responsibility.

Name: jo
Line: who else would be responsible?

Name: dwight
Line: pam made me put a banana in my holster.

Name: pam
Line: you shot a gun off -

Name: dwight
Line: okay. did i make a mistake? yes. do i regret the decision that i made? yes.

Name: jo
Line: oh, stop asking yourself easy questions so you can look like a genius.

Name: dwight
Line: got it.

Name: jo
Line: i love you, dwight. but you don't fit this job.

Name: dwight
Line: [on the verge of tears] jo, please... i will -

Name: jo
Line: no, child. no. it's over. now i gotta find a replacement for my replacement.

Name: jo
Line: you three are my search committee. you're in charge of finding me my next manager. all righty?

Name: gabe
Line: yep.

Name: jim
Line: yep.

Name: jo
Line: till then, we need a new acting manager. now, who's got the most experience in this office?

Name: toby
Line: uh, well, we probably don't want to go just on seniority.

Name: jo
Line: who is it?

Name: jim
Line: hey, dwight. what's up?

Name: dwight
Line: shut up.

Name: jim
Line: well, you do know that jo was right to take the job away from you, right? there's no debating that. but, i will say... in your one week, every single one of the orders went out on time. and i think that is shagadelic, baby. [dwight sees creed claiming the desk in the manager's office]

Name: angela
Line: [giving kevin numbers for the copier] four, one, seven, one...

Name: kevin
Line: another one?

Name: darryl and angela
Line: yes!

Name: angela
Line: seven, two...

Name: oscar
Line: could you turn the volume down on the beeping?

Name: angela
Line: six, nine, shut up, oscar. eight...

Name: darryl
Line: nine first.

Name: angela
Line: nine, eight, five...

Name: kevin
Line: thank you.

Name: angela
Line: three, zero, zero. again, zero. four, six...

Name: kevin
Line: nice.

Name: angela
Line: two, one...

Name: kevin
Line: oh, i hit three. i hit three.

Name: angela
Line: god!

Name: creed
Line: [drives up to the entrance of the building, his license plate reads "new mgr"] it's a beautiful morning at dunder-mifflin, or as i like to call it, great bratton. [gets out of car, tosses his keys toward a nonexistent valet parker] keep it running.

Name: creed
Line: do i love being manager?... i love my kids. i love real estate. [slowly getting more excited] i love ceramics. i love my job. i-i love wrestling.

Name: creed
Line: [to jordan] find out what language this is. [speaking in strange language]

Name: creed
Line: [running a meeting in the conference room] okay, team building! on this side of the room, stanley, phyllis, jim, ted, elroy, [camera switches to show only meredith and kevin have attended the meeting, jim walks by and sees this] and this side of the room, pam, meredith, phyllis, creed...

Name: jim
Line: he never called a meeting.

Name: creed
Line: [pointing at a whiteboard with boboddy written on the left side, vertically] bo-boddy! bo-boddy. what does the first "b" stand for?

Name: pam
Line: what are we doing?

Name: creed
Line: we're making acronyms. okay! what does the first "b" stand for?

Name: kevin
Line: um... business!

Name: creed
Line: i like it! business! good, kevin! [writes after the first b, i, z, n, u...] all right! the "o"...

Name: pam
Line: we need a new manager.

Name: jim
Line: [conducting interview] your paper experience is very interesting. do you think you could use that experience to inform decisions here?

Name: fred henry
Line: absolutely--i, yes. in fact, i actually have a three-step plan that i believe could effectively double your profits.

Name: jim
Line: really?

Name: fred
Line: yeah.

Name: jim
Line: [waiting for fred to continue] ...what is it?

Name: fred
Line: nice try.

Name: toby
Line: i'm sorry, what is your three-step plan?

Name: fred
Line: well, i mean, i can't just hand you my plan. i mean, if you guys give me the job, then, then you'll get the plan.

Name: gabe
Line: well... it's an interview, and we don't know that you really have the plan.

Name: fred
Line: [speaking faster] well, i'm not gonna just make up that i have a plan. i got a plan. believe me, you guys want it. you're in paper, right?

Name: gabe
Line: how would we know that, if you don't...

Name: jim
Line: you could just be saying it to get the job.

Name: fred
Line: i guess i could be, if i was... who would do that?

Name: jim
Line: how about this. why don't you give us a part of the plan, and that way we know you have it.

Name: fred
Line: tell you what. i'll give you part three of part two. not gonna give you a whole part.

Name: jim
Line: okay.

Name: fred
Line: color-code sent documents, tm.

Name: jim
Line: did you just trademark that...

Name: toby
Line: [confused] w-what?

Name: fred
Line: that's a verbal trademark. that's an agreement.

Name: jim
Line: we are the search committee, hand-picked by our ceo, and tasked to find this branch's new manager. not everyone we meet will be good, but someone's bound to be, right? [andy, kelly, and darryl are each dressed up in suits for their interviews, andy is also wearing an "andy for manager?" pin on his jacket] and, to be honest, i think a lot of the decent candidates are right here in-house, so, i'm not too worried. but i'm really excited to spend a lot of time with toby and gabe. [quietly] did you know that gabe's last name was lewis? i had no idea.

Name: stanley
Line: [in elevator with phyllis and darryl, all three are smiling, to darryl] good morning.

Name: darryl
Line: good morning.

Name: phyllis
Line: [also to darryl] good morning.

Name: darryl
Line: good morning.

Name: phyllis
Line: did you have a nice drive in?

Name: darryl
Line: i did.

Name: darryl
Line: i have a solid relationship with jo, the company's owner. i have management experience. i have a good friendship with jim, the head of the search committee, and it doesn't hurt that i'm... [in oprah-like sing-song voice] bla-aaack!

Name: andy
Line: [puts up a poster in the break room with "if you are on the search committee please consider andy" on it in bold lettering]

Name: erin
Line: [commenting on the poster] it's good. i really hope you get it!

Name: andy
Line: the manager job? nah, i'm barely interested. i just can't not go for it. you know, it's not the bernard way. we give it the old college try, and then, in defeat, we show grace.

Name: erin
Line: still, i'd really like to see this office with you in the boss's chair.

Name: andy
Line: don't even... [getting really happy and excited] eeehhhh!!!!

Name: erin
Line: you in the boss's chair!

Name: andy
Line: eeehhh!! no. hehe.

Name: andy
Line: in my family, you don't really go out and get things. if you want something, you write it on a list, and then the housekeeper goes out and gets it, on wednesdays and fridays. so, i don't know, i guess you could say this job is on my list, and... [awkwardly smiling] we'll see what rosa comes back with.

Name: erin
Line: [checks to see that she is alone with phyllis] did you hear anything?

Name: phyllis
Line: oh, i'm sure they'll let us know when they get the results. [erin crosses fingers and smiles excitedly]

Name: phyllis
Line: it turns out that erin was born in the basic time and region that i gave away a child.

Name: erin
Line: so, phyllis might be my mom. i mean, the chances are tiny, but...

Name: phyllis
Line: but, probably not, i mean, it was a big year for babies. porky's had come out.

Name: erin
Line: yeah. i'm sure i was just another porky's baby.

Name: phyllis
Line: mm.

Name: erin
Line: but why not find out.

Name: phyllis
Line: yeah.

Name: pam
Line: [to dwight, who is reading the want ads] should you really be so blatant about that?

Name: dwight
Line: they won't make me manager, and i won't settle for anything less. i've gone about as far as i can here. that's obvious. time to take my talents elsewhere.

Name: pam
Line: are you really going to apply for work at scranton breadworks?

Name: dwight
Line: bread is the paper of the food industry. you write your sandwich on it.

Name: warren buffett
Line: can you do any better on salary?

Name: jim
Line: unfortunately, that range is set at corporate.

Name: warren
Line: what about mileage when i use my car? i mean, gas ain't cheap, you know.

Name: jim
Line: heh. we think that 25 cents a mile is pretty generous.

Name: warren
Line: how about 27? and uh, when i make long-distance calls, will they be monitored or is it on the honor system?

Name: angela
Line: [on phone] okay. [hangs up, smiling] how odd, a very unusual phone call from the senator's office. the senator wants me to have lunch with him at the botanical gardens.

Name: kevin
Line: the botanical gardens, scranton's hidden gem. don't eat any berries you don't recognize.

Name: toby
Line: how will your experience selling refinery equipment translate to our smaller scale here?

Name: robert california
Line: you don't work in sales, do you.

Name: toby
Line: uh... human resources.

Name: robert
Line: you see, i sit across from a man. i see his face. i see his eyes. now, does it matter if he wants a hundred dollars of paper or a hundred million dollars of deep-sea drilling equipment? don't be a fool. he wants respect. he wants love. he wants to be younger. he wants to be attractive. there is no such thing as a product. don't ever think there is. there is only... sex. everything... is sex. you understand that what i'm telling you is a universal truth,... toby.

Name: toby
Line: yes.

Name: gabe
Line: okay, i-i am, i'm almost a little concerned that you might be overqualified for the position. [robert and gabe chuckle at this, then gabe stops chuckling] do you, um, do you think that you are?

Name: robert
Line: do i look like someone who would waste my own time?

Name: gabe
Line: no. [robert then nods his head at jim]

Name: jim
Line: can you... [seems intimidated, clears throat] you are a man of great confidence. could you speak a little more to that, and, what the role of confidence... would be... in a dialogue with a subordinate?

Name: robert
Line: will you be heard? will you have a voice? will i steamroll over you? do you feel heard right now, jim? do you have a voice, right now? you can answer me.

Name: jim
Line: yes.

Name: robert
Line: that was your choice, not mine. the fallacy is that it is up to the steamroller. it is up to the object... whether it will be flattened or not, and i can tell from the small interaction we've had already, you won't be flattened by anybody. do you agree with me, jim?

Name: jim
Line: yes.

Name: robert
Line: [more emphatically than jim] yes. you do. [nods at the search committee, then looks over at the camera with a smirk on his face]

Name: jim
Line: [robert leaves the conference room and looks at the others in the office as he grins at the camera and leaves] he creeps me out. [toby nods] but, i think he might be a genius.

Name: andy
Line: [jim points at darryl to be the next interviewee] good luck, darryl.

Name: darryl
Line: [pats andy on the back] thank you.

Name: darryl
Line: think about it! what other mammal, besides humans, drinks the milk of another mammal? i mean, you don't see a bear drinking raccoon milk.

Name: jim
Line: [jim and gabe laugh, toby smiles and nods] oh.

Name: darryl
Line: so this is cool. i think we make a good fit. [stands up]

Name: gabe
Line: oh? uh... we haven't started the interview yet. were you--were you joking?

Name: darryl
Line: uh... [looks at camera] yes?! i was. [sits back down] little joke!

Name: toby
Line: so, how would you go about settling interpersonal conflicts within the office?

Name: darryl
Line: i thought that was your job.

Name: toby
Line: well, it's one of my strengths, but it's the manager's job.

Name: jim
Line: well, for instance, how did you deal with it when two warehouse guys got into a fight?

Name: darryl
Line: i'll answer that, jim. i would use it as an opportunity to teach, uh, about actions... and consequences... of actions. [jim and gabe stare at darryl]

Name: darryl
Line: [noticing erin in the background leading a black man dressed in a suit through the office] who's that?

Name: jim
Line: [ignoring darryl's question] so i think all we need is a resume, and we'll be good right?

Name: darryl
Line: i... i just thought you knew me.

Name: jim
Line: yeah, it's no big deal, just something that looks like that. [shows darryl a resume] cool? [goes to put the resume away]

Name: darryl
Line: let me... [jim shows him the resume again, darryl looks at it a little longer this time] oh. cool. [jim gives darryl a thumbs-up, then looks at the camera as darryl gets up to leave]

Name: merv bronte
Line: [at the cafe on the first floor] did, uh, you just interview?

Name: robert
Line: ohh, unfortunately, yes.

Name: merv
Line: what do you mean?

Name: robert
Line: that business can't attract anyone. it's awful up there. those people seem like they're in prison, waiting out life sentences in a... dying industry.

Name: merv
Line: place must be horrible. i don't know if i want this job. [gets on elevator]

Name: merv
Line: [in elevator] well, if i get this job offer, and then i know that i'm gonna take it, and if i take it, i know that i'm never gonna quit, and then 25 years are gonna go by and... i'm gonna die here.

Name: dwight
Line: what makes you feel qualified to judge a place after a mere interview? [robert stares at dwight] what are you doing..? [dwight sits up abruptly] stop trying to figure me out.

Name: robert
Line: i just did.

Name: dwight
Line: you can't.

Name: robert
Line: it's done.

Name: dwight
Line: no, it's not.

Name: robert
Line: i know you now, your nature. i'm done. not worth continuing. [at the same time, dwight says:  you don't know me! anything about me! get out of my head!]

Name: dwight
Line: stop trying to figure me out. [robert turns to ignore dwight] do you even know anything about paper? how it's made?

Name: robert
Line: i saw an episode of how they make paper on sesame street. [nods at dwight mockingly]

Name: dwight
Line: [standing up] get out.

Name: dwight
Line: i'm gonna prevent inferior men from sullying my place of work with their weak, passionless leadership. do you see my hat? no? that's because i just threw it in the ring.

Name: merv
Line: you guys pay for relocation, though, right?

Name: toby
Line: well, why would you need relocation, if you already live in scranton?

Name: merv
Line: well, i'd want to move further away, you know? just... i don't want any chance to run into my co-workers outside the office.

Name: jim
Line: can i ask why you're leaving your current job?

Name: merv
Line: [pulls out a tupperware from his briefcase and takes out a tupperware] i'm leaving my other job because they were all jerks, really. [opens tupperware] you know, all of 'em. you had your jerk-wads, and your jerk-offs, so, just between the wads and the offs, i just... i had to get outta there. [begins eating sandwich]

Name: jim
Line: is this a bad time to be doing this?

Name: merv
Line: i'm having a bad time. [chuckles]

Name: toby
Line: i'm sorry, if we did something to upset you, i'm sure it was inadvertent.

Name: merv
Line: [continues to chew, slower and slower, appears confused] wait.

Name: merv
Line: oh, why did i believe that weirdo in the lobby? these are the nicest people i ever met.

Name: angela
Line: [limo driver lets angela out of the limo at the office parking lot] thank you.

Name: pam
Line: [looking at an engagement ring on angela's finger] it's gorgeous, angela.

Name: kelly
Line: yeah, i actually know about nice rings and it is gorgeous.

Name: meredith
Line: [looks at ring, whispering] wow...

Name: angela
Line: it's a little flashy. i mean, what am i? naomi judd?

Name: meredith
Line: tell us the freaking story!

Name: kevin
Line: yeah! tell us a story.

Name: angela
Line: okay. he took me to the replica of monet's japanese bridge, and then he put this flower behind my ear, which normally, i would hate, 'cause it's so civil rightsy. then he got down on one knee, and he said, will you be a senator's wife?

Name: pam
Line: [laughing] oh-ho-ho! he talked about himself in the third person?

Name: angela
Line: yes, pam. not everyone is as informal as you and jim. [imitating jim's voice] oh, hey pam, dude, whatever, wanna marry me? [erin, kelly, and meredith laugh]

Name: pam
Line: that's not accurate.

Name: angela
Line: then i saw flashes. reporters were there. they always find us. and everyone was crying, even his aide. [camera pans and shows oscar in disbelief]

Name: oscar
Line: angela's engaged to a gay man. as a gay man, i'm horrified. as a friend of angela's, horrified. as a lover of elegant weddings, [smiles] i'm a little excited. [expression becomes serious again] but overall, horrified.

Name: jim
Line: andy? you all set?

Name: andy
Line: okay, guys, it's time. it's pep talk time. tell me what i need to hear.

Name: phyllis
Line: are you sure this is a good idea? i hate to see you disappointed.

Name: andy
Line: [grunts] augh.

Name: erin
Line: i think andy should be the boss. he's just so great. if i'm being objective, then darryl, of course.

Name: jim
Line: so, andy, what improvements would you make as office manager?

Name: andy
Line: for starters, i really think we can streamline communication around here... [gets cut off by gabe]

Name: gabe
Line: whoa! that's a very heavy accusation to level against toby.

Name: andy
Line: i wasn't acc-, accusing...

Name: gabe
Line: well, toby's in charge of human resources, that would include communication. i think that toby's done a fine job.

Name: andy
Line: right! i really wasn't trying to insult any, anyone.

Name: toby
Line: i didn't think you were.

Name: gabe
Line: i have two relationships with andy. i have a personal relationship, and i have a professional relationship. personally, yeah, i think he's a rat, and i think he's responsible for the demise of my relationship with erin. professionally,... he broke up the happiest couple in this office!

Name: gabe
Line: how many windows are there in new york city?

Name: andy
Line: what?

Name: gabe
Line: critical thinking. common, on-the-spot question asked in an interview.

Name: andy
Line: okay. let me think... are you counting car windows?

Name: gabe
Line: no... how far away is the sun?

Name: andy
Line: [happily] uh, 93 million miles.

Name: jim
Line: [to gabe] is it?

Name: andy
Line: yeah! and the diameter of the sun is 870,000 miles, which makes it 109 times wider than the earth, and... [gabe looks visibily annoyed] 333,000 times heavier than the earth,...

Name: gabe
Line: shut up about the sun! shut up about the sun! [slams fist, hurting his hand]

Name: andy
Line: [alone in his car] i am unhappy with the confusing and, at times, confrontational nature of that meeting. i wanted it to go better. i wanted it to go better!!

Name: darryl
Line: [on phone] yes, there used to be a paper clip that would pop up and say "looks like you are writing a letter or resume. would you like help? i believe his name was... [looks embarrassed at camera] clippy.

Name: creed
Line: [on phone] first of all, i want to thank you for your years of patronizing our company. i've got some bad news. we're going out of business. [covers phone, whispers to pam] saving face. [uncovers phone] yep, yep. i understand that. basically everything is falling apart here. pam looks around the office and realizes only she has overheard this]

Name: pam
Line: how is this on me?

Name: pam
Line: hang up. [creed hangs up] corporate needs you to find the differences between this picture and this picture. [shows creed two similar-looking photos of some building] intel has told us there were at least seven.

Name: creed
Line: [takes the pictures] okay i already see one, gimme. okay.

Name: pam
Line: they're the same picture.

Name: kelly
Line: well, i manage my department, and i've been doing that for several years now. and, god, i've learned a lot of life lessons along the way.

Name: jim
Line: your department's just you, right?

Name: kelly
Line: yes, jim, but i am not easy to manage.

Name: gabe
Line: great! [to jim and toby] um, can we just... [does a "wrap it up" motion with his pen]

Name: kelly
Line: what was that?

Name: gabe
Line: we just have a lot of serious candidates to get through today, so... [nods]

Name: kelly
Line: [getting upset] am i not a serious candidate?

Name: gabe
Line: what do you want me to say? i mean, there's a line of qualified people out there. we have a video cv from england. [to jim and toby] are we all just gonna pretend to-- okay. [to kelly] um, what are your weaknesses?

Name: kelly
Line: i don't have any, assh***.

Name: dwight
Line: [comes in, slapping some papers on the table] i want an interview.

Name: dwight
Line: [walking with jim in the parking lot] how's the family?

Name: jim
Line: good!

Name: dwight
Line: good. they good?

Name: jim
Line: yeah.

Name: dwight
Line: what's your daughter's name again? peepee?

Name: jim
Line: peepa.

Name: dwight
Line: peepa, how is she?

Name: jim
Line: great.

Name: dwight
Line: great! oh, that's great... we never were very good at small talk, were we, jim?

Name: jim
Line: no.

Name: dwight
Line: now, listen,...

Name: jim
Line: you're not getting an interview, dwight. the whole point of this search committee process is to prevent hiring someone like you ever again.

Name: dwight
Line: okay, i know why you're saying that, jim, i really do, but think of it this way. the hand that reaches from the grave to grip your throat [motions to grip jim's throat] is the strong hand you want on the wheel.

Name: jim
Line: [pulls dwight's arm down] okay. that's vivid.

Name: dwight
Line: i'm going to make you an offer. okay? you even do so little as grant me an interview, i will guarantee you your dream work life. okay? you roll in at 10 a.m. to your own private reserved parking spot, pick up your daily free coffee from dwight's caffeine corner, unlimited sex breaks for you and pam...

Name: jim
Line: yikes.

Name: dwight
Line: erin will eat garbage for your entertainment.

Name: jim
Line: well, you know how i like taking bribes. [both smile]

Name: dwight
Line: ha ha! [pats jim on the back]

Name: jim
Line: unfortunately, jo also took the job away from you because she doesn't trust your judgment. so how would that look for me, if i recommended you?

Name: dwight
Line: fine. i'll do it without you, but you'll regret this.

Name: jim
Line: okay.

Name: dwight
Line: let me get that for you. [runs ahead to open the door for jim]

Name: jim
Line: thank you.

Name: dwight
Line: okay. [looks ashamed]

Name: oscar
Line: pam... i think robert is gay.

Name: pam
Line: the senator? [oscar nods] he was married before, and he has a kid.

Name: oscar
Line: [whispers] so!?

Name: pam
Line: and don't say that thing about how lots of gay guys have kids.

Name: oscar
Line: i have a very strong suspicion.

Name: pam
Line: did you see him at a bathhouse?

Name: oscar
Line: what bathhouse?

Name: pam
Line: the windowless building by the baskin robbins.

Name: oscar
Line: [confused, whispers] what?

Name: pam
Line: forget it. i'm never gonna know what goes on there.

Name: oscar
Line: my friend at the scranton blade is totally plugged into these matters.

Name: pam
Line: you're in the gay mafia.

Name: oscar
Line: you're thinking of another group. much wealthier, much older. [whispers, smiles] you sound ignorant.

Name: ryan
Line: you guys, um, talking senator?

Name: pam
Line: no.

Name: oscar
Line: no. why would we be talking about the senator?

Name: ryan
Line: 'cause he's totally gay? [walks away]

Name: ryan
Line: um, how do i know that robert is gay? he "liked" my facebook photos at 3 o'clock in the morning.

Name: david brent
Line: [on video resume on a laptop] name? david brent. occupation? inspirer. status? none of your business. young, free, and single, though. thanks for asking. hear you're looking for a new boss. yeah? someone to tell a bunch of discontented, underencouraged drones what to do every day. is that it? oh. our out-of-touch powers that be? want me to fire them, if they don't see things your way? then i ain't that dude. bye-bye, baby, bye-bye. get some other corporate suit to lay down the law. what? you've changed your mind? you're now looking for a leader of men? ipso facto, women too. [points at self] when do i start? yeah. [jim looks uninterested in this candidate]

Name: phyllis
Line: do you know what it took to get bob to notice me? i waited in his office every morning wearing nothing but kitty-cat ears. i did that every day for two weeks. and on the tenth day he walked in, he was naked too, except a dog nose. guess what we did then?

Name: erin
Line: [trying to cut off phyllis] i... i don't think i can do that.

Name: phyllis
Line: bestiality. yeah.

Name: erin
Line: well, that's not my personality.

Name: phyllis
Line: if my daughter were asking me... [both giggle]

Name: erin
Line: yes?

Name: phyllis
Line: i would say, if you want someone, if you really want them,... go get them.

Name: erin
Line: i do really want him.

Name: darryl
Line: so, uh... here you go. [gives resume to jim]

Name: jim
Line: great.

Name: darryl
Line: hope it's all right.

Name: jim
Line: i'm sure it's fine.

Name: darryl
Line: the guy who was in here earlier, interviewed after me, how'd he do?

Name: jim
Line: howard cline?

Name: darryl
Line: ehh, that's not who i'm talking about.

Name: jim
Line: [checks sheet] oh... deshaun williams.

Name: darryl
Line: yes. how did he do?

Name: jim
Line: he's an amazing man. he's a rhodes scholar. he invented an app that invents apps. fantastic kisser...

Name: darryl
Line: come on man. i'm being serious. don't joke.

Name: jim
Line: darryl! we all know you. your interview is not nearly as important as the other guys. [darryl taps a couple times on jim's desk and walks away]

Name: nellie bertram
Line: first, i'll take down the cubicle walls.

Name: toby
Line: but there aren't...

Name: nellie
Line: symbol of transparency. there'd be no titles. everyone would have the same job. same goes for me. i'd take your job, but i'd reject the title.

Name: gabe
Line: a little un-specific.

Name: nellie
Line: everyone would be known for their accomplishments.

Name: jim
Line: that's very interesting. um, i feel like there might be a conflict there, and if a conflict did arise, how would that be dealt with?

Name: nellie
Line: ooh? yeah. mm. scratch everything from before. i tell you what i'd do. go the other way. more cubicles. more division. everyone is somebody's boss, and that person can fire the person below them. [overlapping comments by the search committee] at least once a month, the lowest performing person... [does a cut-throat hand gesture] bye bye!

Name: gabe
Line: how would you compare, like, an accountant and hr?

Name: nellie
Line: well, i'll tell you how. shall i? i'll tell you how.

Name: gabe
Line: okay.

Name: nellie
Line: by splitting the difference. just... just, somewhere in the middle.

Name: jim
Line: i think that's probably all we need to hear from...

Name: nellie
Line: zen office. hmm? thought of that? that's what i'd do. everyone takes their shoes off, before they come in. okay. there'd be no desks. you just sit on the floor.

Name: jim
Line: that's very...

Name: nellie
Line: you've got a thai woman, out in the back. sockee! sockee!

Name: gabe
Line: okay, that's not gonna be...

Name: nellie
Line: sockee!... is her name. okay? shes administering massage, all right, if you need it. if you don't, whatever, just talk to her! she's a person! either way, 50 minutes of that and you...you are cracking to go. [smiles]

Name: oscar
Line: is there a front runner?

Name: jim
Line: you know what? they all just sort of blend together after a while.

Name: oscar
Line: well, there must be someone who stands out.

Name: jim
Line: no, not at all. in fact, i'm not even taking it seriously. i think at the end of the day, i'm just gonna pick a name out of the hat.

Name: oscar
Line: well...

Name: stanley
Line: the hell you will! i worked for the last boss for 15 years. according to my doctor, i don't have another 15 years if i want to keep up the same dietary and sexual lifestyle, which i intend to.

Name: ryan
Line: [in mock seriousness] oh no, stanley... you'll live forever...

Name: stanley
Line: my next boss will be my last boss. he'll be at my funeral. so i would appreciate it if you would take this seriously. [dunks his half-eaten donut in jim's coffee, takes it back out, and leaves]

Name: jim
Line: uh--

Name: meredith
Line: you pick a crappy boss, you're responsible for my crappy life. [leaves]

Name: jim
Line: okay, everybody, i was just making a joke. i am taking it seriously, i promise.

Name: oscar
Line: are you? [leaves]

Name: ryan
Line: little advice? take a day off from the whole jim schtick. try caring about something. you might like how it feels... james. [closes his office door, leaving jim alone in the break room]

Name: jo
Line: [walks in with her dogs] gabe, honey! oh, lord. take all this. [gives the dog leashes and multiple bags to gabe]

Name: gabe
Line: all right.

Name: jo
Line: here. jim! did you hear stern this morning?

Name: jim
Line: no, was it good?

Name: jo
Line: ohh, robin was good. she's always good. keeps him on his toes. its howard's show though. [picks up resume from jim's desk] whose is this? darryl philbin. ohh. very nice to see a familiar face on top. ah... a little long aren't we? four pages? is this the same darryl philbin who's had two jobs in ten years at one company?

Name: darryl
Line: yes, thanks to you, who promoted me, after we, uh, interfaced.

Name: jo
Line: coordinated and implemented receipt storage and delivery of over 2.5 billion units of inventory. 2.5 billion, darryl? 2.5 billion units of what?

Name: darryl
Line: paper material, ma'am.

Name: jo
Line: paper material?

Name: darryl
Line: [softly] pieces of paper. [jo rolls her eyes]

Name: dwight
Line: [clears throat] jo, may i speak to you for a second?

Name: jo
Line: or what? you gonna shoot me?

Name: dwight
Line: ha ha ha! ha ha ha! ohh, i enjoy laughing at my mistakes, because i've learned so much from them. i'd like to be interviewed for the position.

Name: jo
Line: i'll interview you right now.

Name: dwight
Line: okay.

Name: jo
Line: question 1. ever shot a gun in the office?

Name: dwight
Line: it's complicated.

Name: jo
Line: yeah, but see... it's not.

Name: phyllis
Line: i don't think we should tell her. angela went a whole day without telling me i had lettuce in my teeth. screw her.

Name: pam
Line: i'm a woman. i would want to know.

Name: meredith
Line: yeah, you gotta know.

Name: kevin
Line: okay, but if angela can get a gay man to marry her, maybe i could get a lesbian to marry me? huh? huh? that's hot.

Name: oscar
Line: you have met a lesbian in real life, right?

Name: phyllis
Line: you know, this is probably is her last chance at a family.

Name: pam
Line: she does seem happy.

Name: oscar
Line: you're right. you're right. she seems happy. we don't tell her.

Name: kevin
Line: we don't tell her.

Name: pam
Line: okay.

Name: kelly
Line: excuse me, ms. bennett, may i have a word?

Name: jo
Line: okay.

Name: kelly
Line: uh,... can it be in private? [to gabe] don't worry, it's not about you. [gabe smiles and leaves] as minority executive, i think it's my responsibility to let you know that gabe is gross. i don't think it's professional that he was sleeping with the receptionist, and then when erin dumped him, so that she could be with andy, he became a total crazy stalker psycho.

Name: jo
Line: welcome to scranton, jo. land of a thousand problems only you can fix. [jo's phone starts vibrating, she picks it up and sees dwight has texted her "dwight's ability as a manager has lead him to higher levels of proffesional success,"] oh for god's sake. he's texting me his resume one line at a time. these are costing me ten cents a piece, you jackass! i'm roaming!

Name: creed
Line: [to jordan] get me our biggest client on the phone, right this instant. [closes his office door]

Name: jordan
Line: who is our biggest client?

Name: pam
Line: uh, just put him through to me.

Name: jordan
Line: [laughs] okay.

Name: pam
Line: hello! this is... the client.

Name: creed
Line: it's creed. fyi, i'm starting my own paper company, looking to poach some chumps, you in?

Name: pam
Line: yes.

Name: creed
Line: hehehe, cool. let's keep this on the qt, okay? i uh, i don't want you to be a dead mamma jamma.

Name: pam
Line: great.

Name: creed
Line: all right, thank you, bye-bye.

Name: pam
Line: thank you, bye-bye.

Name: erin
Line: [knocks and enters] jo, you have one more candidate. he's a burn victim.

Name: jo
Line: huh?

Name: erin
Line: [motions toward her face] he's all messed up. i can tell him to get lost if you want.

Name: jo
Line: no, send him in. [to search committee] who is this?

Name: gabe
Line: i have no idea.

Name: jim
Line: [seeing dwight wearing sunglasses and whose face and hands are completely covered in gauze] oh, i know this guy. [dwight awkwardly hands copies of his resume to the search committee] hello! mr. "soo-ven-yay." mr. "jacques soo-ven-yay." nice to meet you. it says here you're french. [dwight nods] so you worked at your last job for 15 years as assistant to the regional manager.

Name: dwight
Line: [mumbling through the gauze] assistant regional manager.

Name: jim
Line: assistant to the regional manager.

Name: dwight
Line: [again] assistant regional manager.

Name: jim
Line: what is it?

Name: dwight
Line: [in a cheesy french accent] assistant regional manager.

Name: jim
Line: oh, that's my mistake, sorry about that. the last paper company you worked for burned to the ground? and all because they wouldn't hire a manager who lived and breathed paper? that's a travesty.

Name: jo
Line: i want to talk to dwight schrute for a second. i want to ask him a question. [gabe gets up to leave] if he isn't here in sixty seconds...

Name: dwight
Line: uhh. wait. wait! no. stop! stop. jo... [takes off sunglasses and reveals his face] it's me. i'm dwight.

Name: jim
Line: [looks extremely confused] no. no! wait, but, i mean, you're dwight, and then... he's the... [trails off]

Name: dwight
Line: [whispers] yeah.

Name: jim
Line: [looks astonished] ohhhh!

Name: gabe
Line: very unprofessional, "jacques." or, should i say, dwight.

Name: jo
Line: let's just say i had hired this jack souvenir. then what?

Name: dwight
Line: i would have dressed this way every day, legally changed my name, learned french sign language, shown up, and been the best damn branch manager you'd ever seen!

Name: jo
Line: all that for this job.

Name: dwight
Line: yes.

Name: jo
Line: that's f***ing crazy. [jo and dwight both smile] get outta here. [dwight leaves] what a nutjob.

Name: jim
Line: this guy was good. although, he did keep saying that he needed two weeks off right at the beginning for a trip to the finger lakes. seriously. every five minutes, he was like, "just making sure the finger lakes thing is clear."

Name: jo
Line: okay, it's fun to talk about the rejects, but uh, who's got ya excited?

Name: jim
Line: finger lakes guy is good. darryl is also very good.

Name: jo
Line: who's this fella? went to cornell. what's wrong with him?

Name: gabe
Line: how much time do you have? sales ability? none. integrity? see sales ability. [makes a "zero" hand gesture]

Name: jo
Line: and that's your unbiased opinion.

Name: gabe
Line: yes, it is.

Name: jo
Line: so it's not relevant that he took the receptionist away from you?

Name: gabe
Line: oh, jo. jo, i'm disappointed in you. some people let personal things into the workpl-. is she with him? because i thought that she was...

Name: jo
Line: gabe...ugh... you got all close to these people. got involved in their lives. let's get you back to florida. we'll figure out something for you.

Name: gabe
Line: that sounds like a promotion!

Name: jo
Line: it's not. let's get kelly in here to take his place.

Name: jim
Line: um... why kelly?

Name: jo
Line: 'cause gabe's tall and weak. she's short and strong. i'm doing an opposites thing.

Name: jim
Line: okay.

Name: jo
Line: how'd my girl nellie do?

Name: jim
Line: oh, i didn't know you knew her?

Name: jo
Line: she didn't mention it?

Name: jim
Line: no.

Name: jo
Line: integrity move. i like it.

Name: jim
Line: you know, she also gave me a reason to think that maybe she wasn't a good fit.

Name: jo
Line: well, i'm not saying you must hire her. if you find someone who's clearly a fit, then fine. just make sure they fit real good. no more manager turnover. don't mess this up, jim. and give dwight an interview. i like a little bit of crazy.

Name: erin
Line: [hiding under desk, raises a sock puppet up, talking in high-pitched voice] ahh!

Name: oscar
Line: erin, what are you doing?

Name: erin
Line: i've been turned into a puppet!

Name: oscar
Line: okay. [walks away]

Name: kevin
Line: [giggling, walks to erin's desk] look at the puppet! hi, puppet! who are you?

Name: erin
Line: i went to drop off the fedex forms and an evil witch named angela turned me into a puppet!

Name: kevin
Line: [giggles] yeah. low blow, puppet.

Name: erin
Line: and there's only one thing that can change me back into a real girl.

Name: kevin
Line: it's good. it's just that i wish the puppets would talk more about the alphabet. not for me... but, if any kids are watching... a, b, and so forth. you know,... m-n-l-o, p... f...

Name: erin
Line: [as sock puppet] i need the most special thing in the office.

Name: dwight
Line: silence?

Name: erin
Line: a date with the best salesman... andy bernard! [andy walks over to erin's desk]

Name: andy
Line: hey, erin.

Name: erin
Line: [gets up] oh.

Name: andy
Line: where'd you learn how to puppet like that?

Name: erin
Line: [shrugs] i've done it all my life.

Name: andy
Line: listen, i'm really flattered, but i don't think we should.

Name: andy
Line: erin's my best friend in this office, hands down, but... when she asked me out, i just didn't have that feeling, you know? [clip jumps ahead] aren't there some things that you really want to like, but you just can't... seem to like it, like, mad men... or football... [clips jumps ahead] let's not forget, erin chose gabe over me. that happened. i'm not going to apologize for getting over her, okay? i'm sorry. [clip jumps ahead] i would go for someone who's more... she's great, though.

Name: angela
Line: [loudly] stanley, i won't be able to invite everyone to the wedding, because we want to keep it to 350.

Name: stanley
Line: i'll get over it.

Name: angela
Line: i mean, we just have to see how many senators and members of congress want to attend, before we can open it up to regular people. pam, you know how you and jim did your ironic wedding? [pam looks confused] do you still have the plans for the dream wedding that you couldn't afford?

Name: pam
Line: that was our dream wedding.

Name: angela
Line: niagara falls? pregnant? that was your dream? pork medallions?

Name: pam
Line: [looks over at oscar, who is quietly watching this happen] i hope... you have a very beautiful wedding, angela.

Name: angela
Line: hmm.

Name: jim
Line: all right. name.

Name: dwight
Line: dwight schrute.

Name: jim
Line: thank you, mr. schnoot. [closes his binder] we will let you know.

Name: dwight
Line: you have to interview me...

Name: jim
Line: i just did. the answer to that one question told me everything i need to know.

Name: dwight
Line: i demand more questions!

Name: jim
Line: [ignoring dwight] all right, guys, good day, a lot of candidates. let's discuss.

Name: dwight
Line: okay! if you're not going to interview me, then i'll do it.

Name: jim
Line: yes.

Name: dwight
Line: what will be your first priority? i will have seven first priorities. safety, profits, fostering a community of self-reliance and entrepreneurship, listening, respect for human life, bolstering our public image, and... [chuckles] getting everyone home on time. dwight, let me be frank. in an accident that no one can blame you for, an antique gun was discharged while you were acting manager. how are we ever to trust you again? [whispering] that's a great question. [jim nods] i am going to institute a strict no-firearms policy for this office that extends to myself as well. wow. all of my concerns are disappearing.

Name: jim
Line: thank you, dwight.

Name: dwight
Line: thank you. [clears throat and gets up] you'll be hearing from us shortly, mr. schrute, and i think you're gonna like the call you're going to receive. [smiles] oh, come on. i'm just happy that i got this meeting. [leaves]

Name: jim
Line: well, that was quick.

Name: kelly
Line: [sighs] very, very interesting. and you know what? i'm impressed.

Name: jim
Line: he's not a real candidate.

Name: kelly
Line: i don't know, jim, 'cause, makes me think about something my grandfather used to say, which is that, sometimes, the hand that jumps out of the grave and grabs you around the throat; that is the hand that you want on the wheel.

Name: jim
Line: you took the deal.

Name: kelly
Line: yeah, it was a great deal.

Name: jim
Line: that's not okay.

Name: kelly
Line: i don't know. dwight seems like a great leader to me, and i look forward to the personal perks that he promised me privately. what do you think, toby?

Name: toby
Line: well, we could try him out for a little while... [jim drops his pen, looks exasperated] and if it doesn't work out, you know, maybe one of us could, you know, step in...

Name: jim
Line: what is happening right now?

Name: phyllis
Line: is it true that you're making dwight the manager?

Name: jim
Line: no, why would you think that?

Name: phyllis
Line: he and kelly said, then they pre-fired me.

Name: jim
Line: okay. [walks out of conference room] okay, guys, just so you all know, no decision has been made, and dwight is definitely not the boss.

Name: kelly
Line: that is correct. actually, dwight is not the manager yet.

Name: jim
Line: no, no, no. not ever, 'cause that's not gonna happen.

Name: dwight
Line: well, it's not entirely up to you, is it? seems to me like someone's getting a little power-mad.

Name: jim
Line: am i the only one who remembers what he did when he was in charge? i feel like i'm going a little bit crazy.

Name: andy
Line: tuna... you're completely sane.

Name: jim
Line: thank you.

Name: andy
Line: who do you like for the job? is there anyone who maybe was a little underwhelming at first, but now seems like a safe, if not slightly unexciting, choice?

Name: jim
Line: okay, seems like everybody has an opinion. so, who else? anybody?

Name: kevin
Line: do you mean it? anybody? are you sure?

Name: jim
Line: [while sighing] i suppose i am.

Name: kevin
Line: okay... well what do 'i' want in a manager?... let me see. [walks slowly across the office] what do 'i' want?...

Name: oscar
Line: i don't think he meant, that--

Name: kevin
Line: so now anyone gets to talk at any times?

Name: oscar
Line: go ahead.

Name: kevin
Line: what do 'i' want?... i'm looking for someone... who... [smiles] everyone is listening to me. [dwight looks at the camera, annoyed]

Name: oscar
Line: can i say...?

Name: jim
Line: yes.

Name: oscar
Line: i think it should be darryl.

Name: jim
Line: okay.

Name: dwight
Line: what a surprise! minorities sticking together.

Name: oscar
Line: kelly's on your side.

Name: kelly
Line: i'm sorry, is that all you think of me? a minority? i am so much more than that. i am a dancer, i'm a singer, i'm a fashion designer.

Name: andy
Line: whoever it is, i think they should be lame. [stanley shakes his head and rolls his eyes] kind a a non-threatening, moderate personality.

Name: ryan
Line: i want an outsider.

Name: jim
Line: perfect. there are several outside candidates that we think would be really-

Name: ryan
Line: no, i mean an outsider. like someone on the margins of society, who doesn't see things the way we do, like a homeless person.

Name: pam
Line: a homeless person. really? a homeless person.

Name: ryan
Line: no, you're right, pam, let's just leave him to the welfare system and let that handle it.

Name: pam
Line: no, i want you to say that you think the 'best' person to be our new manager is a homeless person.

Name: ryan
Line: let me guess who you want, pam. rachael ray? the ladies of the view?

Name: ryan
Line: i got away with... everything, under the last boss, and it wasn't good for me, at all. so, i want guidance. i want leadership. but don't just, like, boss me around, you know? like, lead me. lead me... when i'm in the mood... to be led.

Name: meredith
Line: i just want, for once, a smart, professional, decisive, well-hung man in his forties.

Name: jim
Line: hey! hey! hey!

Name: meredith
Line: okay, fine. uhh, the guy with a tiny penis. are you happy? [sarcastically] let's hire that guy! [jim looks speechless]

Name: andy
Line: she may have a point there... would a small penis work? small-to-moderate.

Name: gabe
Line: [walks in] gotta catch a plane.

Name: pam
Line: ohh, hey gabe, i'm sorry, we... we didn't get you a cake or anything. we're gonna miss you.

Name: gabe
Line: oh, well i'm still the corporate liaison to the branch.

Name: kelly
Line: you are not leaving without giving me a hug. [hugs gabe] ughh.

Name: gabe
Line: okay, you know what, you don't need to make that sound.

Name: kelly
Line: i'm sorry! you were just a lot bonier than i thought you were gonna be!

Name: gabe
Line: there are plenty of people who love touching me. [camera zooms to ryan, who looks at the camera, extremely skeptical] i'm a terrific hugger. i've been with a bunch of girls where that's basically all they want to do. i will see you all soon.

Name: kevin
Line: later, man.

Name: all
Line: [various] good luck! goodbye! good luck at your new job.

Name: ryan
Line: take care, man.

Name: dwight
Line: we're gonna miss you, gabe. [gabe leaves]

Name: andy
Line: [stands up] uh, listen up. listen up, ladies. i want the job. there, i said it. i'm educated. i'm capable. i like all of you... and i won't make any changes.

Name: erin
Line: i see it. [nods and smiles] i see it like i see a mountain that i'm standing in front of [voice cracks] and facing, and i'm like...

Name: phyllis
Line: yeah. [oscar looks confused] yeah, andy would be wonderful as boss. erin made a good point. [brushes erin's hair with her hand]

Name: phyllis
Line: no, we're not related. i got the call. but... i'll tell her some other day. [smiles]

Name: jim
Line: what about darryl? we can all agree that he's a stand-up guy, right?

Name: angela
Line: well, let me be clear. i only speak for myself, and not myself and the senator. i think we have some wonderful candidates, and there's a great, lively debate here, but let's think about-

Name: toby
Line: no, no,... no. sorry. we cut kevin off for the same thing. you have to have something to say, if you talk. [angela rolls her eyes and stops talking]

Name: kevin
Line: exactly.

Name: darryl
Line: [enters the office with his daughter, who runs in and hugs jim] jada, no, no, no, jada, what are you doing? [jim looks knowingly at the camera] oh. so sorry, guys. i hope my family didn't disrupt your meeting.

Name: jada
Line: daddy, are these the people who are making you manager?

Name: darryl
Line: [sighs] maybe, sweetheart. single dad. challenges.

Name: jada

Name: darryl
Line: okay, shush it. this was a mistake. let's go. [darryl and jada leave, ryan slowly shakes his head]

Name: phyllis

Name: jim
Line: i don't know. this conversation really got away from me.

Name: kelly
Line: i don't care. they can just vote.

Name: jim
Line: no, they can't. that's not how this is gonna work. [exhales] we're going in this room, we're going to have a meeting. we're gonna make a recommendation to jo, and she's gonna give you her recommendation on monday. okay? [to kelly and toby, as they re-enter the conference room] what the hell happened out there? [kevin tries to follow, but the door is closed on him]

Name: andy
Line: sometimes you hear about people failing upwards. i think i'm about to do that.

Name: nellie
Line: this job? oh, yeah, i'll get it. jo's an old friend. i think... i'm her best friend. she's not my best friend.

Name: darryl
Line: every day i have a blueberry muffin. today, i did not have a blueberry muffin. should have had the blueberry muffin... especially considering how incredibly superstitious i am.

Name: fred
Line: no, i've never been more sure of anything in my life. i will be the new boss of... [looks back to glance at lobby directory] vance refrigeration.

Name: merv
Line: honestly, i think i... i sabotaged myself. it's like i'm afraid of being happy. case in point... i was supposed to start another job today.

Name: robert
Line: [chuckles] i will get offered the job. that's a... call i've received many times. the slight hopefulness in their voice, the pregnant pause... while they wait to hear my response, and then... my response.

Name: finger lakes guy
Line: [geeky voice] i want the job. i really do. it's just, the rest of my family's in the finger lakes right now. i'm supposed to be in the finger lakes right now. i told them i was on a hike; snuck away to do this interview. i gotta get back pretty soon; they'll worry. people disappear in the finger lakes.

Name: dwight
Line: i will run this branch, or i will destroy this branch, or... [shrugs] i don't know. something always works out. [leaves]

Name: creed
Line: you remind me so much of my fourth-biggest client.

Name: pam
Line: [in high-pitched, damsel-like voice] is that right?

Name: creed
Line: i think you two should meet.

Name: pam
Line: well, okay!

Name: creed
Line: hey jordana! patch my ninth- and fourth-biggest clients together. [pam puts down phone and picks it back up]

Name: pam as "fourth-biggest client"
Line: [in a comedic male voice] hello!

Name: pam as "ninth-biggest client"
Line: [in high-pitched, damsel-like voice] hello!

Name: pam as "fourth-biggest client"
Line: hi, how are ya? [erin looks amused, stanley and phyllis look at pam, confused]

Name: pam as "ninth-biggest client"
Line: ohho! i'm good! don't you just love paper, and things about paper!

Name: pam as "fourth-biggest client"
Line: hey, are you single? this seems like a love connection to me!

Name: creed
Line: it's kismet!

Name: oscar
Line: oh, for godâ€™s sake. [notices erin planking on parking lot curb]

Name: oscar
Line: planking is a very stupid and dangerous trend. basically, you lie like a plank in weird places. thatâ€™s it. sometimes you get run over. welcome to the internet.

Name: erin
Line: planking is one of those things where, eh, you either get it or you donâ€™t.â  and i donâ€™t.â  but i am so excited to be a part of it.

Line: [exiting elevator] after you my good sir.

Name: dwight
Line: no, i insist.

Name: andy
Line: i insist.

Name: jim
Line: the search committee finally decided, after a lot of deliberation, on robert californiaâ€¦ for the manager position. who took one look around and left.â  he drove down to florida and convinced joe to make him ceo... ceo... her own job. he talked her out of her own job. and i donâ€™t really know how someone does that. but, anyway, then the position was his to fill.â â  and he choseâ€¦

Name: jim
Line: hey, so this isnâ€™t matching up with thisâ€¦and iâ€™m not sure which oneâ€™s right. can you just hunt down the original for me?

Line: yes. me do.

Name: jim
Line: alright.

Line: hey kev, what were you saying before about the paperwork?

Name: kevin
Line: me do it now.  go.  stop worry.

Name: pam
Line: kevin, do you feel ok?

Name: kevin
Line: me feel good.  body strong.  sleep big last night.

Name: pam
Line: yeah, i think we should get him to the hospital.

Name: jim
Line: yeah, alright kev why donâ€™t you come with us?

Name: oscar
Line: no, guys.

Name: angela
Line: no, heâ€™s fine.

Name: oscar
Line: heâ€™s fine.

Name: angela
Line: heâ€™s always been like that.

Name: pam
Line: no he hasnâ€™t.

Name: angela
Line: i mean, heâ€™s gotten worse over the yearsâ€¦.

Name: oscar
Line: heâ€™s making a statement. itâ€™s an ironic comment on our expectations of him.  a funhouse image of our model of kevin.

Name: kevin
Line: you keep think that.

Line: ....back orders and you never called them.

Name: oscar
Line: can you believe this?

Name: erin
Line: there's a dog in the car.

Name: jim
Line: [entering office] hey. so, we saw a new billboard.

Name: andy
Line: yeah? pretty cool, huh?

Name: andy
Line: what better way to announce our new slightly lower prices than with an ad campaign? and what better face for an ad campaign than our new regional manager?

Name: andy
Line: how'd it look?

Name: jim
Line: you've seen it, right?

Name: andy
Line: no.

Name: pam
Line: andy, somebody defaced it.

Name: andy
Line: what? [stanley enters office laughing] morning, stanley.

Name: jim
Line: there's this thing that people tend to do with billboards. how do i put this? if there's an opportunity for a graffiti artist to work in a... phallic shape, interacting with the artwork, it'll happen, and andy gave them that opportunity.

Name: andy
Line: erin, how long did we order those billboards for?

Name: erin
Line: six months.

Name: andy
Line: oh, god. i need you to call the billboard company.

Name: meredith
Line: [entering office] great billboard! funny, edgy, right up to the line without crossing it, loved it.

Name: andy
Line: which one did you see?

Name: jim
Line: okay, don't be gross.

Name: dwight
Line: [entering office] what's going on?

Name: pam
Line: somebody defaced the billboards we just put out in an inappropriate way.

Name: dwight
Line: oh, that's funny. wait, from the photo shoot with you and me?

Name: andy
Line: yeah, dwight.

Name: dwight
Line: no. no. no! no! no! no! no! no! [running from building] no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no! no! no! no! [stopping in front of defaced billboard] nooooooooo!

Name: dwight
Line: schrute farms is very easy to find, it's right in the middle of the root vegetable district. if the soil starts to get acidic, you've probably gone too far.

Name: ryan
Line: just give us the address. we'll look it up online.

Name: dwight
Line: it's simpler this way.

Name: oscar
Line: it's really not.

Name: andy
Line: now, stated arrival time is 3 p.m.

Name: kelly
Line: i don't get the reason for this party.

Name: phyllis
Line: yeah, what's the reason?

Name: kelly
Line: what's the reason, andy? what's the reason?

Name: andy
Line: it's just a garden party. sheesh.

Name: andy
Line: you don't need a reason to throw a garden party anymore than you need a reason to throw a birthday party. it's a garden party. you don't need a reason.

Name: andy
Line: few other super simple reminders â€“ no burping, no slurping, when eating take small bites and chew thoroughly with your mouth closed. yes, darryl?

Name: darryl
Line: what happens when we're done chewing? do we spit it out on the floor, or keep it in our mouths the rest of the time?

Name: andy
Line: i get it, i'm being a little overbearing. but i promise to be underbearing for a week if you guys just all... step it up.

Name: oscar
Line: andy, we understand basic table manners, we're not children.

Name: phyllis
Line: yeah, it's just a picnic.

Name: andy
Line: this is not a picnic, phyllis, it's a garden party.

Name: darryl
Line: there's a grill in the warehouse i could bring.

Name: andy
Line: aw, ew, please don't. not a barbecue. it's better than a barbecue. it's dignified, quieter, there are rules.

Name: pam
Line: how is that better than a barbecue?

Name: ryan
Line: what's the dress code on this?

Name: andy
Line: i'm glad you asked â€“ connecticut casual.

Name: stanley
Line: any chance connecticut casual is pennsylvania business, i.e. this is what i'm wearing to your party.

Name: andy
Line: guys, my family just threw a garden party to celebrate my brother's promotion. it was a huge success. check it out, there's a video online. heartwarming impromptu father-son duet. [video playing on computer]

Name: kevin
Line: yeah, oscar, you showed me this.

Name: darryl
Line: i've seen this, that's not you.

Name: meredith
Line: yeah, whoa, who's the sausage?

Name: andy
Line: it's my dad and my brother. i would have joined in but this melody doesn't really support another harmony part, so... check it out, that's my brother's boss. look how psyched he is, he's having an awesome time.

Name: jim
Line: ah, and did robert california get an invite to your party?

Name: andy
Line: yeah, of course. ye... i mean, uh, yeah, i think he did. [groans from the group]

Name: phyllis
Line: why didn't you just say this was to impress robert california?

Name: gabe
Line: i cannot believe that andy is throwing a party like this just to impress the ceo. classic gabe move. hey andy, how about you don't steal my business strategies, and i won't dress like my life is just one long brunch?

Name: andy
Line: see you all there at 3 p.m., connecticut casual, remember your manners, and have a wonderful time.

Name: dwight
Line: and please refer to the map, stay off of the web. thank you.

Name: jim
Line: [pointing to computer monitor] so, we've typed in the address, now let's take a look at the street view. [picture of dwight and mose on a see-saw]

Name: dwight
Line: they don't warn you when the cameras are driving by.

Name: jim
Line: ah. why do you keep reading that garden party book? i mean, how hard are finger sandwiches and tea?

Name: dwight
Line: there's so much more to it than that.

Name: dwight
Line: i've been wanting schrute farms to break into the high-end event hosting industry for some time, and this party is a great opportunity. plus, i've got a secret weapon. [holds up book, throwing a garden party by james trickington] only one copy in the world and some sucker on the internet sold it to me for two dollars. [laughs]

Name: jim
Line: i'm actually really disappointed in how poorly my book is doing. [holds up same book] i've only sold one copy.

Line: is there anything you wish you had done differently to avoid cankles?

Line: nope.

Line: phillip?

Name: pam
Line: oh, oh my gosh. yes, but don't, don't say anything, okay? it's after my grandfather.

Name: angela
Line: phillip is the name that we're using. it's after my favorite cat.

Name: pam
Line: [giggling] oh, wow. funny. it's after my grandfather.

Name: angela
Line: it's after my cat.

Line: ooh, that sounds great.

Line: sure.

Line: i'm the valet. you have to give me your car.

Line: i'm the... i'm the valet. you have to give me your car.
